Bel Normande is light, delicious and dances accross the tongue, lights up your taste buds and brings about the celebration we enjoy.  We've looked everywhere and found nothing to compare.  Don't forget to try both the Peach and the Raspberry!
Pocky is the best snack food every. I just got some of this and I am about to order more!

This is indeed wonderful stuff, and this is a great brand. However, it has better uses than serving directly with meat. For a start, it doesn't really go with strong game or red meat: it is better with goose, turkey, duck or guinea fowl (or maybe squab...). However, it makes a much nicer accompaniment if you whisk it into the roasting juices with a little wine, port or sherry and serve it as a sauce, rather than spooning it straight onto the plate. It is perhaps best used in baking, in coffee gateaux and chocolate or chestnut tortes, and in the traditional French Buche de Noel. If you're feeling decadent, try a little with rice pudding (a novel way to confuse the traditionalist British and irritate the purist French all at the same time). I particularly like using it as part of a glaze or garnish for carrots or roast parsnips, and it can be good mashed into swede, of all things. Jane Grigson has a very strange recipe for a dessert with raw carrot and this stuff, which is excellent, if you're adventurous. However, it is very rich, and depending on what you want to do with it (baking tends to use larger amounts), this container might be too big for you, and once it's opened you might find yourself desperately trying to use up the wretched stuff before it goes off. However, necessity is the mother of invention, and at least it stimulates your creative talents.

column13: Salt... if it's so bad, why do salt tablets exist....
column14:

Celtic Salt can test well... but is not always a good product...
There is the theory that vets give cows salt licks as farmers have to keep their cattle healthy... they can't afford lots of medicines...
Books like YOUR BODY'S MANY CRIES FOR WATER... also talk about salt...
Regular grocery store brands and most health food store brands test weak on people...
Keep Your Health Balanced with lots of water and enough salt... the right salt...

column13: Delicious, Fresh Ground Coffee Imported From Belgium!
column14:
Douwe Egberts makes some of the most delicious European coffee. When the Senseo Single Serve Coffee Maker was created, these single use, disposable coffee 'pods' fit together like hand in glove. 5,000,000 European coffee lovers cannot be wrong...Senseo Douwe Egberts is outstanding, fresh tasting coffee, and each imported 4 pack, (72 Single-Serve pods), comes attractively packaged in a resealable pouch.
Medium roast is apt to be a particular favorite for American coffee tastes. It has a rich, full-bodied flavor, neither bitter nor astringent. The Senseo coffee machine can make 1 4 oz cup, 2 4 oz cups, or a single 8 oz cup at a time. The self-contained pods use a tea bag filter-type paper and are approximately 2" in diameter.
Right now, the price averages 25 cents per 4 ounce cup. The Senseo makes it with a bit of frothe on the top, and this medium roast coffee is fine straight up, or try it with a little sweetner and a dollop of Hazelnut creamer as I do.
I do envision the price point coming down a bit, as the Senseo system becomes the US equivalent of the European sensation. Douwe Egberts recommends using your pods within 2 weeks, however, I've had good luck storing the extras in the freezer section of my refrigerator with no dicernable flavor change.

The Economist is one of the finest news/business magazines out there. I use to subscribe to three other such periodicals but this smart, timely, and utterly competent publication has weeded them all out. Highly recommended for those who believe in substantiated reason instead of dogmatic emotion.

column13: Lyle's Golden Syrup can substitute for corn syrup
column14:
I am allergic to corn, so eating marshmallows, candy, pecan pie etc. without being able to have corn syrup is a real problem.
The Lyle's Golden Syrup, which is made from cane sugar syrup, can be used as a substitute for corn syrup. It doesn't taste quite the same, though very good. So I think, if one calls the pecan pie made from Lyle's Golden Syrup sugar pecan pie, for instance, it will be very satisfying as its own thing instead of a substitute for pecan pie.
To me, it seems a little sweeter than corn syrup.

Take any positive reviews of this product with a huge grain of salt!
It's amazing that people are suckered into buying this product. The active ingredients listed on the package are "Anas Barbariae Hepatis Et Cordis Extractum 200 CK HPUS" For most folks unfamiliar with Latin, that sounds like it's gotta be some miracle drug, right? Here's the true story.
Since 1925, Oscillococcinum has been prepared as follows. Into a one litre bottle, a mixture of pancreatic juice and glucose is poured. Next a Barbary duck (that's the "Anas Barbariae") is decapitated and 35 grams of its liver and 15 grams of its heart are put into the bottle (that's the "Hepatis Et Cordis"). After 40 days in the sterile bottle, liver and heart disintegrate into a kind of goo, which is then diluted with water into the entire world production of Oscillococcinum for the year.
There's no logical reason to believe that anything in duck liver or heart will be an effective flu remedy. But even if there were some magic substance, the manufacturing process guarantees that it will not be in the finished product. The laws of chemistry indicate that after the 12th dilution, it is unlikely that a single molecule from the original organs will remain. Moreover, at the dilutions that Boiron indicates on their packaging (that's the "200 CK HPUS" part) the concentration of the original substance would be 1 part in 100^200, which is a 1 followed by 400 zeroes. A 1 followed by 100 zeroes is called a googol. The estimated number of particles in the universe that we can see is a googol, give or take a few zeroes. So in order for one of the original duck molecules to be present in a container of Oscillococcinum, the mass of that container would have to be about a googol googol googol times our world, which would be incomprehensibly larger than the visible universe.
A little research is all it takes to discover that there isn't a SINGLE reputable scientificstudy demonstrating the efficacy of this product. And even assuming that the "active ingredients" (duck heart and liver) have any effect on the flu, remember that by spending your $16 on a container of goose liver pate and crackers, you'll be a dose of duck organs that's billions of times stronger than what goes into this so-called "drug". All things considered, your money is better invested in a flu shot BEFORE flu season starts.

column6: Lee Kum Kee Sauce for Spicy Garlic Eggplant
column14: This sauce is terrific.  Its both sweet, and a little bit spicy, and it makes it really easy to make great eggplant.  You just blanche the eggplant until tender, throw in the sauce, and you're done!

I got hooked onto The Economist magazine approximately a decade ago. The weekly has since been staple reading for me and believe it or not, when I do not have time to read the local newspapers in any detail, The Economist more than make up for this in its wide news coverage. It is a constant companion on my daily subway rides and yes, each article is short, succinct and not to mention, extremely well-written. There is the occasional biasness in a few of its articles but generally, it is a far more objective newsmagazine than what you will normally find in other weeklies. The Surveys are extremely good with a wide range of topics. That also provides food for thought and discussion. Overall, the magazine has improved from its past dowdy appearance to one that is more colorful and snazzier without compromising on quality. I tried to wean myself off the magazine twice but eventually missed it so much that I resumed my subscription for blocks of 3 years !

column13: Best current affairs writing in English. 5 stars not enough.
column14:
Sadly in America have no weekly news magazine that comes within miles of The Economist. This magazine has been around for over 150 years, and the experience shows.
I have been a subscriber for 25 years. My college political science professor declared "The Economist has better intelligence than the CIA". I picked up a copy and have been a loyal subscriber since. I challenge anyone to read a few issues at a local library and then pick up Time or Newsweek and marvel at the difference in content, style, and perspective. You won't go back.
It is true that the magazine is conservative in the classical sense, but this perspective is in no way limiting. It's ok for a magazine to have a point of view. The writing is tight, intelligent and aimed at thinking adults. The analysis is first rate.
The regular "surveys" are a treat. These are in-depth collections of articles on a particular country or other topic (such as technology). Beyond the current affairs reporting, the Arts and Science sections very often contain information I don't see elsewhere for a year. The weekly obituary often illustrates the life of someone you haven't heard of, in the process introducing you to a previously unknown slice of history or art.
The Economist simply has no equal! Read it and liberate yourself from mediocre journalism. Life is too short to read Newsweek.

I have been using the Senseo for some time now and I realy can not live without it anymore. It changed my life!!
You have to try it now!

column6: Starbucks Ground Coffee, Sumatra, 16-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)

Sumatra would probably be my second choice. It is full of flavor and it has somewhat of a french taste to it except more earthy. Great choice if you are looking for a diffrent dark blend to try. Highly recomended.

column13: This was one of my favorites as a child
column14: I grew up eating Sap Sago as a child. I grew up in Chicago in an area full of German Import Deli's and this cheese is wonderful. Typically you grate the cheese (which is why often this cheese is also known as "Reibekaese" or grating cheese), and then you mix the grated cheese with butter or margerine before spreading it on bread or crackers. This allows you to control how "herby" your final cheese is. Adding a lot of Sap Sago to a little butter makes for a very sharp tasting cheese, less Sap Sago, of course, makes it milder,  but its always full of flavor.

column13: So Happy to Find this again!!! Great Coffee Maker!!!!!
column14: This little gadget makes the best coffee (read about it long ago in a Tony Hillerman novel, and what do you know!, it really was as good as Joe Leaphorn said!).  Anyway, I've had a couple of these for twenty years and broke one.  I have been searching high and low for years to find a replacement.  I'm so happy to be able to buy it again and now I can get extras for gifts.  People are always so surprised when they taste the coffee. column6: Premium Jumbo Maryland Hard Crabs (Live), 1 Dozen
column14: I've been eating fresh crab my whole life and this is the best I've ever had. Blue crabs are smaller than our Dungeness, but they make up for it in taste. The people at the Crab Place are very helpful and friendly. I will be ordering from them again very soon.

I have tried many teas in my life , & this by far has gone over the top with me ... I have tried 4 different flavors , all of which were very satisfying. The one I liked best is Tazo Chai , it has a spice flavor that just captivates the taste buds . It may not be for every one , but since I like the taste & smell of exotic spices , this does very well for me . I will buy it & keep it on hand as much as possible..

column13: the best coffee in the world
column14: this kona ground is the best i have tasted.it has great flavor.love drinking this coffee it has the sweetest flavor .so you dont have to put sugar in it or cream.has a wonderful aroma especially in the morning its an eye opener and a great way to start the day. if you want great coffee this is the one to drink.and bieng from hawaii it like drinking paradice

I bought this machine for my desk at work and it's...well... a jelly belly dispensing machine. It's made out of a decent weight metal, like the old gum ball machines, and works as you'd expect.
There is only one problem. The machine has the habit of "catching" the jelly bellys as you turn the crank and you end up getting a mangled jb or a partial jb. Seems like the internal mechanism could have been engineered to prevent crushing or damaging the jelly bellys. I'd say one out of every 20 jbs end ups getting crushed or cut up on average.
As a result, the chute where you retrieve the candy can get messy from all the damaged jelly belly shards.
My only other minor complaints would be that it only dispenses 2-3 jelly bellys at a time (although this could be a blessing considering how addictive the jbs can get), and the chute to retrieve the jbs is a little small making it difficult to fish out the candy with adult fingers.

If you've ever made your own raspberry puree, you will appreciate this product! No food mill or strainer required, no piles of goopy raspberry seeds, and no stains on your hands or countertop! Just smooth, delicious puree right from your freezer. The product quality is excellent!
I've ordered this product several times before directly from The Perfect Puree, and was delighted to find out that it is now being offered through Amazon.com. Check out the Perfect Puree website for recipes!
When I First Bought This It Was Huge!There Were So Many Nerds!Man I Just Bought A Couple More.I Just Keep Wanting More, I Give It Two Thumbs Up!!!

column6: Starbucks Whole Bean Coffee, French Roast, 16-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)
column14: So far ive tried the breakfest blend, columbian, sumatra, verona, winter blend, house blend and a special christmas blend they had one year which was diffrent and had a spicyness to it and im looking forward to trying all the blends eventually but out of all of them ive tried so far the French roast has to be my favorite- probably between the french and winter blend. The french roast has an excellent taste and is deep dark beans and a smooth smoky taste. Absolutely delicious and smells great to. I would recomend this if you love dark coffee with alot of taste. Excellent and highly Recomended. A+

While living in South Africa we used to buy this original chutney.  Now we are in Canada, and were delighted to find it in a small shop on Vancouver Island.   We have been using it ever since, and prefer this chutney to all others.  It is sweet and not too spicy and goes with many foods.  We use it with rice dishes and other entrees, and it is seldom off our dining table.

Wow! Being from Texas I have longed for a wonderful tasting BBQ sauce. If you are looking for flavor with a smooth and spicy kick, you picked the right sauce.
Great job B-man!
This tea is subtley intoxicating.  It's sweet, but not too sweet, gentle and full of body. It's incredible. A must try.

column13: Best coffee I've tasted. I try others but always come back.
column14: If you like a strong but smooth flavorful coffee this is it. I have tried others and just keep coming back to this one. My second joice would be the Starbucks Italian blend.

column6: Hapi Hot Wasabi Peas - Wasabi Coated Green Peas (4.9 oz. can)
column14: I saw these at a 7-11 and decided to try them.  I am always tring new things.  After eating a few I couldn't stop until the can was gone.  Went back to 7-11 and bought the only other can they had.  I have been stopping at every 7-11 I pass to look for them.  No luck though so I searched the web.  I shop a lot on Amazon but never thought about finding Wasabi Peas here.  Shipping and handling a bit high for a 1.99 can so I will keep searching.  Love these things.

column13: Best coffee I have ever had from Douwe Egberts....
column14:
I have been drinking Douwe Egberts red label coffee for about 4 years now and the last time I was in Holland visiting friends I had a taste of Senseo Crema Dark Roast... I love this coffee... It is a fantastic blend and is so easy to make a cup of the coffee...
Last year I was given the Senseo Coffee maker and spent the money to have a special outlet installed in my kitchen and the plug changed on the coffee maker so I could enjoy it... I would not pass on this coffee ever.. It is adictive, it is that good...
Buy this coffee maker and this Dark Roast blend and you will see what I mean... It is well worth the money...
Also for those who didn't like the coffee, remember to read the instructions carefully because you first have to run clear water thru the Senseo before you use it.... It adds to the flavor of the coffee and prepares the maker for use... If I could I would rate this with 10 stars...

column6: Hickory Smoked Beef Strips - 12 oz Cracked Pepper
column13: Moist, flavorful, quite possibly the best jerkey I've ever h
column14: This jerkey is soft and chewy.  Loaded with spices, and just enough black pepper.  I'm planning on going to the garywest.com website and getting the jerkey-a-month subscription so I get a different flavor and style of jerkey every month!

column6: Sampler Pack - Low Carb Chocolate from Ross Chocolates
column14: This sampler pack contained a great flavor assortment.  The quality and flavors of the chocolate bars were good.  I was a bit disappointed in the quality of the packaging and shipping container.  I bought this item as a gift and it did not come in gift-ready packaging.  I had to repack the chocolates before they could be wrapped.

column6: Tea, Sleepytime Extra w/Valerian, Chamomile Mint Flavor, 20 ct.
column14: I work very early (4am) and have a hard time getting to sleep.  I have used the regular Sleepytime tea and it helps me to unwind, so I thought I would give this one a try. . .what a help!  I not only unwind, I fall asleep easily and stay asleep all night without the annoying groggieness the next morning.  Just be sure to sip it at least an hour prior to your usual bedtime.  The only downfall is, I can only find it online.  Wish my local stores would carry it.

column6: Mighty Leaf Tea Assortment, 15 Tea Pouches
column14: I drink tea regularly and I love Earl Grey.  Recently I turned up my nose at the thought of having to drink Earl Gold at Il Fornaio instead of Earl Grey.  How foolish of me.  Mighty Leaf's Earl Gold is fantastic- I can hardly wait to try the rest of the line.  Packaged in an individual silk pouch, this product brews sensationally.  Try it- you won't be disappointed.

Yes, summer's coming. Rather than drinking tea as sweet as breakfast cereal, consider this:
Take glass, fill with ice, pour in limeade. Add shot of cherry syrup, then stir, shake or swizzle until content.

Cooks Illustrated didn't give a good review of their chicken stock for CI's chicken broth article. My opinion is that More Than Gourmet's products ([...]) are better for fortifying pan sauces, not so much for a broth or a soup. I use redi-base ([...] that (or homemade stock). It is excellent if used for a pan sauce, a little goes a long way, but their larger 16oz size is harder to come by. Well worth the money.
The best buy for the $$. I can't keep enough of the BBQ sauce and Jerk Mustard in the house.  Family and friends love it.  The blackened season is great on fish or to spice up a salad.

In short, I've had better. While tasty, it wasn't sublime perfection, and what else would we want a toffee for?
I would consider buying again, but will also continue looking for that evasive toffee of the gods.

This ain't some fancy ketchup like other BBQ sauces.  Packed full of flavor.  Ordering and shipping went smoothly.  No hassles.  I recommend the Sampler Set to get the Jerk Mustard too.  Awesome taste and great for the bbq season.
The blackened seasoning adds great flavor to our Friday fish meals.  Even the kids love it.
This product really packs a punch full of flavor.  Spicy mustard look out, this stuff is great.  I recommend getting the sampler set to taste BBQ sauce and blackened seasoning too.

True demi glace takes 3 days to make: Day one, make brown veal stock. Day two, make Sauce Espagnole while reducing the veal stock. Day three, combine stock with sauce, strain protiens and reduce even further. There is only one reason to go through such a laborious procedure: IT'S WORTH IT!
Or it used to be worth it. More Than Gourmet makes a demi that will hold its own in any Pepsi Challenge versus home made. The company also sells it in a pint container, and has many other excellent products.

column6: Senseo Douwe Egberts Mild Roast Coffee Pods, 18-Count 4.41-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)
column13: BEST COFFEE EVER (Starbucks will take a back seat)
column14:
Incredible flavor of Europe in America. This is honestly great coffee and a treat at anytime during the day. It is a pod and therefore you are not wasting a pot of coffe but enjoying one cup at a time. WE LOVE this coffee! It is rich in flavor, and one of the greatest treasures you can give yourself everyday!
A MUST for the coffee lovers of the world!
We were Doughe Egbert users in Holland 15 years ago and currently today. DELIGHTED TO SEE IT IS AVAILABLE STATESIDE!

This product adds superb flavor to any meat. Great on steaks, pork, fish and chicken. Makes the best hot wings! Also great to inject into turkey and deep frying the turkey. Try it on catfish, shrimp, crab, lobster! Brings out the best of flavor.

column6: Burt's Bees Avocado Butter Pre-Shampoo Hair Treatment 4.34 oz
column14: I have color treated hair and wanted something that wouldnt ruin my hair further. This was the best conditioner I've ever used.The longer I left in, the better it worked.My hair was soft and smooth after every use.The only problem was it comes in small tubes, so I needed a longer lasting supply. Other than that, it was something I will use again.

column14: Ate my first jar of these about 6 months ago nad have been addicted ever since...you have to try them!!

column6: Pemmican, Fruit 'N Nut, 3.75 oz., package of 12
column13: Pemmican is the stuff the original settlers & indians ate
column14: Pemmican might be accurately described as the original "power bar." It doesn't digest as easily as say, for example, a modern power bar, but it does have a long & glorious history extending back into the ages.  There are certainly those who say "if it was good enough for our ancestors, and helped make us the great people we are today, it's good enough for us today!"  Imho pemmican does have its place.  A great paper to read about it is entitled "Experiments in Pemmican Preparation," which apparently appeared in the Journal of the Saskatchewan Archaeological Society.  It definitely read like a pretty scholarly paper...and talk about a classic title for a paper!  For those who "just want to know," that's the paper to read it seems.

column6: La Piana Golden Seal Traditional Balsamic Vinegar of Modena, 3.4 Fluid Ounces
column14:
I purchased this product at a little shop in Venice last year. I had been looking everywhere for a "traditional" bottle. This is simply heaven over ice cream or cheese. I use this for very special occasions and it has never disappointed.
The packaging includes some very nice recipes and other serving suggestions.

column6: Tea, Canadian Vanilla Maple, Black, Decaf, 20 ct.
column13: This will have you hooked in under 30 seconds!!!!!!
column14: I have been searching for this tea for five long years!!!  A friend served me the caffeinated version at a party and sadly I only ran out and bought one box.  If I had known the tea would virtually disappear off the face of the earth I would have bought the store out.  This tea is perfect by itself and absolutely delectable with cream and honey.  It's all you need for dessert.  The maple and vanilla combine for a smooth rich taste.  My husband accidentally served my last tea bag to company and I thought I would die.  But once again Amazon.com has come through with its magnificent selection.

column6: Less Salt, Less Oil Popcorn Kit - 40 Pack
column14: I've used this product for a number of years, I was glad when they came out with the less salt less oil.  Still there is too much oil I cut it in half and use it with popcorn I buy at Costco.  I also cut the salt this is really salty if I use all the salt that comes with the package.

column6: Aunt Lizzie's Zero Carb Cheese Straw Bites - 20 oz Tin
column14: I am a native Memphian and familiar with Aunt Lizzie.  Aunt Lizzie has outdone herself with these crunchy delicious cheese straws.  You must try them!  Well worth it for your favorite low carber!
GREAT CHIPS ALTHOUGH THEY ARE HARD TO FIND IN ANY GROCERY

column6: Tazo Green Ginger Tea, 24 Tea Bags
column14: An incredibly refreshing drink when iced! Mix in a teaspoon of honey while your tea is warm and then pour over a generous amount of ice. Because of the ice, use two bags and steep for three minutes or more depending on your taste. You will be pleasantly surprised!

column6: Starbucks Espresso Roast Whole Bean Coffee, Two (2) 16-Ounce FlavorLock Bags (2 Pounds Total)
column13: Haven't tried them all, but this is the best so far!
column14: We received an espresso machine for Christmas and I am fast becoming a latte addict. I have purchased a few different types of espresso beans and these Starbucks beans have been the best. Cup after cup, it has been smooth and tasty, not bitter like some. It's a bit more expensive than grocery brands, but well worth it for the taste.

column6: Coombs Family Farms 100% Pure Organic Maple Syrup Grade A Dark Amber, 32-Ounce Jug
column14:
I have had products from the Coombs farm in my pantry for years. This is what Maple Syrup tastes like. This is the best Maple syrup I know of. I use the Grade B for cooking (it has a stronger flavor that withstands cooking) - everything from breads to cookies and glazes.
This Grade A syrup is wonderful with anything, but I love just a tsp or two with real oatmeal. I hear that some people make "Mapletinis" out of this syrup and vodka, but I can't say that I have tried one.

These little "gummies", taste like apple. They're also shaped like hearts. I think they're pretty good. When the individually wrapped packages say "SUPER JUICY" - they're not kidding - they really *ARE*! (All "gummy" are juicy !)
Try them! I'm sure you'll like them !

column6: Rienzi Imported Peeled Tomatoes - 28 oz can
column14: These tomatoes are fine.  But they are also available in your standard grocery store (such as ShopRite) for $0.75 to $1.25

column6: Tea, Egyptian Licorice, Part Organic, 16 ct.
column14: This is an excellent dessert or snack tea. It's sweet, yet low cal and excellent for the throat. It would be most helpful for singers and public speakers, or just anyone who loves a sweet, gentle tea.

This is the perfect bedtime tea. It's relaxing, but it doesn't make you feel out of it or woosie like a lot of over the counter sleeping pills. It isn't addictive. It's good for when you're a bit tense or just too awake around the time you need to be getting read to go to bed.

column13: More "spice" than cocoa, but I love it.
column14: Although this doesn't taste exactly like hot cocoa, it is a very good tea. The subtle hint of chocolate along with the slight kick of caffeine make for the perfect afternoon tea or early evening tea. A favorite of mine.

I just got the senseo coffee machine and it came with the medium and light coffee. I ordered the dark myself. I much prefer the dark. Its richer and has a fuller body. Its stronger. If you like stronger coffee this is the one for you.
I also tried to double up the medium blend. While this was better it still wasnt as good as the dark.

column6: Organic Passion Plum, Loose Tea and Teabags
column14: Harney & Sons Organic Passion Plum is an excellent way to ease out of caffeine addiction.  Although it won't keep you awake like caffeine, it prevents the headaches that most people encounter with quiting. Be sure to preheat the cup to maximize the ginseng, steep at least five minutes, and above all, enjoy!
Loved the tea.  I mix 1/4 chai tea with 3/4 milk over ice and it is refreshing and delicious!

column6: Michael's Frozen Custard Variety Pack, 6 Pints
column14:
I highly recommend Michael's Frozen Custard. I went to graduate school in Madison and LOVED their frozen custard. I was excited to see it on Amazon and ordered the 6 pint variety pack. It's the same great stuff I remember. Let it sit outside the freezer to thaw for about 20 minutes to get the smooth creamy texture.
Thanks for carrying this product, I will definately order again as nothing comes close to this in California!

I just got the new Senseo coffeemaker and it's been a hit in our office.  The dark roast coffee is just that, and I recommend it for those who like a hearty brew.  My only gripe is that the dark roast definitely tastes like Columbian coffee -- I'd like to see a variety of blends, not just a variety of coffee strengths.  I'm also buying some of the Melitta pods to see if they work with the Philips coffeemaker.
Product was shipped in a timely fashion.  Product received in excellent condition.  Great gift item for those people that love to barbeque.  My family loves this as an all occasion gift.

column6: Sierra Club Coffee Certified Organic Fair Trade Certified Shade Grown 12 oz. Whole Beans
column14: if you like chocolate and good coffee, this is the one.  Not flavored.  Naturally chocolatey!

column13: Feels like BBC minus the anti-american bias
column14:
Absolutely wonderful. The articles are clear and insightful. I have been expanding my vocabulary immensely because they do not write down to the lowest denominator reading their magazine.
It has a BBCish feel of openness, delight, and wonder mixed with British humor. But don't let that fool you. It is there meerly to cheer up some of the most thoughtful and thorough analysis of economics, politics, foreign affairs, and anything else important affecting the world. The magazine is weekly, so articles are timely as well.
Their credibility is impeccable. There is no discernable bias in my opinion, save a pro free market stance. This is very appealing in a world where I cannot even think of another news source of which I believe to be politically unbiased.
The recent train bombings in Madrid were an issue on which I wanted to see the Economist's take. Conservatives are claiming Spain is appeasing terrorism, while liberals are defending Spain as exercising its democrat free rights to choose its government... and of course, as is the standard today, neither are willing to give an inch on their positions. The Economists response was the typical, yet satsifying, "Well, on the one hand..."

I like all of Muir Glen's organic salsas. They taste of fresh ingredients, and sweeteners are not to be found. When they say "mild," "medium" or "hot," you can trust them. The roasted tomato flavor has a pleasant "thereness" in the chipotle version.  The cilantro is also discernible.  Exacting foodies may be disappointed that the chipotle presence is achieved by the combination of jalapenos and natural smoke flavoring (a barley malt product), rather than, apparently, peppers that have been smoked over wood chips.  Those for whom chipotle means fiery may not appreciate the "medium" level of heat in this product.
If you like corn syrup, this is the best available anywhere.

column6: Aunt Lizzie's Zero Carb Cheese Straw Bites - 20 oz Tin
column13: YUMMY YUMMY , BUT SPICY AS ALL GETOUT!!
column14: GREAT STUFF, BUT KEEP A SUGAR FREE SODA OR LOW CARB BEER HANDY, BECAUSE YOU WILL NEED 'EM!!

I have never been so impressed with any service, until now!Purchasing from Marketspice was a delightful experience! I ordered their great tea, and just two days later received my package, just as fresh as promised!! The lovely ladies and gentlemen at Marketspice should be so very proud of themselves for the great service and attention they have given to their customers for so many years! Great job!! Keep up the EXCELLENT and VERY impressive work!

column13: A very nice break -- Green Tea
column14: I was visiting a friend in Colorado who introduced me to this green tea.  It has excellent flavor and the citrus highlights perfectly complement the green tea flavor.  I have given a bag or two to friends when they have seen me drinking it and 100% have enjoyed it.  A couple are now converts and that's great when I run out, I can borrow a tea bag now and then.  Each teabag will make 10 to 16 ounces of tea so you will get more than 30 cups from a box.  I use a small teapot or a large mug with one teabag and it work perfect.

column13: I am on the Atkins Diet and Crabtree Foods was cheaper
column14: I bought the salmon from Crabtree Foods because it was cheaper than the others. Little did I know that I actually got a good value. The product was as described and fit perfectly into my diet. I strongly recommend it.

column6: Crabtree Foods; Shrimp Gone Wild!! 5lbs Jumbo Shrimp and 5lbs Peeled Popcorn Shrimp
column14: I ordered this combo not knowing much about popcorn shrimp. We breaded them and my kids loved them. The jumbo shrimp we also very good on the grill. Thank you Crabtree Foods

The oil has excellent flavor in all baked goods and provides delicate flavor for sauteed items. I use it for baking muffins and quick breads as well as baking powder biscuits and cookies. I also use it for sauting onions, mushrooms, garlic or peppers.

column6: Sencha Kyoto Cherry Rose Festival, Gourmet Green Tea by Paper Street Teas - 4oz.
column14: I loved this tea. It's naturally sweet and the rose petals give it a great look and smell.
This was by far the best genmaicha tea I have ever had!

I don't know much about coffee but I saw this on Amazon and thought I'd take a chance and give it a try.  WoW!  I don't think I could ever go back to Starbucks.  It is really strong but with no bitterness.  I have a friend who knows a few things about coffee and she was really impressed.  I totally recommend this product.

column6: Cashew Butter, Smooth, Raw, No Salt, 16 oz.
column14: This stuff tastes so good! It makes a good topping for ice cream (or in my case, the non-dairy equivalent). But beware, it may be habit-forming!

column6: Old Fashioned Candy Sticks Horehound [80CT Box]
column14: This Item is so profanley disgusting that I would not even bother to give this item a star.

column6: Breads from Anna, Gluten Free Bread Mix, Soy Rice and Nut Free, 19oz
column13: The Best Gluten Free Bread Mix!
column14: There is no gluten free bread out there like this. This is truly one of a kind. The texture is like normal bread! The taste is like normal bread! Make the mix for a pizza crust and you will love it! I am a Manna from Anna pizza crust junkie! Or make hamburger buns from the mix- you will really like how great they taste. I can't say enough about it!

I have been in love with the taste of Market Spice tea since a trip to visit some of my family in Seattle when I was in college, 21 long years ago. I had to depend on gifts from them or when I would visit for my supply. It became a tradition for my sister, sister-in-law, my mom, and I to have Market Spice tea at our family Christmas party each year. It makes the whole house smell wonderful and nothing beats the slightly sweet, spicy taste. I am so glad Amazon has it available now and I can get some any time, especially since I have gotten several of my friends hooked on it too. Although I no longer have to make my supply last I do have a tip. If not used within 6-8 months the tea will get a bitter taste. However I have started storing my tea bags in the refrigerator or freezer and they last a year or longer. However, once you try this tea you'll want to brew all of it up long before then.

column6: Brew-in-Mu g Tea Mug with Lid and Infuser - White
column14: This is the very best infuser mug I have found. It is good for work where space is limited. Simply put the leaves in the infuser and steep, then rest the leaves on the lid while you drink the mug of tea. It is easy to clean up. Dump the leaves, rinse the infuser and that it !
We ordered shrimp from Crabtree Foods and I was very happy with the order. We will be ordering again. I have never tasted shrimp like that before. It arrived on time and was delicious!

Forced by the school's debate coach, I unwillingly waded through every magazine/news source I could get my hands on.  After awhile I realized the magazine that I would always come back to was The Economist.  The information is comprehensive and has a relatively objective outlook.  Also I feel like I am getting both sides of the issues, sometimes it feels as though it has a conservative slant and others it feels more liberal.  If you would like to get away from the lurid publications such as Time and Newsweek get The Econommist.  It is hard to be disappointed by it.

column13: Typical Greek Cheese from the Island of Crete
column14: Myzithra is a greek cheese come from the island of Crete.

column6: Hawaiian Kona Blend - Ground Coffee for 1 Pot
column13: Hawaiian Kona Blend is the best!
column14: I first tried the Sampler Black Mountain and all the coffees are excellent but the Hawaiian Kona Blend is the best. I also like the fact that the coffee comes in individual packages.  The coffee stays much fresher that way and it is more convenient than grinding beans.

column6: No Sugar Added Dark Chocolate Bars - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates
column13: So Yummy You'll Think You're Cheating
column14:
Low carb chocolates have come a looooong way, baby. Ross Chocolates Dark tastes great - you almost can't believe that it's low carb. The sensual yet bold dark flavor is completely intact. The texture I find is smoother than standard dark chocolates and, yet, I rather like it better that way.
I like to freeze my chocolates and break them off into chunks as needed. Totally yummy. I'll also break off pieces to eat with low-carb ice cream. A real treat there.
I purchased several of the other flavors of Ross Chocolates for my husband's birthday. He practically inhaled them all. He gave a piece to our chocolate-loving 7 year old niece who enthusiatically ate it and gave it her seal of approval.
The only potential drawback is that it's a bit pricey. But if you need a chocolate fix while on a low-carb diet, this chocolate (or any other of Ross's flavors) will definitely help you. You'll feel like your cheating, but your not.
Warning: Don't eat too much at one sitting. It can have a laxative effect. You've been warned. :-)

Tamale Molly tamales are absolutely delicious -- moist, flavorful and really easy to prepare.  I served the tamales as a main course at a lunch for 10 people and everyone raved about them.  I have already ordered more!  Also, Tamale Molly donates all its profits to hunger related charities -- it is wonderful to buy from a company that gives something back to the community.  I highly recommend this product to anyone who enjoys unique gourmet foods.

column6: Cote d'Or Milk 1883 Chocolate Bars: Four 5.29 oz packages
column14: Grew up in Belgium where Cote d'or is like Hershey in the US. But there truly is no comparison.  Excellent product - not too sweet, even a slight taste of salt. Very creamy, melts smoothly in your mouth. Ok - need to eat some more.

I bought several items from Barry Farms, all of which were very fairly priced and arrived promptly.  It is not always easy to find pumpkin seeds that are shelled, ready to consume. Pumpkin seeds are chewier than sunflower kernels and can be tough or stale, but Barry's are crisp-chewy.  Because I snack on them and toss them in the nightly salad, I haven't added them to homemade crackers, breads and muffins as planned, but I think they'll be ideal for those projects when I order more.

column13: Best scones I have ever had!
column14:
I was fortunate enough to have been introduced to this product about 2 years ago, and I cant say enough good things about the entire line.
These scones were made to be consumed with tea. The cinnamon is really smooth, and seems to flow throughout the entire scone.
The scones are not to dry, and not to moist, they are as the saying goes.. "Just right".
These are the perfect size for a nice snack; so many products out there go for sheer volume and sacrifice quality. This bakery went for quality foremost and managed to hit the nail on the head when it came to volume. After eating one of these, you wont be hungry anymore, but you also will not be stuffed. And that is no problem, Because you will be happy.
And if that doesn't count what does?
I hope you enjoy these as much as I have.
Mark

This product makes an excellent Margarita without all the sugar and carbs in normal mixes. Drawback is the cost. Other good Margarita mixes can be had for half the price at your local stores. However if the cost is not a drawback, you can't go wrong. I would easily give it 5 stars if it was priced more reasonably.
This company makes a few versions of the seasoning.  They are all great.  Really spruces up plain rice for making chirashi.
I love mustards, but this one is the best I've tasted.  It is addictive!  I mix it with some sour cream for my salad, and I don't have a burger without it.  Ambrosia!  Thank you.

column6: Choice Organic - Organic Tea - Earl Grey Lavender, 6 Units / 20 bag
column14: This is my favorite Earl Grey tea.  My Mom loves it, and can't find it locally, so I order it for her for Mother's Day and Christmas every year now.  We hoard it from the rest of our families.  It makes a tea break into a special treat.

In my town we used to have a small confectionary that is now 5 years out of business... I used to go there and buy pounds of this candy alone... The great thing about these is not the taste (although they do taste great), it is the texture. They are very soft (at least when they are not stale). This was always great for my braces because other very chewy gummies would be too painful. Being able to have them again is a great treat.

column13: Credit card charged for items not in stock
column14: Amazon's site made no mention of the products not being in stock, charged my cc, and then mocafe held the order without mentioning that shipment was backordered.  My first call to mocafe received a nebulous response along with an offer to leave a voice mail for someone else, and my second call (upon not receiving a return call) revealed the real facts.  Having a credit card charged for items not in stock is *not* cool.  Beware.
An exquisite black tea with a little extra. If you're fond of black tea but think Earl Grey is a bit twee, give this one a try. The flavor and aroma are brisk but refined. It's become my standard.

To date, this is the best, most informative weekly publication I have encountered. The Economist never fails to cover the stories that really matter in the world, whether they are flashy or not. Including politics, technology, and the arts, as well as economics, it delves deeper and argues more rationally than any other magazine or newspaper available.
Like all newspapers and magazines, it has an angle. As its editors freely admit, it was founded in the 19th century with the express purpose of promoting globalization and free trade around the world- a mission which it continues to this day. Many people mistakenly label the Economist as "conservative". The term "liberal" is only used to label those politically or socially (as opposed to economically) left-of-center in the US. In Britain (the home of this magazine), "liberal" refers to economically liberal- e.g. pro free-trade- a stance more often associated with the right, at least in America. It is also a uniquely American custom to mix social mores up with politics- a path rarely (if ever) followed in Britain. (Many Brits consider it absurd, for example, that the debate about abortion in the States is actually in the hands of lawmakers and the judicial system, making it a debate about 'right' and 'wrong' rather than safety and feasability). Thus, this magazine takes its stands in this British tradition. It is not steeped in what Americans consider conservative mainstays- Christianity, "traditional" values, or naked hatred toward the welfare state as the root of all evil. Judgments are rationally made on sound (usually economic) policy, nothing more.
I describe myself as a social liberal and, though I have, on rare occassions, disagreed with some of the stances taken by the Economist, I have never seen a piece of writing between its covers which I considered unfair, or which drew unfounded conclusions. (Perhaps it helps that I am also pro-global free trade).Rather than a (American-term) conservative mouth-piece, I find this publication refreshingly level-headed and non-partisan. It is unfortunate there are not more such news sources available.

The previous review was right - you NEVER fry a Weisswurst! You simply heat it in water, do not ever boil, and serve still in water so it stays hot.
Despite the faulty cooking instructions, these are very good. authentic Muenchener Weisswuerste!

Sevruga is an excellent tasting caviar that practically goes with any snack or meal.  I always take a can to work for our weekly Pinochle meetings, usually held on Friday. Since I am not allowed to eat meat products laced with steroids and proteins, I usually eat rice.

column6: Sampler Pack - Low Carb Chocolate from Ross Chocolates
column13: very good, although a little expensive
column14: My husband, who has a sweet tooth, has missed chocolate ever since going on Atkins 7 months ago.  I gave him a sampler pak of Ross Chocolates for Valentine's Day, and he loves this chocolate.  He's ordered more of it on his own.  The flavor is very good, and the consistency (what others are calling "mouth feel") is extremely close to "real" chocolate.  All the flavors are delicious.  My one caution is that it is more expensive to order this chocolate through whatever service is selling this through Amazon than from Ross directly.  A sampler pak direct from Ross is about $13, as compared to the "sale" price of $15 here, allegedly marked down from $22.  One wonders what the mark-up is for.

A few weeks back I was constipating and my friend recommended me to eat more fiber. So I went to the local store to check out some high fiber cereals. I tried Kashi at first and it was allright. The next couple days, I go there again and found Nature's Path Optimum Slim. I can't believe how perfect it is. It's whole grain, high fiber, and high protein! Not many cereal can boast 11gm of fiber per serving. On top of that, Optimum Slim is USDA Organic. But best of all, it tastes great! I can eat without milk. It's like I was eating Chex mix (no kidding)! Also I might add, as a side effect, I feel full all the time cuz of the fiber and therefore I lost 5 pounds after eating it. My local store sells it at $3.99 and they can't keep it stocked. I'm so happy that Amazon has it for less.

column6: Starbucks Guatemala Antigua Whole Bean Coffee, Two (2) 16-Ounce FlavorLock Bags (2 Pounds Total)
column14: What can I say for a coffee thats the ultimate: rich, smooth, elegant...these words do not do this coffee justice. I've had hundreds of brands of coffee and this by far is the finest. You'll find yourself on vacation everyday when you enjoy this brew. Sit back and enjoy life... YOU deserve it!!!

column13: Tea for the body and soul
column14:
This cocoa spice tea is made from organic ingredients and is low in caffeine. Although the aroma has a strong note of cocoa from the crushed cocoa shells and beans present as ingredients, there is only a subtle background taste of cocoa. The predominant flavor is cinnamon and ginger. Considering the flavor, I have given this tea only 3 stars because there are better spice teas on the market. But I give it 5 stars for originality. The tea is packaged in keeping with a yoga theme, claiming that it is a tea formulated to uplift body and soul. The box contains instructions on meditation, a note from Yogi Bhajan, the yogi that guides the business practices of the company, and a poem that inspired the illustration of the tea cup on the front of the box. Whether you find this kitschy or useful, it certainly does make for distinctive packaging. Each tea bag is individually wrapped for freshness.
Eileen Rieback

column6: Lee Kum Kee Hot Sesame Oil
column14: This is more about Pacific Rim Gourmet then this product (though it is good too). As a frequent internet shopper these folks must be given kudo's for their professionalism. I have been getting so many things that are poorly packed lately that I was very impressed with this co. packing (as an ex-packaging tester I get picky about such things). They wrapped each item in bubble pack then surrounded the items with "peanuts" works GREAT. I only wish Amazon would take a hint from these folks as they have shipped me some very sloppily packed boxes of late which resulted in damage to my items. Pacific Rim also shipped my items VERY quickly. All in all a happy customer.

Love this vinegar,the flavor of the raspberry taste delicious without being overly powerful. This is a must for any cook enthusiast, you will not be dissapointed. I highly recommend this product, plus the seller was very professional and item was shipped fast.
These are very good. Just crisp enough to hold a dip and great alone. No hydrogenated oils.  All natural.
This is great when mixed with a little melted garlic butter and some fresh thyme and drizzled over fish.

Ok folks, this is not a joke.  I am a real fan of hot sauce, hot peppers and anything that makes my eyes water, and I have to honestly say that Dave's Insanity Sauce is absolutely the hottest thing I've ever tasted.  I use one drop in about 25 ounces of home-made tomato sauce and it makes the sauce noticibly hot.  This is NOT a sauce to dash into your soup or to liven up some salsa.  DON'T USE IT LIKE TABASCO!!!  It is a heavy-duty hot sauce that should be used as in ingredient when cooking a decent amount of a dish.  My brother doubted its powers so I poked the end of a toothpick into the sauce and gave it to him.  The poor guy freaked and ate more Italian bread than I've ever seen anyone eat in my life.  This bottle will last you a long time.  Why doesn't it get 5 stars?  It's just too hot.

column6: Tiger Milk Bars, Lemon Meringue (contains sugar), 1.23 oz, package of 24
column14: I have adored Tiger's Milk bars since my parents used to drag me to the health food store when I was little (along with those sesame snaps) and I still love them as an adult.  My favorite has always been the Peanut Butter Crunch until they started selling the Lemon Meringue.  I still love the peanut butter ones--when I can afford/need the calories.  They do contain some sugar, but for a sweet snack that is low in fat and has nutritional value I'd pick these over other nutritional bars any day. Reasonably priced and they actually taste good to boot!

column6: Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire Gold Tea, 40 Tea Bags
column14: I really like this brand. Taylors of Harrogate is one of those brands on which you can always trust.Utterly British. Tea is strong but elegant. I definively recommend it. With milk is perfect. Please do not add lemon to this tea , it would be a crime.

column6: Tazo African Red Bush Tea, 24 Tea Bags
column14:
After growing up in Africa, one becomes rather fond of Rooibos tea and I never thought the day would arrive when I would recommend anything but a pure Rooibos tea. Tazo has taken Rooibos tea to a new level by blending African Rooibos (red bush) with hibiscus, lemon myrtle, lemon verbena, orange peel, rosemary, and lemon balm.

Rooibos has quite a distinctive fragrance that reminds me a bit of a fragrant flowers waving in a warm afternoon breeze after an African veld fire. I remember mixing in a tablespoon of condensed milk as a child. Now I mix in powdered milk and honey. Honey seems to bring out the rich flavors in this particular tea blend.

For some reason, this blend is rather delicious with a toasted and buttered cinnamon/raisin bagel.

I've recently rediscovered the health benefits of Rooibos although I can truly say I've been drinking this tea for most of my existence on this planet. Rooibos is naturally sweet, very aromatic and is high in magnesium, calcium, iron and copper. Mothers in Africa will often add an infusion of this tea to a bottle of milk for babies to cure colic.

An application of cold Rooibos tea can also aid in clearing the skin or is recommended for allergies, indigestion, insomnia and nervous tension. Just drinking the tea seems to improve your skin due to the high antioxidant levels, 50 times that of green tea!

This is one of the Tazo teas that should not be steeped for too long because of all the delicate flavors. If you enjoy this tea, you might also want to try Tazo Honeybush tea. I must say that the Tazo company really has my attention with their packaging, amusing tales of ancient Tazo wheels and they know how to blend tea to absolute perfection.

~The Rebecca Review

I was introduced to this tea when I went to Spokane and am now able to buy on line to replenish when I need to and not have to wait until I return to Spokane.  The foil bags help keep this tea moist for as long as I have had the box.  I have had this box six months.  I was hording them but I no longer need to since I can get them at Amazon.  Thank you Amazon.
The Jalapeno Jelly was wonderful.  It was in a cute little jar which would also be excellent for giving as a gift.  The delivery of the product was lightning fast.  Thank you Red Buffalo.

column6: S&B Golden Curry Sauce Mix - Medium Hot
column14: I have tried both the mild and medium hot S&B Golden Curry mixes from my local grocery store and they are wonderful. The instructions on the back of the box are easy to follow and so in a relatively short period of time you have a delicious meal that can serve several or last over the course of several meals. While it is of course best fresh, it stores well for a few days if necessary.

column6: Black Mountain Gold, Flavored Gourmet Coffee Gift Sampler - 30 Count
column14: We have certainly exjoyed this variety pack of coffee, the flavors are excellent!  Received the order very quickly.  Would buy from this company again.
Koeze's cashews are by far the biggest I've ever seen.  And they are delicious.  Maybe soon they will get their cashew puddles up on Amazon.  Those chocolate, caramel goodies are heavenly.

column6: Geoff & Drew's Happy Birthday Gift Box of 8 Fresh Baked Cookies, 4 Flavors
