This is the most disgusting, dry, tastless licorice I have ever tasted in my 47 years of life on this planet (44 years of eating licorice). I ended up throwing most of it away!
I have eaten smoked salmon all over the country but this is the best I have had the pleasure to eat.  I will be ordering more.

A few years ago, while on vacation in New Orleans, I had the opportunity to sample these great chips. And sample I did; quite a few times in fact. Frankly, these are the tastiest, crunchiest potato chips I've tasted. I'm glad to see them offered on Amazon for such a reasonable price (works out to $2.09 per bag with shipping, not much different from other "gourmet" chips from the  local supermarket - but what a difference in flavor!)

column6: Sweet and Savory From Hey, Good Cookies!
column14:
The site looks great. Had fun comparing all. But of course no comparsion!!!!
wish I had a cookie at home tonight!!!!!

If you haven't tried these you need to now!
They are incredible. You should order at least twice the amount you are thinking about because you just can't stop once you start.
Five stars because that's all i'm allowed to give them!

column6: 8 pieces Milk Chocolate frosted MAPLE PRALINE Biscotti
column14:
I recently purchased several of the Peggy's Biscotti.
After being disapointed by another product I was a bit worried.
The Biscotti arrived in a short time and they were very good.
I'm writting this review after ordering another batch and I can't
wait to try all the many varities offered.

The Economist is witty, well-written and extremely informative. It is committed to covering the international scene as fully as possible, following developments in Asia, Africa and South America more closely than most news magazines. It has extensive coverage of U.S. politics, as well as an excellent business section. It is simply an exceptionally intelligent production.
As one caveat, I will say that The Economist has its own editorial slant on things, and, frankly, it is not my own. But this doesn't seem to warp its reporting substantially, and I suspect that there is a wider range of views among its reporters and writers.

This granola rocks!  It is loaded with the best tart pie cherries.  I was also pleased that it doesn't contain any preservative or fillers like wheat flour. You so owe this to yourself. I eat it with vanilla yogur but I feast on it with Hagen das vanilla Ice cream.
I started eathing this for breakfast.  now I  keep a bag in the car too. This is a ginger lovers dream and the mix with pineapple and the macadamias.  YUM

When the call it Peaches and Pecan.  It's loaded with fruit and nuts.  usually with granola you have to search to find the odd piece of fruit or nuts.  You get somting in every bite.  Roasted to perfection...I'm addicted

I ordered Ferrara's Tiramisu and it is too good. Couldn't stop eating it. I ordered it from another web site and paid more than this price. Even at the higher price, it's well worth it. One of the best desserts around, anyone ordering this item will love Ferrara's Tiramisu.

column6: Olive Oil, Extra Virgin, Rich & Robust, Unfiltered, Unrefined, 25.4 oz
column13: My family won't let me buy anything else!
column14: They're addicted to this olive oil.  They say they can tell the difference when I buy others.  They love that you can actually taste the olive-y flavor in Napa Valley Naturals.

column6: Santa Barbara Biscotti Chocolate Macadamia with White Chocolate Biscotti CoffeeHouse Canister 30 ounce / 30 count
column13: European style - not too sweet, but full of flavor
column14:
Really incredible chocolate cookie. Almost all the (American) chocolate cookies or pastries are too sweet - but this Chocolate Macadamia Nut Biscotti is very chocolate and very delicious and in European style is not too sweet - you've really got to try it!
It's a great cookie, and the best biscotti I've ever tasted!

column6: Olive Oil, Extra Virgin, Reserve Cuvee, Unrefined, Organic, 25.4 oz
column14: I love this olive oil!  It tastes like fresh olives are in the bottle.  I use it in pesto, to make salad dressing and I can eat about a loaf of bread if I get to dipping it in the olive oil.  Do yourself a favor...get some!
I use Napa Valley Naturals Grapeseed Oil when I don't want a heavy taste in baking.  And it has a high smoke point so I can fry in it without burning.  Very useful stuff.

THESE ROLLS WERE GREAT.  THE LOBSTER MEAT WAS FLAVORFUL WITH ONLY A SMALL AMOUT OF MAYO TO HOLD IT TOGETHER.  HOWEVER, IT WAS THE BUN THAT MADE THE SANDWICH.  IT WAS A PERFECT SIZE AND DID NOT INTERFER WITH THE GREAT TASTE OF THE LOBSTER.  IT MADE A MIDWESTERNER FEEL LIKE HE WAS BACK IN ARCADIA.  I WILL BUY MORE.

column13: Modern classical liberalism; conservatism w/o religious bias
column14: This magazine is a great way for thinking people here in the US to get their news.  Unlike FOX News, whose "reporters" pretty much say whatever Rupert tells them to, or CNN, which often seems like the adult version of the old kids' show with Gary Gnu ("No Gnus is Good Gnus"), or the pro-American big business magazines in the states, The Economist provides deep and insightful analysis of global issues.  It does have a lean - it is of course pro-free markets, pro-trade, and pro-capitalism - but it does not hide this lean, and neither do I.  What's great is that when the writers of the Economist give their opinion, they tell you flat out that it is their opinion that they are giving; it's not hidden in sentimentally-charged rhetoric.  It is also pro-science, pro-technology, pro-reason, and pro-progress, which is something foreign to American-style conservatism, the adherents of which tend to rely on religiously-based and highly sentimental rhetoric to back the claims they make.  (For one example, The Economist has maintained for years a compelling economic argument that drugs should be legalized.)  The Economist is much closer to the spirit of those who founded this country, more interesting and persuasive than either its conservative or semi-liberal counterparts in America, and, frankly, makes a lot of sense on most issues.

column6: Hot Cinnamon Spice Loose Tea, 4 Ounce Tin
column14:
I recently ordered the Hot Cinnamon Spice tea from Harney & Sons. The tea tastes like hot cinnamon candies often used to decorate cookies for Valentines day. The tea is sweet, yet spicy. According to the Harney literature, the tea contains no sugar, but to taste the tea you will insist that it has sugar in it. I think the sweet taste comes from the sweet cloves used within the tea. The aroma is wonderful from the moment the tea is opened.
I must say I was highly impressed with the tea. The tea is available both loose and bagged.

Organic licorice is a hit or miss deal, and this is very good. I love black licorice, and I really like organic licorice, and this is very good. It is a small package, but it is pretty inexpensive.
Also, if you like black licorice, but haven't ever tried organic stuff, then you should try this. The taste is a little different from the regular store stuff, but it is worth branching out a little on the wild side.
Why??  Because I couldn't find anywhere in the description how much rice I'd get for $9.16.  Has anyone bought it under those conditions?

column6: Aloha Island Kona Hawaiian Organic Coffee Blend, Island Breakfast Blend, 8 Oz Whole Bean
column14: This is better than any other Kona coffee I've had, including the other guy's so-called 100% Kona.  I've been to Hawaii and this is the only coffee I've found on the mainland that is better than what I had in Hawaii.  Keep up the good work.

column6: All Natural Pure Cold Pressed Hawaiian Macadamia Cooking and Salad Oil by Sweet Meles, 8 oz.
column14: I used this oil for so many different dishes and my family loved it.  It's not only good for frying things, but it is also great in salads.  I went through my whole bottle in 2 weeks and have already placed my order for more.  I trust this brand because some of the other oils do not taste as fresh and leave a film in my mouth -- never this brand.  (The popcorn they have also takes great).

column6: Hodgson Mill Pasta Wwht Angel Hair
column14: This is great pasta, whole wheat or not. Great flavor - not the normal cardboard taste.
This may be the worlds best rice blend.  Needs no spices or seasonings. Just prepare as per the package (a little butter and salt). The flavor is in the rice.

Galbani Mascarpone is, in my opinion, the finest on the market, definitely worth the cost. It tastes like a dessert, without anything added to it. We like it with smoked salmon, thinly sliced onion, and capers. I'm delighted to have found it at amazon.com; the stores in New Orleans don't seem to be stocking it anymore.
This is pretty good miso soup for coming from a packet.  It makes great quick lunches at the office.

column6: French Vanilla Flavored Kona Hawaiian Coffee Blend, 8 Oz Whole Bean
column14: This is the first vanilla flavored coffee where you can really taste the vanilla and it doesn't taste like cheap vanilla.  This is full of vanilla flavor and it makes the coffee taste even better.  I strongly recomment

Gevalia has a program that five times a year delivers certain specialty coffees to subscribers.  These are from limited production plantations, all at the highest elevations designed to produce the best beans.  Antigua once was part of this select group but now can be purchased separately.  It is a coffee that is deeply fragrant, pungent, smooth as a wine. This is a spectacular coffee as are all those in this series. One must note that the king of coffees, Popoyan, is still as good as it always was.  Sadly, I must report that the once great Zimbabwe coffee has been discontinued due to the ravages of the regime against the producers in that once-fair land.

I have tried several of the Kalahari Red Teas, this one having the boldest and most enticing flavor.  Don't let the "chai" scare you off.  It is an excellent blend that won't torch your taste buds.  If you're looking for a tea with more to experience, this is the one.  You also get the best buy for your money, as most other red tea manufacturer's prices for the same amount are two to three dollars more.

Cafe de Oriente is part of a new International series of coffees produced by Gevalia, the Swedish company. It includes a Greek, French, Italian, Swiss, German, Austrian and more varieties. THese are NOT flavored coffees but are Arabica beans that have undergone (I believe) differing roasting techniques. The result is a wide range of deep, ultra-smooth delicious cup that is intoxicating.
By all means, get the whole bean and grind it. Some have argued that whole bean coffee cheats the buyer since the space between the beans takes up room for the product. But the taste of the feshly-ground coffee more than makes up for this slight loss in volume - a clear case of quality over quantity.

column6: Kalahari Camps Bay Chamomile Red Tea
column14: This is one of my favorite Kalahari teas.  It is perfect when you're looking to sit back, relax and do some reading.  With a bit of honey, it is just that much better.

The quality of this coffee is the first thing one notices. It goes without saying that all Gevalia coffees meet the highest standards and this new one is no exception.  I ordered the whole bean and ground each time right before making a pot.  The flavor reminds one of an AFrican bean (Zimbabwe) but slightly muskier...the only word that comes to mind.  Yet, the sip is crystal clear - a perfect compliment to a morning muffin.

column6: Sampler Pack - Low Carb Chocolate from Ross Chocolates
column14: I have bought this assortment for myself and as gifts for others who are on sugar-free diets.  We all agree that this chocolate is very high quality and tastes better than chocolate WITH sugar!  Great for diabetics, hypoglycemics, and carb-counting dieters.  Definitely worth the price.  Just don't eat too much at once-- maltitol has laxative effects.

I tried this ONCE and expected something out of this world.  It was good, don't get me wrong, but not for this outrageous price. There is a uniqueness in all coffees and this one has such a taste - subtly bitter, rich, a coffee that should be made by professionals, not the sipper with his $150 coffee pot. Try the Popoyan instead.
Normally, I can handle habanero peppers. This damn near killed me off. I think this hot sauce should be renamed "Attempted Murder".

column6: Douwe Egberts Ground Coffee - Dark Roast (8.8 ounce)
column14:
I tasted Douwe Egberts Arabica coffe, medum rost not dark roast, in Europe. I liked it so much that I brought couple of bags with me to US. Later, I asked my friends in Europe to sent me this medum roast coffe to US. It's cost cheaper in Europe than here. A bag of 500g. coffe cost around $4-5. This coffe is much, much better than Starbucks coffe. From Starbucks coffe I get a hartburn, but not from Douwe Egberts coffe. It is more delicate.The arome and taste of the coffe are great!
Similar coffe to Douwe Egberts I found in swidish IKEA store, they sell some of their delicasses there.You wouldn't be disapointed with both coffe I recomended!

column13: This stuff really works and it tastes good
column14: I'm a college student with a pretty stressful life and I've never been a big believer in herbal remedies, but this stuff really seems to work.  I tried some just to expand my horizons a bit and wow am I glad that I did. I've started drinking it before I do my homework to relax me and clear my mind. Great stuff. I highly recommend it, even if you aren't a tea and/or herbal type person.

column6: Bangkok Princess Thai Iced Tea, 3-pack of 10oz Cans
column14: I am a big fan of Thai Ice Tea, but have found it difficult to make.  This powdered version is easy and convient.  Kind of high on the calories though (150/serving), so it still should be a treat.

column13: Laudemio olive oil is truely worth it's weight in gold.
column14:
I recently moved from Orange County, CA to Hawaii. Before we moved I packed 4 bottles of Laudemio Olive Oil for our personnal use. Several months later, I ran out and was ready to shop for it locally. Thank goodness for the web!!! Without it, I would never be able to purchase the very best reasonably priced Italian Olive Oil ever made.
I originally discovered Laudemio 8 years ago, shortly before we moved to California. I almost cancelled that move until I discovered several stores carrying the product. However,shopping in Hawaii is a completely different story. Here, it is almost impossible to find a local source for even the most common ethnic, exotic or non-run of the mill foods. I could have ordered any olive oil brand online, but Laudemio is my only choice, even if it means waiting for a shipment.
Laudemio is perfect for dipping, salad dressings, marinades, anything. Not too strong, nor too overpowering and no too green tasting and very reasonably priced.

We ate this cheese at Epcot in Norway and fell in love with it.  It has a wonderful chocolately flavor that melts in your mouth.  If you're looking for a new cheese to try, don't pass this one up. It's a must!

column13: Ya gotta try whole wheat couscous...
column14: There is no comparision between regular couscous and the whole wheat variety.  The whole wheat couscous has a wonderful nutty flavor but retains the light texture of regular couscous.

column6: Wild Thymes Plum Currant Ginger Chutney
column14: It's rare to find a condiment with both sweetness and tartness combined so well. The fruit flavors come through with a hint of ripe cranberries, and the tartness of currant, but the ginger adds a zing that makes this ideal for those wanting flavorful, fruity but not overly sweet relish. It goes extremely well with Carribean style cuisine (black beans, rice and assorted peppers in a tangy sauce; accompanied by smoked fish and roasted chicken) or with basted roasted leg of lamb and tender spring veggies (asparagus, or fresh young peas). A great find!

column6: Tea, Yerba Mate, Unsmoked, Tea Bags, Organic, 24 ct.
column14: I've tried a number of brands and both loose and bagged tea, and this was quite delicious.  Although it's unsmoked it has a rich smoky flavor that's quite satisfying.

column6: Tea, Madagascar Vanilla Red, Bags, 20 ct.
column14: I found Madagascar Vanilla Red to be excellent, very smooth and tolerant of long steep times without becoming bitter.  This is because of its low tannin content.  It is reputedly high in antioxidants (many web sites say this of its main ingredient, the rooibos, or "red bush").  It reaches full flavor after about 4 minutes steeping, but supposedly continues to release antioxidants if it is steeped even 10-20 minutes.  I like it with 3 teaspoons of raw cane sugar added, but that is not because of any bitterness.

column13: the biggest and best nuts in America!
column14:
I have had the pleasure of sharing a tin of Koeze nuts and can honestly say that they were out of this world. The cashew nuts are huge and I rationed myself to 3/4 a day to make my share of the tin last!
Here in England, the cashew nuts we buy in the shops would insult any Koeze - they are tiny and tasteless!!

column6: Chocolate Chips, Semi-Sweet, Grain Sweetened, 10 oz.
column13: If you are on a no sugar diet and miss chocolate, try these!
column14: These are fabulous!  I am a hypoglycemic and can't eat any refined sugar or artificial sweetners.  I eat these chocolate chips right out of the bag (in reasonable amounts, of course) and have no hypoglycemic side effects.  They are also great to cook with.  Try them in your favorite banana bread!
We use this sauce as a topping for Chicken Parm, Pizza, and much more. It's excellent for any kind of pasta and it has soooooo much flavor that you only need to use a little bit at a time.
...you will love this! Better than Barilla!

column13: The next best thing to fresh lemons
column14: The second you twist open the cap, the aroma of fresh lemons hits you right away. The ingredients are lemon, sugar, and pectin...not even any water or anything else to lessen the effect. One small jar should last you a long time because it's so full of flavor.

column13: Whether you like mushrooms or not, you'll like this
column14: One of my cousins was sampling this and some of the other pates I bought. She said she liked this one a lot and asked what it was. I told her it was the mushroom pate and she did not believe me. She said "it can't be mushroom...I don't like mushrooms...it must be one of the other ones." So I showed her the jar it came from and she was shocked at how good mushrooms can be when prepared like this stuff is.

column13: Drink this tea, its good for you!
column14:
Have an upset tummy? Heartburn? Feeling flu-ish?
This tea is really good, but it's not like drinking black teas at all: You have to make sure that the water is REALLY HOT (preferably boiling hot from a teakettle on the stove - microwaved or warm water just doesn't do it justice) and it's best if you allow it to steep even as you're drinking it.
Do Not use Sugar or Honey! This tea doensn't need it (sugar is just excess carbs anyway) & the natural sweetness and spiciness is what you want to enjoy. Soon, you'll be drinking it every day!

column6: Italian Parmigiano Reggiano Pre Cut (Approx 10 Ounces)
column14: I just opened my Parmigiano Reggiano Cheese and it's outstanding!  I intended to use it in my mixture for meatballs, but decided it's way too delicious.  Definitely to be enjoyed by freshly grating atop any pasta dish, but I enjoy eating it as is with some fresh fruit!

column6: Lavazza Super Crema Espresso, 2.2 lb bag whole beans
column14: Very smooth compared to other brands. A must if you like quality coffee.

column6: Le Saunier Fleur de Sel de Camargue 4.4oz - The Chef's French Natural Sea Salt
column13: The little things that make life worth living . . .
column14: Sometimes it's the little additions that make a meal memorable or more pleasurable. This is wonderful finishing salt. It is sweeter than regular salt and is full of natural magnesium, calcium, iron and potassium that are often missing from table salt. It is different in texture and taste from ordinary salt, and if you are on a salt restricted diet, this small addition as a treat is well-worth not having salt on your food all the time. This is an elegant addition to any gourmet spice rack!

column6: Tampax Pearl Plastic Regular Scented 20 ct
column14:
These offer no more than any other tampon, as they are Tampax they actually offer less because of the way in which they are made - they are made by cutting rectangles from a length of cotton/viscose fleece, which makes them more prone to fiber loss (although not enough to be a large risk), the loss here comes from the fact Tampax expand lengthways, meaning that they can expand into the gaps on either side of the cervix causing further period pains or cramps.
These products would be great for Tampax tampons in terms of absorbency, however two major factors that put me off even trying them for the sake of research;
1. Plastic applicator, tampons are enough of an environmental risk as it is however add an applicator waste is doubled, add a non-biodegradable applicator then this product is a regrettable purchase even in the name of research.
2. Scented, tampons are harmful enough as is for introducing chemicals into the vagina disrupting PH levels, however add to this scent, something unnecessary and so harmful is again - regrettable, as my gynecologist will agree.

This marmalade is thick and full of flavor. If you like the taste of oranges, this product is definitely for you. It is one of my favorites. I love it on toasted whole wheat bread for breakfast or a snack. Enjoy!

column13: Another Review From Dr. Fruitcake A WINNER!!!
column14:
Generally, I dislike anything that smacks of the deep south. Maybe it's my upbringing, but usually I don't like pecans in anything. I associate pecans with that god-awful hockeypuck confection known as the praline found in every truck stop from Georgia to eastern Texas.
So when I encountered the Texas Pecan Fruitcake, I was skeptical.
SURPRISE! The fruit content is generous, and the wonderful orbs of succulent red cherries provide a wonderful juicy . I even managed to savor the pecans.
This one is definitely a winner. The mouth feel is very good, and the ratio of sweet-to-savory is nearly perfect. To make it a little friendlier, soak it in port sherry for a while, wrap it up and put it away for a few months.
You MUST try this one!
James Hold McGavran PhD (Phruitcake Doctor)

One word EXCELLENT, i've been a big fan of zipsticks you need to give them a try. They are not like the other greesy chemical infested jerkies out there ZipStickS are 100% PURE.
My fav is habanero heat!
Give them a try you will not be dissatisfied.
I ordered the Hon-Doshi (Bonito Fish Soup Stock) and I received it so quickly!  Quality service for a quality item!  Thanks!

I was looking for a good "gourmet" jerky that wasn't one of those loud slim jim brands but actually had some flavor from the country and these are it.  The spicy habenero heat is my fave (my mouth is watering thinking about it), helps when I commute from work when I need something to hold me down before I get to dinner. Gotta hand it to these guys the packaging is pretty classy as I don't feel as embarrased when I need to take out a stick from my briefcase as theres no onerous odor or loud colors (for those conservative environments)!  If you're looking for a healthy snack that actually tastes like real food I'd go with these.

column6: Peanut Butter, Creamy, Salted, Organic, 18 oz.
column13: my chakras really swirl with this stuff
column14:
i'm an amateur hippie down in california. i've just recently arrived here, and am still learning how to be organic and natural. this peanut butter has helped me quite a great deal.
at first, i must admit, i was having some problems. i tried smearing it on my chest and putting a thin film over the top of my eyes, but it neither helped me see the road to fulfillment, nor did it lighten my breating and deepen my capacity for understanding. it turns out, it just gave me a rash and caused me to be overrun by ants (i was sitting near an ant hill while trying this).
then a monk walked by and broke his vow of silence so he could say, "no, you idiot, put it on bread with some jelly and make a sandwhich". as i watched him climb into his corvette and speed off into the night, i thought to myself, "that talking unicorn might just have a point!" (i had been sitting in the sun and roasting in peanut butter for a while at that point). in any event, i got up and did just what that magical creature said, and, i have to say, this truly is the telekinesis for which i'd been searching. i feel younger (the monk-unicorn showed me how to reverse time), lighter (i ditched the anvil i'd been carrying around when i bought the bread), and smarter (i think that speaks for itself).
in short, this peanut butter has singlehandedly changed my life, and if you feel like you're missing something, you might try spreading some of this stuff on crackers. also, you could try taking a look behind the couch.

column6: Cookie Waffles, Honey & Maple (8 per pk), Organic, 8.5 oz.
column14: I had always seen these sitting on the shelf but never had tried them because I would like to share them with my husband and he hates anything that resembles breakfast food. Well, the other day my resolve broke down and I bought a box. They are DELICIOUS! Crispy yet thick on the outside and chewy in the middle- these are a very rich and deserving treat. I made my husband have a bite and he's fallen in love with them too.

I was always a stickler for making my own vinaigrettes, until two events coincided that made me more than a bit dependent on LIVE A LITTLE: 1) I got sick of my boring old dressings, but wouldn't deign to touch a bottle of Kraft or Paul Newman, and 2) a friend gave me a set of these three dressings. I dipped a finger in each and couldn't decide which to put on the salad, so I ate three mini bowls with one of each!
I started with Very Blue Cheese, which is full of the flavor of its namesake and adds punch to a fresh, crunchy romaine salad. Bold Balsamic tastes wonderful on mixed greens- truly the only readymade vinaigrette that tastes better than something you could whip up at home. The Mango-Lime sounds unconventional, but it has a wonderful tart citrus flavor to balance out the sweetness of the mangoes, and goes well on a spicy green like arugula.
These three dressings knock the living daylights out of anything you'd find in a conventional supermarket! You'll want to eat salads for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

Leave this under your spice rack and don't pay attention to smaller & lamer mortars. You want the big heavy pestle as its inertia will actually make the job easier and its large contact surface will mean less seeds fly out of the mortar, and speed up the job. Sure this thing is heavy but you absolutely want that. The ungrooved interior is rough enough to generate friction but not so rough to catch lots of yield and make cleaning difficult.
This is the best solution on the market.

column13: Do you really want to taste your coffee?  Yes?  Get this!
column14:
This is the way to make coffee if you are like me -- love coffee but hate the sour bitter watery flavor you get out of most coffee machines.
In regular machines, you usually can't taste the difference between brands of coffee. That all changes once you figure out how to make coffee the right way -- in one of these.
Coffee recipe in the melita:
3-4 tablespoons of medium ground coffee grinds. The amount depends on the roast of the coffee. Darker more flavorful beans get about 3 tbsp, light breakfast roast beans get 4 tbsp.
12 oz (1 1/2 cup) cold water in microwave safe measuring cup.
Microwave 2 1/2 minutes in microwave (until bubbles start forming on the sides of the container) The goal is 155-170F water. (If you happen to have a meat thermometer -- that is medium well.)
***DON'T boil the water**** it leaves the coffee tasting bitter and horrible.
Hotter water gives you more bitter coffee, but takes less grinds. Cooler water gives less bitter more flavorful coffee, but uses lots and lots of grinds to get full flavor.
Now, pour the water through the grinds in your melita filter and into your cup.
Mmmmmm java-licious.

column13: Caramel Treat for Occasional Sugar High
column14:
I normally don't eat sugary treats, but when I saw this item, I just had to eat one to remember my childhood days of almost pulling my teeth out while trying to chew on this delicious milk caramel pop.

The trick of this entire experience is to use this like a lollipop and get the caramel soft enough so you can actually bite off a piece and then suck on it slowly. If you try to chew this caramel, you will notice it sticks to your teeth with a level yet unknown to glue.

So, use with caution. I will occasionally treat myself to one of these because they keep me busy while watching a movie. It also helps one get through 100s of pages of editing!

I had no idea they still made these because I'd only seen the sugar daddy treats in packets, but had not seen the pops in quite some time. It was like I was 13 again.

~The Rebecca Review

The \\"GeniSoy\\" Protein Shakes have always impressed me with their creamy texture and \\"complete nutrition\\" health benefits. It is easy to put a scoop of powder with milk or juice and blend it into a nutritious shake. Frankly, if I had to choose between a milk shake and a Soy Protein shake, I'd choose GeniSoy. Not only because I have seen the great results of taking soy powder, but also because I just feel healthier and this product is not overly sweet. It is just perfect.

You can mix up this shake after a workout or drink it as a breakfast shake. Basically, you can drink this at any time of the day and feel good about this Fat-Free and Cholesterol-free product.

For the best results, blend this in a shaker or use an electric blender. I've also been adding a scoop of All One Vitamin Powder to the blend.

This is my favorite Chocolate Flavor Soy Shake. If you have tried a lot of health shakes in the past few years, you will become very loyal to GeniSoy brand products. They just taste better. I can't wait to try the other flavors since I've only tasted the vanilla and chocolate. I hear they now have a Strawberry Banana flavor. Hey, you can't have too many Soy Protein powders! If you love to workout and also want to keep up with your nutritional needs, try GeniSoy.

Also look for the Vanilla Protein Shake.

I've been drinking GeniSoy soy drinks for years and years. So far, I have been unable to find a protein drink that tastes
this good.

~The Rebecca Review

column13: Organic Darjeeling best with Organic Sucanat
column14:
\\"Sitting on the porch of a bungalow on a tea plantation in Darjeeling, you can see the peaks of Everest and Kanchenjunga as you sip a cup of this exquisite brew. Life is good.\\" ~tea packet

If you want a subtle tea with a smooth, soothing flavor, then Darjeeling is an excellent choice. The slightly floral flavor is much milder than an Earl Grey. I especially love this blend when eating a Caramel Apple Cobbler Clif Bar. For some reason, the flavors mingle nicely. I think it is the slightly nutty flavor of the Darjeeling.

While many of the Tazo teas are blends of a variety of teas, this tea is purely a blend of Organic Black Darjeeling teas. The tea is grown near India's border with Bhutan. There are only \\"true Darjeeling\\" tea leaves in this tea.

This tea is just perfect when blended with an Organic Sucanat: Natural Sugar Cane. You might also want to try using \\"milk powder\\" instead of cold milk with your tea. I find it helps to keep the tea strength and adds a creamy element to the smoothness of this tea.

Darjeeling is a very satisfying blend for morning tea. You might also enjoy AWAKE and Earl Grey if you enjoy this tea.

I just love the packaging of the Tazo Teas. The individual wrappings have a nice crinkly sound and the colors are all so soothing and quite beautiful. These teas are definitely for the aesthetically aware. Drinking Tazo teas literally becomes a magical experience. There is something mysterious going on here. The teas even seem to have a magical glint or luster to them. When you drink Tazo teas the world looks more beautiful and you feel much more aware of life itself. I find that my creativity soars after drinking Tazo teas.

For more information on the mysteries of Tazo Tea, read the review for the Tazo Assorted Teas.

For a calming experience try the Tazo Calm Herbal Infusion which is perfect for quiet evenings, after completing a yoga workout or just to sip on while you write in
your journal.

~The Rebecca Review

column13: Delicious Sweetener for Tea and Baking
column14:
Organic Sucanat is many levels above regular white granulated sugar. This sugar takes baking and tea drinking to new levels of pleasure.

When holding this sugar in the palm of your hand, you will notice the irregularity of the crystals and the \\"dark brown sugar\\" color. This does have a flavor that is reminiscent of brown sugar and yet the texture is much more natural and the crystals take longer to melt on your tongue.

Recently I've been discovering a variety of more natural sweeteners. This on is perfect for tea because it not only adds sweetness; it adds a caramel flavor to teas in which you use milk. There is a purity in the flavor and you feel better because you are supporting organic farms and keeping your body healthy.

This is a one-for-one replacement for refined white or brown sugar.

Sucanat is made from 100% certified organic sugar cane. The sugar cane is \\"green cut.\\" This means the fields are not burned and the leaves and tops of the cane plant are left in the field. The sugar is minimally processed and once the sugar cane is harvested it is pressed to squeeze out all the cane juice. This juice is then clarified, filtered and evaporated. This helps to remove excess water. The syrup is then crystallized and a sugar with a molasses flavor is produced. There are also vitamins, minerals and trace elements from the sugar cane plant. One teaspoon of Sucanat contains 10mg of Potassium and 6mg of Calcium.

If you are still using white sugar, try Sucanat. It might surprise you with added flavor, goodness and purity. I find the flavor to be superior to refined white sugar. This sugar will add a touch of caramel flavor to all your baking.

If you are looking for an even deeper flavor for chocolate recipes, try Muscovado sugar. It has a rich flavor that can't be matched by any regular brown sugar you would find in your grocery store. With Muscovado and Sucanat, you can take your baking to the next level.

~The Rebecca Review

This is an excellent item to keep in the kitchen cupboard.  I love lemon desserts and just a touch of this makes an excellent addition to any.  It also works well for those times when I really want to bake but don't want to go to the store for lemons.

column13: Possibly the best in its price range
column14:
As of today, Jan. 25, 2004 Amazon is offering this product from two different merchants at two different prices with two different names. Possibly the confusion comes from the fact the the name of the product is partially in Italian, and every merchant made up its own English name. Anyway, the following two are the same, just buy the cheapest
1. Illy Roasted Espresso Coffee Beans -- Merchant: Goodman's
2. illy Whole Bean Espresso, Normale -- Merchant: CaffeSolo
Here is my review of the product itself.
Among coffees in this price range, I haven't been able to find anything better.
I am an italian who came to US 6 years ago (I think it is relevant to readers) and Illy is an italian brand. I claim my review does not have any shallow food-nationalism bias, but it might well be that I am influnced by my upbringing.
This coffee is roasted much less than what americans are used to think as the "italian roast", Illy calls it "medium roast". It is roasted less than ANY Starbucks coffee I tried so far. The roasting type can be seen by comparing the colour of the powder. This particular Illy is lighter in color and it is bit reddish. It's color is close to the color of cocoa poweder (I mean cocoa powder processed with alkali).
The roasting is key for me because I dislike any coffee which tastes of burnt -- Illy does not.
It's flavor is marked enough to fully come through even when drank with milk in a 50% coffee 50% milk proportion. It actually still tastes of coffee in this proportions.
Some people prefer Illy Dark Roast (the silver and black) to make espresso, but I prefer the flavor of Medium Roast even to make espresso.
I prepare it with a stove-top espresso machine, such as Bialetti.
This particular tin I am reviewing contains coffee beans, an identical tin (the lid is different) containing grounded coffee (same blend) also exists. The grounded one is grounded having in mind stove-top esperesso machine, which is a powder barely coarser than the one for true electric espresso machines (it can be used in them too) and much finer than grounds for dripping machines.
As you probably know, coffee should be drank very soon after roasting. In general this is true. Illy is one of the leaders in vacuum paking, so the shelf-life of its coffee is very long. The metal can is not just for beauty: it does keep the air out better then bags. Still, you don't want to buy it from a merchant who had it on its shelf forever.
All in all, there is better coffee around, but I can't find any better for this price either for delivery on the internet or from small roasters who roast their own coffee in the New Haven area.

I ordered the pecan tin as a Christmas present for my secretary December 7th. The product was never delivered to me nor did anyone contact me. I called Taste of the South the first week of January to inquire about the status of the order and was told that I would be called back when they figure it out. No one ever returned my call. Finally, I called the sales representative again and she confirmed that my account would be credited for the error. Today is January 24th, 2004 and still no credit has been applied to my credit card. This is a very small and completely disorganized business, avoid the mess and buy from someone else.

\\"A single cup of Tazo Calm has been known to have the same effect as sitting for 45 minutes in a mountain meadow on a sunny day with your shoes off.\\" ~tea packet

Drinking this particular tea blend almost begs for 32 ounces of water. You can brew this tea in your coffee maker by letting the water drip slowly onto the tea that is sitting in a coffee filter or you can use the infuser that comes with this kit.

This tea has a magical, almost golden sparkle of brass. The ingredients in this herbal blend are almost romantic. How often do you drink a tea with \\"rose petals\\" in the blend?

Ingredients: Chamomile flowers, hibiscus flowers, spearmint, lemongrass, rose petals, blackberry leaves, safflowers, peppermint, sarsaparilla, lemon balm, licorice, and other natural flavors.

Chamomile is known for its soothing properties and after drinking this tea I have vivid dreams and my sleep is deep and calm and I wake up refreshed. Tazo Calm Herbal Infusion will allow your body to relax into sleep and can be especially calming after yoga, before bed, or when writing peaceful thoughts in your journal.

~The Rebecca Review

column13: Best price, responsive vendor, but best product?
column14:
This is my first experience purchasing and using dried pears since I live in a place where specialty items like this are not easily found. This is the best price available of the varieties offered on Amazon, and the company responds immediately, with low shipping charges.
The product is unsulphered, which may be prefered by some. Its texture is tough. Its flavor is present but muted, rather like canned pears. That said, when braised in a little chicken broth, the dried pears perked up and did what they were supposed to do in a wild rice pilaf dish. I'll definitely soak them before adding to breads or cookies.
The next time I order, though, I may try Melissa's, to compare quality.

It's color is close to the color of cocoa poweder (I mean cocoa powder processed with alkali).
The roasting is key for me because I dislike any coffee which tastes of burnt -- Illy does not.
It's flavor is marked enough to fully come through even when drank with milk in a 50% coffee 50% milk proportion. It actually still tastes of coffee in this proportions.
Some people prefer Illy Dark Roast (the silver and black) to make espresso, but I prefer the flavor of Medium Roast even to make espresso.
I prepare it with a stove-top espresso machine, such as Bialetti.
This particular tin I am reviewing contains coffee beans, an identical tin (the lid is different) containing grounded coffee (same blend) also exists. The grounded one is grounded having in mind stove-top esperesso machine, which is a powder barely coarser than the one for true electric espresso machines (it can be used in them too) and much finer than grounds for dripping machines.
As you probably know, coffee should be drank very soon after roasting. In general this is true. Illy is one of the leaders in vacuum paking, so the shelf-life of its coffee is very long. The metal can is not just for beauty: it does keep the air out better then bags. Still, you don't want to buy it from a merchant who had it on its shelf forever.
All in all, there is better coffee around, but I can't find any better for this price either for delivery on the internet or from small roasters who roast their own coffee in the New Haven area.ounded one is grounded having in mind stove-top esperesso machine, which is a powder barely coarser than the one for true electric espresso machines (it can be used in them too) and much finer than grounds for dripping machines.

I got some of this blend thinking that it would be a little different on steamed vegetables or greens, but when I tried it on eggs, I was astounded! Used sparingly, it really makes plain old scrambled eggs into a taste treat.
The key with all of these spice blends is to USE SPARINGLY! I've used most of the other blends as well - a little goes a long way towards creating subtle overtones in your dishes. Another good one is "Are You Game?" Mostly I use that for meat dishes, but it's really good in lasagne and spaghetti sauce too.

Pickappa has achieved a fine balance of excellent ingredients in this sauce that I have found nowhere else, (I have tried others when I could not find Pickapeppa, unsuccessfully). column6: S&B Golden Curry Sauce Mix - Hot
column14: I have been a fan of S&B Golden Curry since I found a box in SF's Japantown.  I wasn't able to read the preparation instructions since they were in Japanese, so I had a friend translate for me.  Then I found it in the U.S. and realized that the instructions he gave me were not at all a translation, but they are better than what's printed on the box.  So disregard the printed directions and use my recipe instead!  1 lb. chicken, 1 large onion, 3 medium potatoes (peeled), 2 carrots (peeled).  Cut all the preceding into medium-sized pieces.  Brown the onion and chicken.  Add 3-4 cups of water and the potatoes and carrots.  Cook for 15-20 minutes until the potatoes are done.  Remove from heat and add the Golden Curry (cut it into pieces for easier melting).  Mix well and it's soooooo tasty!  Serve over rice or udon noodles.  5 servings?  HA!  3 servings for people with normal appetites.

column6: Blair's Sudden Death Sauce with Ginseng and Skull Key Chain - 5 oz
column13: The absolute benchmark of hot sauce.
column14:
Blair isn't joking: that plastic skull is a cogent, stark warning not to take this sauce lightly. And another note: this isn't so much a sauce as it is an additive.
Here's how you can literally fire up your mouth: take one 24 ounce jar of generic hot salsa from your supermarket. Let's say you laugh at their idea of "hot", which means you're ready to go with Blair's Sudden Death Sauce.
Put the salsa in a blender. Do not blend yet. Pour about 1/4" of water in the empty jar, shake it up, pour into the blender (get all of your salsa's worth). Put four-six drops of Blair's into the blender. Cover and blend on "Liquify".
Pour into a serving bowl. Take a nacho chip, dip, and eat. Now run to your kitchen sink, and stick your mouth under the tap. After five minutes, the burning should stop.
Repeat until the bag of chips are gone.
I add a few drops to canned chicken soup, and it really makes it far more tasty and hot than you could ever buy. I'm impressed at how tasty the sauce really is, if you use it properly. It takes a little practice to get the right balance of flavor-to-hot, but it really does add flavor to soups, salads, chili (man, does it ever), hamburger, just about anything. A single bottle might last you about three months, and you'll sneer at lesser sauces in your grocer's aisles.
fred

column13: Nostalgia makes me write this review
column14:
Being Italian I basically grew up on Baci Perugina. When I came to live in the US it was very difficult to find them and I sorely missed them.
Now they are omnipresent and I don't miss them anymore. My knowledge and taste for chocolate has evolved since, so I find them too sweet and I can taste the vanillin (used instead of the more expensive vanilla). I would not buy a box for private consumption, or for a gift, but I do pick up one, once in a while, next to a shop chash register in memory of the time past.
OK, but what are they?
Each of them looks like a small truffle. The filling is gianduja chocolate (gianduja chocolate is milk chcolate with hazelnut powder mixed until it forms a paste. It is basically like Nutella, just denser), with small pieces of hazelnut and at least one full hazelnut on top. The whole thing is covered by dark chocolate.
It looks like they are in fashion now, because I see them everywhere

column6: Douwe Egberts Ground Coffee - Medium Roast (8.8 ounce)
column14: After traveling to the Netherlands and drinking Douwe Egberts coffee in just about every restaurant I decided to try to get some DE Coffee in the US.  It's not very easy to find!  I prefer a whole bean coffee for the freshest taste, but this pre-ground is hard to beat.  Distinct flavor and the medium blend is the perfect match of a smooth drink and a bold flavor.

column6: Perugina Milk Chocolate Classic Bars: Box of 12 Bars
column14:
This chocolate is average. Very much similar to the one you would find in a supermarket. Very sugary, very much taste of milk, vanillin instead of vanilla.
The Perugina brand still carries a lot of renoun in Italy (I am Italian), but there is so much, so much better than this now on the market.
It is not bad, don't get me wrong. It is equivalent to the other chocolates in it's price range.
If you are ready to spend something more try Valrhona Le Lacte Milk Chocolate, for a totally different experience.
Then again, I am a "believer" in dark chocolate, so no milk chocolate is ever good enougth :)

column6: Aunt Lizzie's Zero Carb Cheese Straw Bites - 20 oz Tin
column14: I just got my first tin today -- and I say "first," because I know there will be many,  many more in my future! These cheese straws are just divine -- delicious, savory, great texture. You really feel like you're eating a batch of "fully loaded" premium cheese straws. Having started on the Atkins plan, I've been looking high and low for something that actually tastes good that satisfies that craving for a "munchie." This has been a super find! (My other super find, also available on Amazon, is Ross chocolates...super-low-carb and amazingly delicious.) And I'm still trying to pick my jaw up from off the floor at the idea of these things being absolutely NO carb!

column6: Chocolate Rhum Torrone (Torrone al Rhum e Cioccolato) from Piemonte
column14:
This is good, but other brands are better.
Torrone is the italian way of making nougat. This torrone is the hazelnut one in the usual white paste (honey, sugar and something else that I don't remember). This particular torrone is the \\"morbido\\" version, by now prevalent. \\"Morbido\\" meas \\"soft\\". Actually, in this product a lot of the white paste is softer even for the morbido type; it is almost fluid.
This particular product is a variation of torrone, quite popular in Piedmont during Winter Vacations. Is a variation because it has other things besides torrone itself. This particular brand has 2 layers: 1 torrone layer and 1 layer of rum chocolate (it is rum chocolate paste; it is not chocolate filled with rum liquor). The whole thing is covered with dark chocolate. The dark chocolate is very, very thick below constituting a 3rd layer. On top and to the side the chocolate it thinner: just a cover to keep the hole thing together.
The rum flavor is strong (in a good sense) and the hazelnut is strong too, but could/should be stronger.
By now I got so snotty with chocolate that I can see how the chocolate could be better (both the chocolate in chocolate-rum paste) and the chocolate in the covering. Anyway, as a whole this torrone al rhum e cioccolato is quite good, and until I can find the brand I was used to in Italy I'll keep on buying it.

I wanted to order something from the gourmet food section besides chocolate, so I picked this package of 1lb of jumbo shrimp.
The packaging was very nice, they came in a large styrofoam box with icepacks keeping them cold. I immediately froze them when I got them, as I wasn't cooking them within the next 24-48 hours.
They dethawed well and I made them as a shrimp cocktail. They were just as good as any shrimp I've bought in a grocery store, though far from the best I've tasted.
While they were good, I will probably just buy my shrimp from the grocery store as the taste is comparable and then I don't have to pay for shipping. They were decent shrimp though, so I recommend them to people who live in areas where shrimp is not readily available.

column6: Espressione Classic Coffee Pods, Box of 150
column14:
We ordered these to go with our new espresso machine and have been so pleased with them. We were really shocked at how delicious and tasty this coffee is - I bought it based on the Amazon reviews and they were right on. I decided these deserved another good review after I tried a Starbucks pod this morning and had to throw it out it was so terrible - it had no flavor and tasted watered down even though I made the correct amount (1 oz.) I have been lavishing praise on our espresso machine, which it does deserve, but I have now realized that the Espressione pods are the big reason that we've fallen so in love with our home espressos. The coffee is very flavorful, richly so. The price is also competitive when ordered in bulk like this, a great deal (these pods come out to be $.40 each whereas the Starbucks pods were $.41 each). They are certainly worth more.
One caveat, make sure to order the 100% Arabica pods - you would be well advised to always buy Arabica coffee as it is far superior to coffee made with the cheaper, more acidic Robusto beans.

column6: Cell Forte IP-6 And Inositol Rapid-Release Tablets - 120 tabs - Enzymatic Therapy
column13: Cell Forte wioth IP-6 - a miracle supplement
column14: I would highly ercomment this supplement to anyone but specialy to those how suffer from cancer.  I have talked to two other people whao are in remission and they have been taking this supplement ever since they were diagnosed.  My father was diagnosed with pancras cancer.  The family new the out come of this disease but we did not give up hope if nothing else we wanted more time instead of three months.  My cousin snet him a bottle of the Cell Forte with IP-6 and he took it every day till he passed on.  He lived over a year from the time they gave him three months.  Even the Doctors were amazed that his blood cell count went down at a very slow pace.  We belive that this supplement gave us a year with him that other wise we would not have had.  I will say this he had no chemo and radiation.  The  only treatment was the Cell Forte.

column6: Welpac Japanese Akaume Zuke - Pickled Plums
column13: Dear God in heaven, help me please now!
column14: Can you take it? Can you? Really? 'Cause if you can't, don't buy these. They are serious: Salt and alum and salt and alum and maybe a little plum -- but for sure, there's salt and alum. Serious salt -- and I like salt. So be sure to order a mirror to go with them, because the twisted pucker your face will go into will be worth the price, plus shipping. Buy these, and buy a mirror. I dare you. I hear the wily Japanese eat a couple a day to start out their days -- detox the liver and all that. I'd rather give up drinking (and that ain't gonna happen). Good luck.

column13: The Best Granola I Have Ever Eaten
column14: I LOVE this granola so much that almost everyone I know received 2 bags of City Grits and 2 cereal bowls for Christmas!  I basically stopped eating granola several years ago because what was on the market was full of sugar, cinnamon, maybe a few raisins, was very dry and it seemed they all tasted the same.  This City Grits stuff is wonderful!  The fruit alone is worth trying a bag - it all tastes so fresh and feels like it is good for me.

column6: O & H Danish Kringles, Set of Two, Pecan and Raspberry flavors
column14: Others try to make kringles but there is only one bakery that makes them the real danish way. That is O&H Don't be decieved by the dry tasteless garbage others try to pass off as a kringle.

column6: Gillette Series Shaving Gel Sensitive Skin 7 oz
column14: My son always has me order this product for him, as he has very fair, sensitive skin. The aloe enriched formula allows him to get a close shave without undue facial irritation, leaving his skin soft and smooth to the touch. It seems to offer a protective layer between blade and skin, making for a much more relaxed and comfortable shaving experience.

column6: Edmond Fallot Dijon Mustard Gift Pail (16 ounce)
column14:
We received this mustard from a neighbor who purchased it at the Paris airport.
We have almost gone thru the entire jar in abour a month. At Christmas time all the kids and grandkids were over and almost cleaned the jar out.
I've been looking all over until I found it on this web site. Once you use it you will not go back to the other yellow mustards.

The Blue Eyes herbal mix has an unexpectedly strong but delightful flavor; the Darjeeling is acceptable if undistinguished; The Yerba Mate and the African Red Bush are only for the brave (sort of a boiled tree bark flavor); and the green teas are, well, green teas ('nuff said).
I highly recommend to have business with this company. I like their job. Nice price, quick shipping, tasty product.

column6: David Rio Decaf Tiger Spice Chai,14 oz-2 cans
column14: I've tried many of packaged Chai products - liquid, dry, soy, etc. I actually enjoy the Chai at a national chain coffee store (I don't care for their coffee).  I received this as a gift and it is excellent (it must be made with water and sweetened a little or it will taste horrible). What's even better is it's caffeine free so I usually drink it at night instead of coffee.

column6: Tazo Filter Bag Tea for Keurig Brewers - Chai
column14: This is Awesome!! Tastes like its a complex home mixture of spices etc for chai tea but its all in a simple tea bag! AMAZING!

column6: Earl Grey Supreme Tea, Loose Tea in 7 Ounce Tin
column14: This tea is excellent! I've been a fan of Earl Grey tea for many years but succombed to the bagged variety (Bigelow, etc).  This tea has a very rich flavor that is quite superb and all of my friends love it.  As a result of this, I have been unable to dring bagged tea in any flavor.  Be sure to follow directions - I added a little more and let it steeep a little longer a few times and was disappointed.

This tea is great. Its got a strong flavor that will grow on you. After just a few cups you will find yourself craving it. I made the mistake of giving a sample to a few office friends. Now I seem to be the supplier of a hard to find tea.
Wish that they would change the name so people wouldn't take the tea as a joke.

Chocolate Covered Espresso Beans are incredibly delicious for anyone who likes the taste of fresh coffee and fine chocolate. This combination cannot be beat! I gave several 5 pound bags to friends and colleagues for holiday gifts and received rave reviews and profuse thanks. This is a terrific and unusual gift idea. The chocolate covered beans keep for a long time in an airtight container, or gallon zip-lock bags. Best stored in a cool place - not the refrigerator. I love them!! ENJOY!!
JANA

column6: Sampler Pack - Low Carb Chocolate from Ross Chocolates

column6: Kookaburra Old Fashioned Black Liquorice, 10oz Bags in a Gift Box (Pack of 4)
column13: Fantastic Real Licorice From The Land Down Under
column14:
I recently purchased a bag of Kookaburra Black Licorice at Target (of all places) Real licorice lovers in US know how difficult it to find REAL black licorice here, so I was delighted to find this product at a retail store AND at my fave online store. It is "gourmet-priced" candy, but still a reasonably priced treat that's well worth it. It is far, far better than the crud that's passed off as black licorice in this country! (no wonder so many people say they dislike it!)
Kookaburra Black Licorice is the real, old-fashioned licorice deal, in HUGE pieces that are perfect for a mid-day licorice fix.
Buy a bag for your fellow licorice lovers, or invite a supposed black-licorice hater to try the real deal--they just might change their minds...This would also make a great, inexpensive just-for-the-heck-of-it gift for an elderly person who fondly remembers the taste of REAL licorice.
Oh yeah, one little word of warning though: Real licorice can have a mild laxative effect in some people. :)

The Hickory Farms Beef stick is an excellent item that is part of our holiday tradition.  We usually end up getting several during the Christmas season.  If you buy it at a permanent store have them thin slice it for you.  If you buy it at a kiosh in the mall make sure you pick up some of the white crackers.

If you are one of those people who always pick the licorice jelly beans out of the candy dish first, then this is the tea for you.  Although there are other herbs and spices in this tea blend, licorice is the predominant flavor. It has a womderful aroma and it tastes great, especially when sweetened with sugar. The tea bags come individually wrapped for freshness. They're decaf too.  Enjoy!

column6: Tazo Earl Grey Tea, 24 Tea Bags
column14: This is a strongly aromatic version of Earl Grey, scented with citrusy bergamot. If you like a mild Earl Grey, this may be a bit strong for you. I personally love it. One of my favorites.

I add this to bread to up the fiber. I put it in hot cereal and I also use it to make dehydrated veggie crackers, using it as a flour substitute. It has a nutty, delicious taste and it's incredibly good for you.

column6: Avalon Organic Botanicals, Bath & Shower Gel, Lavender, 12 oz
column14: This is one of my favorite bath gels, much nicer than bar soap in the shower and made with good essential oils, It's also a good value. Avalon is one of my favorite organic brands. The gel is scented beautifully yet is no more expensive than artificially scented shower gels. Recommended.

column13: Can be used for breading for low carb dieters
column14: You can use this for bread, pancakes or breading if you are on low carb diets. Almond meal is mild and not so "nutty" flavored as pecan.

1. You can make low carb pancakes with wheat gluten (add some soy flour for flavor) or you can make gluten bread.
2. A few tablespoons added to general purpose flour make bread come out better, especially in the bread machine. Good to add to rye or pumpernickel to promote a good texture.

This is the Japanese version of breadcrumb (pan=bread, a Portuguese loan-word, and"ko-"  is "child of" or of "derived from".) Panko are used for katsudon, tonkatsu or cutlets served on rice or in soups. The cutlets, pounded chicken or pork, are coated with these light and crispy crumbs and fried. They are not gritty and dense like regular crumbs. They are very nice on deep fried shrimps and decorative for a more gourmet touch.

column6: Italian Parmigiano Reggiano Pre Cut (Approx 10 Ounces)
column14: I surprise myself by rating this cheese my favorite of all cheeses (and I love cheese, all kinds.) But real Parmigiano Reggiano is so delicious. I love the characteristic amino acid crunch (those little white spots are crystallized amino acids produced during the ripening process.) Even though a pound grated lasts a long time, sadly, you may discover that real parmesan can be eaten in chunks, like a good chocolate, and thus, this pound will melt away like snow. Too good.

column6: Candy Bar, Rice Crisp, Dark Chocolate, Dairy Free, Gluten Free, 3 oz., package of 12
column14: Tropical Source is one of THE BEST dairy-free chocolate brands out there. This isn't their best chocolate bar, but it's still pretty darn good! Amazon.com should really add the banana and the rasberry flavors. I hope that they're working on it.

I am rather nostalgic about this filter, as my flute teacher would use one to make a cup of French Roast before we started a lesson.

Sue

this is the best molasses i have ever tried. it is flavorful without being biting or bitter. Smooth on the tongue. Wonderful in BBQ sauces, and on biscuits!

column6: Cookies, Lemon Shortbread, Wheat Free, Gluten Free, 7.5 oz.
column14: My boyfriend just found out the hard way that he has a wheat gluten allergy. I've tried experimenting with different non wheat fours, but they're expensive and don't turn out very well.  (And I'm a good cook!) He especially misses shortbread and butter cookies, so we were thrilled to see these in a local market!  They're a little different, but they're good! column6: David Rio Tiger Spice Chai, 14oz. - 2 canisters
column14: I think that this is a great Chai! Far from sweet.. I found it very unsweet (and that is exactly why I like it). The Tiger Spice is a great blend of Black Tea, Cinnamon, Ginger, herbs, and more. I was not a big tea drinker (until now) but this is a very smooth and light Chai. All you do is add water and it comes out creamy and perfect (some people add milk but this Chai mix already has a creamer in it). This is my new healthy breakfast wake me up. It is great. I have many Indian friends with whom I drink freshly made Chai with and this is as close as you can come with an instant blend. I highly recommend this.
Producer provided refund for underweight cheese (greatly appreciated) that was mentioned in previous recommendation. I've since tasted cheese and it is excellent.

column14: Amazon webmasters - this is not a forum for personal views on any type of meat production, but an area for reviewing products.

I haven't found a rice that compares with basmati. The rice is aromatic ans has a nutty almost sweet flavor that adds a wonderful richess to many savory dishes. While I don't use this with asian dishes (I think there is too much flavor) I use this in most other things. It adds a great flavor to stuffings, rice pilafs and plain cooked meant to be served with a topping (like a meat/veggie mix). It holds its own against thick flavored sauces and its a real winner on my table.
I usually will wash this rice a few times before cooking to carry away some of the starch. Some people would find this rinses some flavor but as long as you dont over-do the pre-rinse you will be fine. It works especially will when briefly sauteed in butter or olive oil proir to cooking. That will accentuate all the wonderful naturally occuring nutty traits.
The grains are generally separate and get longer rather than plumper when cooked. So if you are expecting a very plump grain you may have a hard to deciding when its done. I have used this in a rice cooker and found it needs quite a bit more water than the rice cooker directions suggest (just as an fyi in case you open the lid and find dry grains at the top, like I did)
As an all purpose rice I just love this. Its a flavor that works very well with most savory dishes and I think you will enjoy the texture once you experieince it

column6: Frank's ® Original RedHot ® Cayenne Pepper Sauce, 5 fl oz
column14:
Frank's RedHot Original has been marketed since 1920 and is one of the best Louisiana-style hot sauces widely available. The recipe is simple - aged cayenne peppers, vinegar, water, salt, and garlic powder. However, the sauce has a great consistency and adds the perfect amount of heat. I find it's perfect for soup, eggs, chili, and popcorn. In addition, the makers offer an extensive recipe website. A most highly recommended hot sauce that is sure to become a staple in your home.
Fun trivia: Frank's RedHot was used in the original recipe for buffalo chicken wings, and they still sponsor a wing eating contest in Buffalo, New York.
This hot cocoa tastes as if it's from heaven.  The smooth and creamy falvor is sure to be a must for any chocolate lover.  As it is the holidays - I recommend it as a stocking stuffer!!
Not a low carb product

Cake and French Vanilla.

I have actually seen the product in grocery stores, but now like
the idea of buying it on Amazon in the future!

I'm very disappointed in the shipping methods of this supplier. I bought $12.95 worth of lime leaves that are now worthless due to inadequate packaging. The item arrived via priority mail, and was wrapped in brown paper that was sopping wet. Upon unwrapping, the gel coolant pack they placed on top of my produce had leaked everywhere. To make matters worse, the leaves themselves were simply lain on a styrofoam tray with saran wrap around them! They were not even sealed! So now not only is there stickl gel all over my hands, it is all over my lime leaves.
Good idea to provide this item, but terrible packaging, bad enough to prevent me from ordering from them again.

column6: Huy Fong Sriracha Garlic Hot Sauce, 17 fl oz
column14: When Americans want to add some heat to food, we usually think of Mexican or Louisiana style hot sauces.  Sriracha, on the other hand, is a common sauce in Thailand and is named after the largest harbor in that country.  This version, made in California, is a wonderful diversion from Tabasco-like sauces.  Although made with peppers and relatively hot, the sauce has a generous helping of garlic taste that really perks up food.  It's ideal for Asian recipes, but it can be used with any food to which you want to add some heat, including soups, pasta, and chicken wings (the company also has a website that includes some excellent recipes).  The sauce comes in a handy plastic squeeze bottle that is ideal for squirting just the right amount into your food.  If you're tired of the usual old hot sauce, give Sriracha a try.

I recently received the Maine Lobster Salad, complete with authentic split-top rolls (just like the kind I had as a kid growing up in New England). Everything arrived cold and wonderful. The salad was superb... giant chunks of tender, flavorful Maine lobster... only a little mayo (don't want to smother the lobster!). This is a terrific product.
This popcorn is as good as it says.  Just just follow the directions!  I use it in my West Bend 82306X Stir Crazy 6-Quart Popcorn Popper.  We all love the results.  The corn is so tender and tasty.

My friend had an assortment of candy from this merchant, and these were definitely my favorite.  The "creamy" transition from chocolate to caramel is wonderful, and the cherry flavor is just subtle enough to complement the chocolate, not overpower it.  These are terribly addicting!

Hmmm. Coconut oil that can be used for body and for cooking. I was suspect.  Opened jar to get a wiff of my beloved coconut fragrance. NONE. Only after the fact did I do my reading to learn the benefits of this product.  I Like it. Texture while cold seems gritty upon scooping out, but goes on smooth upon application. If heated, turns completely liquid.  Left mine by a heating element accidently and I thought someone had poured water into the jar. Firmed back up on window sill.  I used this product for after bath with great results. Used it on the kids.  Used it for sauteing something when I ran out of regular oil. Worked fine. I didn't rate 5 stars because I didn't like the idea of scooping it out while firm which is my preferred texture for body application.  I'd buy it again as I'm moving towards more natural products.

column13: The best bread crumbs...you'll never go back
column14:
Panko bread crumbs are just awesome. When used for breading they make a light yet crispy coating...The are different than traditional *american type* crumbs in the way that soft powder snow is different than heavy packed snow.
The crumbs themselves are larger and irregularly shaped so as they lie on eachother they don't form a dense compressed breading but one with substance that still remains airy. Their flavor is very light and seasoning is needed but this is a plus for me as I can season to taste.
I have also mixed these with traditional bread crumbs at times as these tend to be expensive for a lighter style coating but still essentially very much like all panko dishes. I tend to use a light egg wash with these as I find using just eggs to dip the meat/poulty/fish in a bit heavy for these crumbs.
In general I find these far superior for coating food. These aren't the kind of bread crumbs I use for adding bulk (ie meatloaf, meatballs etc). I have been using these for a few years now an there is a huge difference between these and the others. I think if you try them you will really enjoy the light crisp crusts you can achieve...

column13: A Great Cheese - But Buyer Beware!
column14: Let's just start with a few points of clarification. First, Alsace is NOT German speaking as is mentioned above. Say that to an Alsatian and you're likely to start a fight. Second, while this cheese is one of the strongest smelling cheeses I can think of, the strength of the cheese changes drastically depending on age.  That is to say that most Alsatians consider this a seasonal cheese; most young Munsters are quite mild in flavor, given their smell anyway. Old Munsters are exceedingly strong. Therefore, it would be quite a gamble to buy this cheese online without knowing the age or the state of the cheese. With all that said this cheese might very well be worth the gamble. In Alsace it is also quite common to sprinkle the cheese with caraway seeds. In addition to the wine pairings (try an Alsatian Tokay), it goes great with beer (Alsatian or German beers, though my favorite is Hoegaarden).

column6: igourmet Black Diamond Grand Reserve Cheddar - Pound Cut (15.5 ounce)
column13: Excellent Cheese Indeed - but Check this out
column14:
This cheese is slightly crumbly, tangy, I believe it *would* go well with chutney, but it's more versatile than that.
Still, if this type of cheese hits your hot button, you should consider trying the "special reserve" Black Diamond. This venerable comestible has been aged for a minimum of 4 years!! All the things you like about the standard Black Diamond are even more in evidence in the reserve. Perhaps best of all, you can buy a pound of it at CostCo for only 8.99!! Whew.
Fabulous with eggs and bacon as well as steak! Haven't ordered it from Amazon before now because it wasn't available but we ate it with everything in England! Definitely authentic anglo-cuisine!

column6: 16 pc Gift Box - Dark MINT Chocolate Truffle
column13: Best Low Carb-Low Fat All Natural Truffles in America
column14: These Truffles are the absolute best tasting truffle made in America. I can't believe they are low in calories, low in carbs, low in fat, all natural and still tastes like the richest chocolate truffle ever made.

column6: Chocolate Chip Cookie Lovers Assorted Gift Tin: Chocolate Chunk, Chocolate Chip Pecan, and Chipotle Double Fudge Chunk (One dozen cookies, 1.lb)

column14: Combined together in this wonderful tin are 2 classics paired with 2 truly unique and clever twists.  As for the classics, my grandmother always included pecans in her chocolate chip cookies while my mother preferred bigger chunks of chocolate in her recipe.  Glad they won't be reading this before I get my stocking stuffers because they each just placed 2nd.  Then try the 2 "new" originals in this assortment. Oatmeal choc chunk doesn't sound as unique as the Chipotle dble fudge chunk...until you try it.  I don't know if it's the all-natural ingredients or what...you have to experience it.  Then there's the that Chipotle dfc.  When you can get an award from yankees on a cookie containing chipotle, you know IT MUST BE FANTASTIC!  It is.  Try 'em...you'll love 'em.

column13: Order at least a month early!

When the order completed and was updated in My Account, the estimated delivery date was JANUARY 25th!  I couldn't cancel because the order said it was in processing, and now the item is no longer stocked. Buyer BEWARE!

What arrived was a cardboard shipping box filled with bags of coffee.  There was no nice gift box.  I must now find some sort of gift box or basket so this can be given as a Christmas present.

Bob Tuttle, Treas.
