column6: Barbecue Sauce, Mild, The Pepper Plant, 15oz. Glass Jar
column13: Am I a Wimp or are these really hot????
column14:
Last week I was picking up some Dave's Insanity Sauce, and I added some of these olives to my order.
The first sign that these were different olives where the scotch bonnet and habanero slices resting on the bottom.
I popped a couple of olives in my mouth. Wow. I was not prepared for the heat. These are not olives with some heat; they are heat with some olive flavor. After my blood pressure returned to normal, I had a couple more olives.
I really like them. My only warning is to be prepared. I would recommend trying them in your martini or just eating them plain with a cold beer.

column6: Nutrition Bar, Chocolate Brownie, 2.4 oz., package of 12
column14: All the cliffie bars share these traits: very moist, chewy and easy to swallow. It makes a terrific afternoon snack or for quicker recovery from a workout or jog. The other energy bars I've tried such as PowerBars are either too dry and hard to swallow or sticks-to-the-teeth. I also like the Clif packaging and learning about Soy Protein. One Tip: Sometimes it's hard to open, just flip it over and open it from that end! If that doesn't work have a friend rip it open with their teeth - you know that's a friend to keep!

I ordered a "6# wedge" as a special treat for my aged parents who were to host a big holiday party.  Package arrived nicely but wedge weighed just over 4lbs, making this the most expensive cheese I've ever purchased.  I've yet to taste it and I'm sure it is good (?) but someone's scale is broken... and I'm feeling ripped off.

Even Shakespeare did not have enough of a grasp of the English language to describe how hot this sauce it. It is mind blowing. I put a few good dashes on some BBQ I have eating. I was able to shovel in 3 healthy forkfuls into my mouth before the heat hit. Pow. I was knocked out. All I could do was grab on to the table to brace myself and breath through my mouth.
I ate all the bread I could find. I wiped out every square inch of my mouth with a napkin. All in an attempt to ease the heat. It helped only a bit.
After about 2 hours, I was almost back to normal.
It is that hot. I would think that only 1 drop would heat up a pot of chili. DO NOT try this straight from the bottle. It won't kill you, but is will wound you. Wow.

column6: Tapatio Salsa Picante Hot Sauce - 5 oz.
column14: Tapatio salsa picante is one of my favorite hot sauces.  The flavor is more smoky and complex than Tabasco and other popular hot sauces.  Although it goes perfectly with almost any kind Mexican or Southwestern food, it's also a great compliment to a variety of other dishes, including spaghetti and soups.  In addition, the sodium content is relatively low - 110mg per teaspoon (many comparable brands have 200-250mg), making it an excellent, low-sodium way to add flavor to your food.  Most highly recommended.

I am lucky to live near a grocery that stocks this. It is a wonderful item that adds *restuant-quality* to your soups, stocks, sauces and flavored rices. Including a teaspoon of this to a recipe (even if you have alread added stock) brings a body and taste that isn't usually expected in cooking outside a professional cooking.
I have tried this flavor as well as the chicken and roasted chicken and they are all excellent. It is the essenese of stock cooked down to a very thick paste/gel consistancy. You can use this in water to make a stock but I have found that adding a small amount to what ever stock you normally use is very good and more cost effective.
Once opened it will stay good a little while in the fridge. I have kept it about a week after opening. If I am going to have it longer I will portion it up into small pieces and freeze the pieces individually.
It is not a salted item like a soup stock cube which is very welcome. If you want more flavor you just can add more without worrying that you item will become so salty you won't be able to eat it. You can season according to your own preference.
I have found this a great help to add to home made soup stocks that are a bit weak in body and flavor. I have also added it to things like risotto and stir frys. Its a wonderful, although not inexpensive pantry item.

These are a really satisfying snack. Unlike some snack food that can be swallowed almost without chewing ...this has a nice chewy consistancy. It is sweet but not overly so (take into consideration that mangos are pretty sweet and the dried ones probably more so, so these are sweeter than dried apricots or peaches. They probably are more on the line of dried pineapple)
I had originally got these to try to find more healthy options for my son to eat. I thought maybe the taste and consistancy would be similar to fruit roll ups and that he would like them. In the end, I ended up liking them much more than he did. Perhaps you need to be a mango fan to begin with to enjoy them.
I buy them every once in a while as I find them an expensive dried fruit option but they are my very favorite dried fruit option.

column6: Olive Tapenade Spread, Double Gift Pack
column14: This one's a little less bold than the Black Olive Tapenade Spread, and it's got a fantastic flavor all it's own. Handmade, all organic, one of my personal favorites.

column13: Not enough information to buy this
column14: There is not enough information provided to know what I'm buying.  More description is needed.

column13: Good if you are at a California airport
column14: These chocolates are good, not phenomenal.  If you're at an airport in California, and you forgot to bring your friends a gift, these make for a delightful present.  One word of advice--if you like nuts and chews, consider getting the strictly nuts and chews box in lieu of this variety chocolate assortment.  They won't be as refined as Teuscher or Godiva, but they will be very satisfying in a down-home American way!!

column6: Black Olive Tapenade Spread, Double Gift Pack
column14: This is definately on my top 10 list of gourmet acoutremants. Great flavor, great texture, a little bolder than the Olive Tapenade spread - there's nothing like it. Superb.

If you are looking for something new - You have to try this!  I have been cooking everything with the Zest Sauce and the Real McCoy Mustard Sauce.  The salad dressings are really tasty as well.  No more same old same old.  I am going to send this as gifts this year to all of my cooking friends.

column13: A great way to learn about different flavors
column14:
This is a great way of learning about different cheeses, and what there flavors are.
Gorgonzola is a stronger cheese, usually used for salads - very tangy with a stronger after taste, something I think everyone can really enjoy in that matter. A classic is romaine lettuce, gorgonzola and apple slices.
In contrast, gouda is a milder creamy cheese, great for breads. If cheddar were a starting point, I would say gouda is more creamy. It tends to break and crumble less easily, and really stick to bread surfaces better.
Both will make you forget about the normal supermarket colby or cheddar. I recommend this sampler highly.

I received this as a gift. Great quality and on-time delivery. they have a bunch of clubs in wine, beer, fruit, flowers, coffee, cigars, chocolate and pizza! Very cool idea! They have a main web site at [...]

column6: Orangina Sparkling Citrus Beverage with Pulp (4 PACK) Bottles
column13: I fell in love in Paris
column14:
Yes, with this juice. Apparently I'm not the only person who loves this drink, it is the leading orange carbonated soft drink in France. What I love most about this drink is the not-too-sweet flavor of the carbonated juice. This is not like the super sweet orange drinks that are normally carbonated. It is more like carbonated water with a splash of real orange juice and flavor.

I think I first tasted this juice in a café next to the Moulin Rouge in Paris. At least, that is what I remember when we ate lunch after stepping off the tour bus. Anyway, imagine my surprise when I found it was also being sold over here in local tea shops and grocery stores. And now it is here at our very own Amazon!

A deliciously light taste and not overly sweet. Perfect for picnics and parties.

~The Rebecca Review

Whether you are using this juice to help ease gout (a type of arthritis\\" that is an excruciating, throbbing pain) or you want to make aloe vera juice taste better...

You can mix a tablespoon of cherry concentrate into your drinks. You can mix this juice with the R.W. Knudsen Organic Apple juice. It is unsweetened, smooth and one of the most delicious apple juices I've tried.

Agatha Thrash, M.D. says that some people do notice results with as little as 1 tablespoon of cherry concentrate a day. So, it is worth a try!

~The Rebecca Review

I love Mango juice and this company makes particularly delicious fruit juices. There is hardly anything as delicious and fragrant as a mango. Mango nectar can take drinks from ordinary to exotic. Here is a recipe you can use with either the Goya mango nectar or you can substitute papaya nectar for an equally delicious drink.

Mango Freeze

1 fresh ripe mango
2 c. mango nectar
3 T. frozen orange concentrate
2 T. lime juice
8 ice cubes
Lime slices

In this drink, fresh mango and mango juice is blended with ice to form a delicious tropical slush. Look for yellow/orange mangoes with a red blush. Mango contains betacryptoxanthin that has protective antioxidant and cancer fighting properties. To Make: Peel and slice the mango, place in a blender. Add mango nectar, orange concentrate, lime juice and ice. Blend until smooth. Serve this drink in tall glasses with straws and decorate with a slice of lime. Makes 2 glasses.

Enjoy!

~The Rebecca Review

column13: A good starting point to learn about different flavors
column14:
This is a great way of learning about different cheeses, and what there flavors are.
Gorgonzola is a stronger cheese, usually used for salads - very tangy with a stronger after taste, something I think everyone can really enjoy in that matter.
In contrast, gouda is a milder creamy cheese, great for breads.
Both will make you forget about the normal supermarket colby or cheddar. I recommend this sampler highly.

column6: Aloe Vera Juice, Plastic Bottle, Organic, 32 oz.
column14:
\\"Aloe Vera (topical or ingested) has the remarkable ability to stimulate fibroblast collagen production...\\" ~Stephen Cherniske, M.S. in his new book \\"The Metabolic Plan\\"

Aloe vera is a rather amazing find. Not only will aloe vera gel help wounds to heal, it can also be taken internally to encourage stronger tissue and increased collagen production.

Lily of the Desert has a number of products containing aloe vera juice. I found the \\"Pleasant Tasting Aloe Vera Juice Drink\\" to be a quick way to drink Aloe Vera Juice, however, you can use any of their \\"juice\\" products mixed in with some fruit juice. The \\"Aloe Vera Juice, Plastic Bottle, Org., 32 oz.\\" Listed here is not the Lemon-Lime Flavor I prefer, but all the aloe vera juices are very healing.

Aloe does have a distinctive flavor which you quickly get used to when you see your skin improve considerably after just a few weeks. I bought a 32 Fl. Oz bottle and before I have even finished half the bottle, already my friends say I look younger. It could also be that I'm putting Aloe Vera Gel all over my entire body. Stephen Cherniske got me started on this juice after reading his book: The Metabolic Plan. It is truly an amazing product!

The Lily of the Desert company has a state-of-the-art processing method in which all the \\"aloin\\" is removed. This is the harmful, bitter part of aloe vera. The aloe vera plants are also grown organically. The company follows strict standards established by the Texas Department of Agriculture.

Drink 1-8 ounces a day and see amazing results! You can mix this juice into any fruit juice. Often, I make an aloe vera drink with apple cider and grape juice (one ounce aloe vera with 7 ounces additional juice) You can hardly taste the aloe vera in this combination.

Drinking aloe vera will encourage anticatabolic benefits by supporting immunity, healthy cell proliferation, collagen production, detoxification, antioxidant activity and intestinal health.

Lily of the Desert is a leading producer of Aloe Vera and their products contain high levels of minerals, enzymes, amino acids and vitamins.

~The Rebecca Reviewa leading producer of Aloe Vera and their products contain high levels of minerals, enzymes, amino acids and vitamins. ~The Rebecca Review

column6: Tortuga Coconut Rum Cake, 16 Ounce Cake
column13: Great Rum Cake, even if you don't like rum!
column14: My husband and I visited Grand Cayman last  year and every store sells this cake.  We bought one, even though neither of us likes rum, and LOVED it.  The cake was gone in no time.  Excellent gift option.

column13: zest sauce has tons of uses!!
column14:
I have been using zest sauce for years...so glad to see it on Amazon...it will be easy to get!
I love it on grilled chicken. Mix about a 1/4 cup with fresh orange juice and rosemary. Also great on fish like this. It is also great in pasta salad.

This is the smoothest tea I've ever tasted. I've been drinking it for several years and really enjoy it. It is by far my favorite green tea. The flavors blend nicely to the point that none are dominant. Example: To be honest, I don't love the taste of green tea. This tea solves that problem because the spearmint, peppermint, and lemongrass complement the green tea to the point that you get the health benefits with just a hint of green tea flavor. For those folks that don't like strong peppermint flavor this is also perfect. Like I said ... smooth :)
Excellent any time!

column13: The Best Stuff on the Market
column14: The Formella Family's products have been a staple here in Chicago for many years.  It is wonderful to see them on Amazon where they can reach a wider audience.  The pictures do not begin to do the products justice.  We use the giardiniera on everything..the ground giardiniera is wonderful on sandwiches, pizza, hot dogs, scrambled eggs and just about any meal where you want extra flavor.  I'm also a big fan of the eggplant salad. I've really been enjoying the newer products as well, the muffalata salad and the hot olives.  The packaging is colorful and these make wonderful (and welcome) gifts; we've been sending them to our friends and family for years.  Highly recommended!!

column6: Mt. Sterling Raw Goat Milk Cheddar Cheese - Four 8 oz. Packages
column13: Not as good as I hoped...
column14: I have to say I was disappointed - it may just have been my batch, but the texture was closer to mass-produced supermarket cheddar rather than a raw milk boutique cheese.  Rubbery mouth feel and a mild, innocuous taste.  I was hoping for much more from this cheese based on the write up and awards.  Overall, this is an easy to eat cheese that would be good to serve to friends who are put off by stronger, flavorful cheeses.

column6: Black Mountain Gold, Flavored Gourmet Coffee Gift Sampler - 30 Count
column14: I have become an official coffee adict.  Black Mountain Gold coffee has a great taste as well as the little boost to get me going in the morning.  The wonderful aroma reaches my nostrils and makes my mouth begin to water before the pot has finished brewing.  Once I am able to get that savory first sip of Black Mountain Gold Coffee my taste buds dance with joy!  Thank you Black Mountain Gold keep up the good work.

column6: Godiva Chocolate: Classic Milk-Chocolate Hot Cocoa Canister 15.4oz. (14 servings)
column14:
I am not a fan of chocolate, which includes hot chocolate, but Godiva is not your average chocolate. This is, simply stated, the best. The taste is smooth, it is not tart or flat. The milk makes it so much creamier. Try it, I can not imagine you will not like it.
Would make a nice gift in a basket along with some Godiva cookies and a mug.
Highly recommend.

Though usually known as a side dish to curry, chutney is tasty with any kind of cold cut, and fabulous on hot or cold chicken breast. It can also jazz up your hors d'oeuvres, and add a lot of interest spread in a dull cheese sandwich.
This excellent Patak's Hot Mango Chutney is sweet and pleasantly hot, but far from burning hot, so you won't need water to douse the flames even if you eat it by the spoonful.
The ingredients are sugar, mangoes (nice chunks of it), corn syrup, salt, acetic acid, spices and garlic.
The nutritional information per 1 tablespoon serving size are: calories 60, sodium 300 mg, sugars 14 g.
Blend Patak's Hot Mango Chutney and sour cream to make a marvelous and easy dip, served with toasted pita pieces, crackers, fruit, or veggie sticks for dipping (remember to store the dip chilled).
If you like Indian food, you will love Patak's chutney, and will be sure to find many uses for it.

column6: No Sugar Added Dark Chocolate Bars - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates
column13: One of the few good-tasting, low carb chocolate bars!!
column14: Being a HUGE chocolate lover, I have tried many dozens of kinds of chocolate in my day... but VERY few out there (that are low-carb) can compare to the Ross low-carb chocolates!  They taste almost as good as regular chocolate, and bounds better than most other low-carb chocolates out there.  Whether you're on the Atkin's diet or just trying to watch your carbs - you'll LOVE this chocolate bar!  I recommend it to all my friends!

column6: Fireworks Popcorn, 11" Bowl Popcorn Gift Set
column14: I got this as a gift for someone and they loved it!  It comes with four different kinds of popcorn (Wisconsin White Birch, Savanna Gold, Starshell Red and High Mountain Midnight), some EXTREMELY good white cheddar season salt and a couple popcorn forks.  The bowl it comes in is really nice, and is ok to go in the dishwasher (something extremely important to me!).  All four kinds of popcorn are great, my favorite is the Savanna Gold!  I highly recommend this as a gift for a popcorn lover (or yourself).  It's great tasting and VERY reasonably priced!

My brother-in-law was thrilled with this gift (and he's Italian!).
> Superfast shipping!

These little chews are absolutely awsome!! They are the best for motion sickness-even better than Dramamine and without the drowsiness.I suffer from motion sickness and I carry these in my purse to every trip I make-car, boat, plane. They last a long time since you don't need to eat a whole one to reap the benefits. A third of a chew will do-one feels instantly better. It is really great for older children-young kids might find them too spicy. Adults find them addictive because they are so good tasting!!!

Mmm... this stuff is great!  I got some this year right before Thanksgiving and it surprised me!  Cranberry Fool is great with SO many things - I love it on crackers and with cheese and bread, but some people I know love it on ice cream as well.  I haven't used it much in cooking or baking, but the times I have it has gotten rave reviews!  It's GREAT as a glaze!  If you like cranberries, try this - you won't regret it!

First of all i must specify that my review is based on the fact that i cant eat any food without feta.In addition to having tasted any feta in greece i had the (not so) luck to taste feta in france when i went on vacation.
I believe dodoni (and not dodino as wrongly stated on the title of the product) is the best feta in greece definitely.After all what you pay is what you get and so i find its price ok compared to its quality.Try it and you wont get disappointed:)

column6: Tea, Chai, Original India Spice, Decaffeinated, 20 ct.
column14: I have always loved chai and consider myself an aficionado of it. Celestial Seasonings has a winner with this great chai. Even the smell is rich, heady, and full of spices. The taste is wonderful, especially when you add milk and sugar. It is decaf too!  Rather than the tea bags being individually wrapped, they come in a thick inner wrap to keep them fresh. Try some of this wonderful tea and take your taste buds to the Orient.

column6: See's Candies 1 lb. Milk Bordeaux(tm) by See's Candies
column14: I have always loved the smooth flavor of the Milk Chocolate Bordeaux. You have to try it to know what you are missing. It's truly the best!

I have been using canola oil for many years, and am a believer in its health benefits. I also appreciate that its flavor is so mild it is hardly perceptible, and does not interfere with the taste of other ingredients. I love it in my favorite salad dressing, which is also a marvelous substitute for butter drizzled on artichokes or asparagus spears:
½ cup Hain canola oil
the juice of 2 limes
1 tsp. of grated fresh ginger (from a peeled chunk or "finger" of ginger)
garlic powder, salt and pepper to taste.
Hain expeller pressed canola oil is wonderful for stir fry dishes, especially the more delicate recipes that include shrimp, and perfect for baked goods, because of its neutral flavor. The nutrition facts per serving of 1 tablespoon are:
Calories 120
Total Fat 21 %
Saturated Fat= 1g, Polyunsaturated Fat=4g, Monounsaturated Fat=8g
The only other ingredient in Hain canola oil (as can be found in other high quality canola oils) is 10% all natural Vitamin E, to preserve quality and enhance freshness.
(percent daily values based on a 2,000 calorie diet).
Canola oil is the lowest in saturated fat compared to other vegetable cooking oils, making it a healthy option when choosing an oil.

These Eden soy beans are a great additive to salads, and much more. Though if eaten alone they will not tantalize your taste buds, when mixed with other foods will add much to the nutrition of your meal.
They are especially important in the daily diet of women, as many experts say that women over the age of 40 benefit greatly from adding soy products to their diet, helping to turn down the heat index of those "hot flashes".
You will be surprised when you open an Eden Black Soy Bean can, that unlike some other brands, it is packed to the top with beans, and with very little liquid; other than the small quantity of water, the only other ingredient in Eden Black Soy Beans is kombu seaweed, and that does not make it taste salty or fishy, in fact, the aftertaste these beans have is slightly sweet. The black beans are somewhat more delicate than their yellow soy bean relatives, and these have been cooked, but still retain their shape, density, and are shiny dark brown in color.
The versatility of the soy bean is amazing. It will help your budget and cholesterol level if you mix it in with your ground beef dishes, are excellent in soups, and can be blended into just about anything. I simply add these beans to a salad to make it a complete and satisfying meal.
A serving size of ½ a cup provides:
Calories: 120
Dietary Fiber: 28%
Protein (11 g.) 22%
and good percentages of calcium ( 8%), potassium (9%), vitamin A (10%), and iron, phophorous, magnesium, and zinc, all at 15% each. (percent daily values based on a 2,000 calorie diet).
Bon appetit, and here's to your health !

\\"Throughout India, chai wallahs can be found serving cups of decaffeinated chai to souls who naturally seek inner beauty at a slightly gentler pace.\\"

If you like your Chai with a peppery kick, then this tea will interest you. Rooibos, cinnamon, ginger, decaffeinated black tea, cardamom, ginger, chicory, cloves, star anise and other natural flavors seem to take a back seat to the delicious peppery flavor of this tea. This tea tastes similar to a tea I first tasted in Africa, where Rooibos tea is grown.

Best served with milk/powdered milk/soy milk or a dash of cream and some honey. Since this is a decaffeinated tea, it is perfect for late night writing sessions or when you want something calming to drink that doesn't taste like chamomile.

~The Rebecca Review

I grew up in Kansas and a few times in my life I was fortunate enough to have home made, Kansas-grown wild plum jelly. When my package from The Red Buffalo arrived I tore it open to sample the wild plum jelly on a piece of wheat toast. It was great -- just like home. It is a real pleasure to have this arrive on time, well packaged, and tasting so great. I'm looking forward to tasting the other flavors.

Ick Ick Ick...mate tastes like boiled straw. It's a fact that no amount of sweetner and milk can cover..and really, would you want to waste perfectly good milk?  Anyone who is familiar with mate would scoff at this product and tell you to buy the plain gourd with the unflavored yerba.  Mate is an acquired taste, but this is definately not way to acquire it!

column6: Dave's Gourmet Pepper Salsa, Insanity Ghost, 16 Ounce
column14: $10 for shipping and handling for one jar of salsa is absolutely ridiculous. I understand that glass jars are heavy, but this is quite a mark-up.
WOW! I had no idea how tasty Huckleberry Jam is!  This product is sensational and makes a GREAT gift!

column6: Santas Comin to Town 3 Way- 3.5 Gallon
column14: This popcorn tin makes a wonderful gift for anyone who loves popcorn and likes pretty tins. The tin contains three types of popcorn: carmel, cheesy, and butter. I really don't think the carmel tastes that good and would perfer a box of Cracker Jacks any day. column6: Sesame Tahini, Raw, No Salt, Organic, 16 oz.
column13: sesame, the little seed that does so much
column14:
Though a little tasteless on its own, tahini is a wonderful item to mix and blend into other ingredients, adding some protein to a vegetarian meal, texture and fullness to a salad dressing, and more.
Mix it with some garlic, seasoning to taste, and a little water or lemon juice for a good cole slaw dressing, or experiment with ingredients to make a dip, for example, blending it with a peeled and seeded cucumber, chopped green onions, dill, garlic, lemon juice and seasonings, or make a pita roll with fresh steamed veggies and tahini...and then of course, there is the ever friendly tahini and jelly sandwich !
For anyone on a "living food" diet (mostly raw foods), or for those who eat meatless meals a large percentage of the time, tahini is a good nutritional additive, and is so adaptable it can be used in anything from soups to oatmeal-raisin cookies.
For those who like middle-eastern food, it is terrific in hummus, and so easy to make: 1 can of chick peas, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, red pepper, parsley and seasoning to taste, blend and serve.
2 Tablespoons contain: 190 calories, 6 grams of protein, 12% dietary fiber, 2% calcium, 10% iron (percent daily values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet).
Maranatha makes their excellent tahini from 100% organic hulled sesame seeds.

column13: Spice It Up for the Holidays
column14:
Blend a little apple cider mix into your Tazo Passion Tea and see what happens. This creates a magical apple cider experience with hints of cranberry and hibiscus flowers gathered in an ancient land.

Snuggle Up Spiced Cider is a good choice because you can then spoon in the exact amount you desire, but packets of cider work equally well. This is the type of tea you would expect to enjoy after skiing in some distant forest where you are also munching on homemade brownies or eggnog cookies. Apple cider also works very well with the Gypsy Teas, especially the Lemon Jasmine.

The deep purple/red color and hibiscus fragrance of Tazo Tea is enough to make anyone passionate about tea. Yet, is this really tea? It looks like tea, but it is really an herbal infusion made by steeping hibiscus flowers, orange peel, licorice, cinnamon, rose hips, lemongrass and red poppy in a swirling of hot water.

The original flavor is also slightly reminiscent of hot apple cider or hot cranberry juice which is why it is extra delicious with a cider mix. Tazo Teas are a mysterious experience into which you can lose yourself with a sense of abandon. So far I've tried more flavors than I can count and have always been impressed.

~The Rebecca Review

If you scroll through the list of ingredients in this yummy little item you will come across tricalcium phosphate.  Tricalcium phosphate, a.k.a., bone-ash is generally used as a filler in dog food.  Enjoy!

There are many orange spice teas available, but there is none like the original MarketSpice Tea from Seattle's Pike Place Market.  It is naturally sweet, and you really do not need sugar.  It's wonderful hot and just as good iced, because it is so strong and sweet.  An aroma and taste that is unforgettable!

column6: Tea, Egyptian Licorice, Part Organic, 16 ct.
column14: I simply adore the experience of treating myself to a cup of this brew.  The name Licorice is misleading.  It has none of the qualities that are usually associated with licorice.(harsh anise, black or red twists and vines) The first sensation you taste is sweet and slightly spicy.  My favorite part is the lingering flavor that 'washes' down the back of your throat.  I don't know of any other way to describe it.  It is a truly divine experience to relax with a cup of this tea.  I have found that it takes the full suggested brewing time to fully develop the flavor.

Emmental and Gruyere cheeses combined with White wine and Brandy as well as spices gives this cheese a wonderfully creamy texture and powerfully great taste.  Keep lots of crusty French bread nearby, as well veggies.  Pre-cook some chicken to go along with this for a full meal.  Just be sure to COOK the chicken.  I like to dip fruits in this.

column6: Coffee, Whole Bean, Hazelnut, Organic, 5# Bulk
column14: This is the smoothest coffee you will ever try. I have been drinking it for a few years now, and whenever I go back to a non organic brand, it tastes too acidic. Try it!

column13: Yeast Infections are Out of Here!
column14: I was suffering from yest infections for several years before my nutritionist recomended this product to me.  The drippy goops and pharmacy pills were not working to curb the problem, it was just treating outbreaks that were likely to happen.  I am allergic to dairy products, so yogurt is out.  Yeast Defense has been exactly what I needed.  My gynocologist says that I have a lot of healthy bacteria, and I have not suffered one yeast infection since starting to use this prodcut nine months ago.  (hint: take this with a double strength acidolphilus bifudus, and you're set!)

I had been eating Valrhona chocolate for years when I first ordered their cocoa powder. I of course had very high expectations. I love it; I have gotten my best friend \\"addicted\\" to it.
It is somewhat unexpected. When I first received it it smelled of green wood. Even hot cocoa smelled of green wood, and I was puzzled. I found out that I needed to adjust my recipe for hot cocoa a bit: I used to drink it with no sugar, no vanilla, whole milk. Valrhona is so powerful and rich that even I like to have the tip of a tea spoon of sugar in it. Adding a vanilla bean is great. Great with half&half. It is not overpowered by orange extract or almond extract.
Great for chocolate cookies too.
This cocoa is \\"dutch\\" processed, which means that it's acidity is lowered during process of obtaining the cocoa powder from the beans. This is general advice: when you read a recipe you have to make sure whether it calls for \\"regular\\" or \\"dutch\\" processed cocoa powder, otherwise it might not work.
Of course this cocoa is for pastry of the highest quality (...)also sold by Amazon in which you can find the most amazing recipes, but I use it to make excellent what I do everyday.
Enjoy!

column6: Milk Chocolate "Jivara" in a Tin Box - 40% Cocoa - 18 Squares
column14:
I want to start out by saying that I am dark-chocolate guy. I usually eat Guanaja from this same brand rather than Jivara. Nonetheless, I have great faith in this brand so I tried it. Although it is milk chocolate (and hence, for me, fatally flawed) it is truly unique milk chocolate, and even a dark-chocolate guy can like it.
First of all, it is the characteristinc Valrhona long lasting flavor effect, that remains into your mouth for one minute or more after you swallaw it.
Second, it is by far the least sweet milk chocolate I ever tried - that's a plus, just in case you have doubts :)
Third, you can feel that caramel was used to replace (in part) ordinary sugar.
All in all, well, if you really prefer milk to dark chocolate, this is a must try. It is still better than dark chocolate of most (but not all, of course) other brands.

El Pato Jalapeño Salsa is a great tasting, versatile tomato product.  The sauce can be used straight out of the can for chip-dipping salsa, or it could be used in a variety of recipes.  For example, it could make a great, spicy sauce for baked chicken.  I've used it in soups and also mixed it with sour cream and served it with tortilla chips.

Not as quick as those classic Herb-ox cubes, but this stuff will give you authentic Japanese flavors for your cooking. This is the base note for proper tempura dipping sauce (also known as tentsuyu). Some people think the flavor is overly fishy but it tastes right to me, the tentsuyu I prepared with this tasted the same as restaurant dipping sauce.
You may wish to strain the results after boiling, but the flavors are right on.

column6: Sampler Pack - Low Carb Chocolate from Ross Chocolates
column14: I'm on Atkins and I've tried a few other brands of chocolates. Yuck. These are very, very good and have the "mouth feel" of good chocolate (creamy and flavorful). I highly recommend these bars!

This stuff is perfect for a camping trip or when you're too lazy to cut your own tofu and green onion to mix with proper miso paste.  My 6 YO son loves it because it's nice and salty.  And how many of us are willing to open a tub of tofu to cut half an ounce of the stuff, anyway?  It's not perfect but it makes up for that in convenience.

column13: Great flavors for a variety of foods
column14: I can't tell you how often we use these products.  Seems that just about every food (and drink) item we prepare can be enhanced by one of these Appalachian Mountain Specialty products.  The Zest Sauce is good on just about everything and can really make a great Bloody Mary.  I love the Mustard Sauce in my tuna salad.  The recipes just get you started!

column13: The best news source there is
column14:
The Economist provides the best insight into American politics - and, unlike, most other American media outlets, explains how decisions in the United States impact the rest of the world, not just America. Also, The Economist leads the news cycle. I have often read an article in The Economist and seen it recycled in The New York Times a week later, then on CNN that night, and then on the network news a few days later. Why settled for a watered-down version of The Economist's original article?
While The Economist is serious (no chance Madonna will ever grace it's over), it does have a humorous side and strong British wit (hence the cover with the cactus giving the finger or the decision to run an obituary of Uday and Qusay Hussein).
Also, while a news outlet having an agenda is nothing new, the frankness with which The Economist acknowledges its slant is rare. (While it is one of the more \\"fair and balance\\" media outlets out there, it would never make such a claim). It's pro freedom (and not in the warped post-9/11 sense): free trades, free markets, and freedom for citizens from government intervention.
Finally, the subscription gives you full access to The Economist's website, which contains a huge archives of articles, along with some reference material.

column13: City Grits is the Best Granola on Earth - Don't Miss it!!!!
column14:
Every City Grits Granola you try is sure to please. This stuff is simply amazing - I have tried all flavors and LOVE all of them. Somehow the freshness just knocks all other granolas out of the running - this is truly the best granola I've ever tasted.
Top picks are the PB&J and Berry; other favorites are Peach Pecan and Cherry Cashew. The Pineapple Ginger is good and unique - especially if you dig ginger. If you live in Seattle, hit the Fremont Sunday Market for samples galore from the very kind local owners/couple - salt of the earth folks who really just want to make a great product for us all to enjoy!

column13: City Grits - Simply the Best Granola On Earth
column14:
Every City Grits Granola you try is sure to please. This stuff is simply amazing - I have tried all flavors and LOVE all of them. Somehow the freshness just knocks all other granolas out of the running - this is truly the best granola I've ever tasted.
Top picks are the PB&J and Berry; other favorites are Peach Pecan and Cherry Cashew. The Pineapple Ginger is good and unique - especially if you dig ginger. If you live in Seattle, hit the Fremont Sunday Market for samples galore from the very kind local owners/couple - salt of the earth folks who really just want to make a great product for us all to enjoy!

column6: Pemaquid Point Lobster Pot Pies, Four Pies
column14:
These lobster treats are stunning. We have never seen anything like them. Wonderful aroma, texture and taste, and the little puff pastry lobster on top is like the flower on a wedding cake, can't decide whether to eat it first or last!
Saw these on Food Finds on the Food Network, ordered from Amazon, can't wait to order more.

The comics aren't funny, in my opinion. Little kids probably like them though, your average bubble gum, nothing special except theres a comic strip in every gum, everyone has eaten one in their lifetime, very common in your local variety store. The taste gets a 5 from me, but I think if you're going to order gum off the net, get something harder to find.

column13: City Grits is the greatest breakfast EVER!
column14:
The PB&J Granola is simply put the greatest thing I've ever eaten for a snack or breakfast (and occasionally dinner :) There are just loads of nuts and fruit, and everything has a great crunch and tons of flavor. I eat 2/3 c. and I am full until lunchtime - keeping me from getting hungry mid-morning hard task for anything in the cereal family. This stuff is fantastic! DON'T MISS IT!
If you live in Seattle, hit the Fremont Sunday Market for samples galore. Other favorites are Berry and Cherry Cashew. The Pineapple Ginger is good too and unique.

column14: This rice is very tasty and the spices pep up most any dish that calls for rice.

column6: Sampler Pack - Low Carb Chocolate from Ross Chocolates
column14: This is the first time I've ever written a review for any product, but I really want people to know how fantastic this chocolate is!  I've just "graduated" from Atkins' Phase 1 and the only problem I've had while on it is wanting chocolate.  I'm not fond at all of their shakes or chocolate syrup (too chemically), though the Atkins ice cream cups are very good, if not exactly just like ice cream. But Ross low-carb chocolate... I could not believe it when I ate a bit after Thanksgiving dinner. There is finally something I can eat that doesn't hurt my diet AND satisfies my (somewhat picky) sweet tooth.  No chemical taste, no aftertaste, no gritty texture. The dark chocolate bar and the orange milk chocolate bar are all I've had so far but I absolutely plan to work my way through all of them.  These are excellent.  Excellent.  Excellent.

column6: Hot & Spicy Cooking From Asian Cuisines Gift for the Cook, Chef - Includes Book, Spices, Chili Pastes
column14: The Indian Barbeque Collection was a big hit as a gift (and I got one for myself)!  Folks are always looking for a new taste for old favorites and theses unique flavors add greatly to any grilled meat or vegetable.

Quinoa. Often sold in the bulk bin in your favorite natural foods supermarket, quinoa is a gluten-free grain that hails from the Andes. Pronounced KEEN-WA, this versatile grain is tasty in as a side dish or in casseroles, and can even be sautéed with vegetables.
This is a great food for your soul! And for those who choose the Atkins diet, this is an excellent substitute for regular bread grains.

we just received our first order from this company. the lobster rolls are best! can't find these down in houston. based on this first purchase we intend to order some of the other items along with another order of lobster rolls!

column6: Omaha Steaks 1 (2 lbs.) King Crab Legs
column14:
This product ships in great packaging and it looks good, but the taste... horrible. In fact, there is not much one can do wrong with good fresh crab legs, just steam/boil, and freeze to ship. They added salt to the legs while cooking so much so that it tasted not only bad in my opinion, but my cat did not eat them either.
So, save your money, and go to any local store that carries the king crab legs, I bet you they are not worse then the ones I had to throw away.
I loved the packaging on this - I brought it as a dinner gift and everyone was going crazy - the nuts were soooo fresh!!!  Its really an unbelievable product.

column13: "You put peanut butter in my chocolate!"
column14: I can't remember a time when I didn't like Reese's Peanut Butter Cups.  They are one of my favorite candies from my childhood and I still eat them (albeit occasionally) as an adult.  The design of the peanut butter cups is rather simple:  a layer of milk chocolate surrounds a center whose primary ingredient is peanut butter.  The result is a fantastic marriage whose combined flavor can put the taste buds into a state of euphoria (if you're not careful!).  Of course, being weight conscious, eating a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup is a treat for me today.  In my humble opinion, Reese's Peanut Butter Cups are one of the best confections ever created!  Hence, I rate them with a resounding 5 out of 5 stars!  Just be careful not to eat too many if you're concerned about your waistline.
We live in the Auvergne region of France and this is the most fantastic cheese. Perfect for any meal and a great cheese to enjoy with a nice red wine! Enjoy!

column6: Hershey Milk Chocolate with Almonds, 1.45-Ounce Bars (Pack of 36)
column13: Hershey�s Famous Milk Chocolate With Delicious Almonds
column14: I have enjoyed Hershey's chocolate bars from the time that I was a child.  My two favorites are Hershey's Dark Chocolate and Hershey's Milk Chocolate with Almonds.  The combination of Hershey's sweet milk chocolate with chunks of whole almonds was a confectionary landmark that, in my opinion, only enhances the flavors of both.  Of course, being a bit weight conscious today, I don't eat Hershey's chocolate bars as often as I did in my childhood, but that doesn't alter my rating of them with a resounding 5 out of 5 stars!  Just be careful not to eat too many if, like me, you're concerned about your waistline.
I tasted these Pistachio Nuts and I must say they were out of this world!  I am a big Pistachio fan and I really enjoyed what I purchased - would definetly recommend it to anyone!

These stone crab claws were as good as those served at the famous Joe's in Miami Beach.  They arrived as promised, overnight and COLD -- and uniformly sized as advertised (some other shippers slip in one or two smaller claws).  Discipline was required to wait until dinner time!!  The meat was tender, succulent and absolutely DELICIOUS.  The included mustard sauce was a bit unusual -- we detected a hint of horseradish; a very interesting and tasty novelty.  Compared to some other stone crab shippers, the price was fair, the service was excellent.  If you like stone crab --- what are you waiting for?!  You can have them on your table tomorrow!

column6: igourmet Gruyere AOC - Pound Cut (15.5 ounce)
column13: Not the usual kind of Swiss cheese
column14:
If you like cheese - and I'm not talking about the kind you mindlessly slap on a hamburger or sprinkle over a side dish at the salad bar - you'll love Gruyere.
My wife, who is Swiss, introduced me to Gruyere cheese via fondue (where it's traditionally encountered) when we were living in Europe. But when we had some left over one weekend, I tried a slice of it with a green apple ... and the rest is history. I simply fell in love with it.
Gruyere is a gourmet cheese and it's price reflects that fact. So be careful, it's expensive ... and not for the obsessive calorie counter. But if your pallet is discriminating and you enjoy fine, quality foods, then indulge yourself. You won't regret anything except the fact that you didn't buy more!
PS: Have a good white wine ready if you plan to make fondue, or a good red wine ready if you have a slice with some fruit! Bon Apetite!

column6: A Taste of Thai Coconut Milk, 13.5 fl oz
column13: the perfect choice for Madras soup
column14:
Other than drinking it straight out of the can (which trust me, is easily do-able!), I have had one practical use for "A Taste of Thai" coconut milk - for making Madras soup. An east Indian dish, Madras soup (named after the town of Madras) is a combination of tomato juice, coconut milk, shredded coconut and various spices.
I have been serving it hot on cold holidays and always get requests for the recipe. Getting "A Taste of Thai" sure beats cracking your own coconuts and getting the milk the hard way. No extra sweeteners are added - just the natural, subtle sweet goodness of coconut.
My less than perfect rating is for the lack of a warning to shake before opening and stir well before pouring. The contents settle when sitting on a shelf, so the coconut "meat" portion which is much thicker, rests on the bottom while the thinner viscosity portion pours right out. If you don't stir it well or use the entire can in your recipe, the remaining portion will not be good for much and spoils within a few days of being opened.

column13: The ONLY News and Infomation source worth examining
column14: In this age of Left Wing dominated print media and Right Wing dominated television and radio media, it is increasingly imperative to find a source of unbiased (or at least equally biased) international news and information.  The Economist is the only media outlet I have found that delivers not only in-depth and, in most cases, highly researched articles, but also gives equal print time to most voices in the arenas of politics, economics, nationalism, and race.  If your main source of information is not The Economist, then your viewpoints are, quite possibly, a mere facsimile of someone else's propaganda.

column6: Cookies, Ginger w/Sliced Almonds, Wheat Free, Gluten Free, 7.25 oz.
column14: This cookie has a wonderfully strong ginger flavor, and is not very sweet. The almonds give the taste and texture just enough variety.  The consistency is very dense, and just a bit dry; they go excellently with a glass of milk (if you can drink it) or a cup of herbal tea.

There's Key Lemon Pie, Peanut Butter, Cherry Cheesecake, you name it. The flavors are for real. They last for over an hour. I thought that was an exaggeration, but it is not. A perfect and ORIGINAL gift for a family, a loved one or a client. I got a tree of lollipops at my desk... everyone comes in and talks here more often now. I wonder why. :o) They are great.

Plase do not buy this novelty product.

Red beans and rice is such a simple dish. Everybody in New Orleans eats it on Mondays, from cab drivers and port workers to businesspeople and Tulane kids.

New Orleaneans (native or adopted, displaced or otherwise) know that red beans and rice is a very subtle dish. The beans at Dunbar's, Mother's, and Ye Olde College Inn (all famous for the dish) are all different, and everybody's mother has her own recipe, too. There are many variables involved in getting it to come out just right, from the choice of meat to the number of bay leaves to add to the pot.

The most important is in choosing beans. Red beans and rice cooked by displaced New Orleaneans elsewhere doesn't always come out as creamy as people in the city are used to--often they're thick and starchy and the beans need to be put in a blender to get anything resembling the gravy in the authentic dish. One reason for this is that Americans outside of New Orleans and the Deep South really don't eat beans, red or otherwise, and the beans sit on the shelf and toughen. The second reason is that the \\"red kidney bean\\" popular in New Orleans is not the same thing as the kidney bean used in three-bean salad or Texas chili. It's smaller, hence it cooks faster, gets creamier faster, and has a more intense color and flavor.

Camellia beans are authentic Louisiana red beans--the small variety--and they're probably the most popular in New Orleans. They enjoy such a good reputation because they're almost invariably fresh and they produce the creamy pot of beans that, more than any other dish, reminds us of New Orleans.

column6: Aceto Balsamico Tradizionale -- Affinato Aged 20-30 Years
column14:
I plunked down my $80 for a bottle of the Pedroni \\"Affinato\\" (\\"Affinity\\") balsamic vinegar and was sadly disappointed. To begin with, it comes with a catalog from A. G. Ferrari Foods which tells you that's it's been aged for \\"at least 12 years,\\" NOT 20 YEARS as stated above. Whoops, a bad omen. The next bad omen is this: Nowhere on the box or the bottle does it actually have the name \\"Affinato\\" or the real age. It does say Aceto Balsamico Tradizionale, but at this price, I like the label on the product to tell me that it is what I thought I ordered. And I like to know that they keep track of their aging process better than my wife does (we're celebrating her 39th birthday for the 10th time).
Bad omen number three: When you swirl it around in the bottle, it does coat the inside of the glass briefly - but it is NOT as thick as syrup. Now, one of the selling points for aceto balsamico that has been awarded the \\"Tradizionale\\" designation is that \\"the real stuff,\\" as Ferrari's catalog calls it, is as thick as syrup and a few luxurious (Ferrari's adjective is \\"voluptuous\\") drops on a slice of Parmigiano Reggiano will give your palate intense pleasure. Hmmm. Well, the proof of the pudding is in the tasting. Let's open it.
My wife and I tried it on the finest Parmigiano Reggiano that money can buy and the most perfect strawberries we could find. Conclusion: The \\"Affinato\\" vinegar is sweet-and-sour but not exceptionally complex, and it more or less detracts from the natural taste of a plain strawberry. On quality Parmesan cheese it is better - but again, we decided we'd rather enjoy the perfection of the Reggiano cheese on its own. I do think it would go very well with avocado, but we didn't have one handy.
Complexity is the point. Aceto balsamico becomes complex when it is moved from one kind of barrel to another during the aging process. It spends a few years in oak barrels, then moves on to another kind of wood (they never tell you exactly what) and so on. From each type of wood it's supposed to pick up subtle nuances of flavor. It's like winemaking, where for example aging a chardonnay in French oak barrels makes it lose some of its chalky-tasting tannic acid and absorb some of the vanillin that occurs naturally in the wood. That added vanilla taste gives us what we call an \\"oaky\\" chardonnay. Alas, the \\"Affinato\\" vinegar is not oaky, not mysteriously subtle, it's just a very good sweet-and-sour vinegar.
They also say you can sip it. Fair warning: if you do that, the fumes go up your nose and it makes you cough. Hey, it's still vinegar. The best use of the \\"Affinato\\" is to make an oil-and-vinegar salad dressing with extra virgin olive oil and a kiss of garlic, and in that application it makes a truly outstanding dressing. Lip-smacking.
My wife and I have been using \\"balsamic vinegar\\" that's in the $20 - $25 range for many years. We looked forward with great anticipation to this step-up to a true \\"Tradizionale\\" aceto balsamico at 3 times the price. The Tradizionale designation is the equivalent of the "Premier Grand Cru" designation that's awarded to top Bordeaux wines - like Chateau Lafite Rothchild or Chateau Haut Brion - and we were expecting something on that level, where every sip gives you subtle new surprises in flavor. We didn't get it.
One more thing. Though neither the Ferrari catalog nor the product description above tells you how much you're getting in a bottle of Affinato, it's 100 milliliters (3 fluid ounces). As for product information, even if you can read Italian, the type font on the label is so small that it literally takes a magnifying glass to read it.
Let me add that I write this negative review reluctantly. I am one of Amazon.com's greatest fans. I greatly value Amazon's unique democracy of customer reviews and spend at least a couple thousand dollars a year on Amazon.com. I've contributed positive, five-star reviews ofbooks and CDs that are really special. This negative review does not in the least weaken my faith in Amazon, but in this case the product discription is misleading.
Who knows, maybe you'd be better off spending your hard-earned money on Ferrari's $150 Extra Vecchio (\\"Extra Age\\") balsamic, which the catalog states is \\"aged for at least 25 years\\" (not 30 years as stated above). As for me, I can't afford the experiment. And so far, what I've tasted from the Merchants of Modena has not lived up to the legend or the hype.

column6: O Olive Oil - Meyer Lemon California Citrus Oil
column13: Imparts wonderful, light flavor to dishes
column14: I discovered these oils years ago, bought one of each flavor, and was thunderstruck at the quality. I use these in place of vegetable or olive oil whenever a dish calls for a similar flavor ingredient (to give it the extra flavor "kick"), but I found myself using them sparingly since I didn't know where to find more when they're gone! I'm almost out of the bottles I bought (just opened 2 of them, and they're fresh as ever!) and was thrilled to see them available on Amazon! The Lemon oil makes a wonderful Greek Saganaki (flamed Feta or Kaseri cheese), the Lime oil is fantastic for Thai cooking and it's many lime-based dishes, and the Orange oil I use in Salmon marinades, as well as with Oriental stir-fry & Chinese duck--I may even try it in making Duck a L'Orange! I don't recall what I paid when I initially purchased them, but as gourmet oils are pricey to begin with, I would consider this a reasonable price, especially considering Amazon's free shipping & the convenience of to-your-door delivery! The bottles are also attractive to display, & are so tall & slim that they take up very little space on your counter. Treat yourself to these oils!
