column13: TRY ARBUCKLE'S YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED!!!!
column14: Arbuckle's is a local company, they make the best coffee ever!  I don't think I could even pick which flavor is my absolute favorite.  My local grocery store always carried Arbuckles coffee, and suddenly decided to switch to another brand, it was terrible!  I will go out of my way to always buy arbuckles coffee instead of another brand.  I even called my local store to complain and they had already gotten calls from other people too, needless to say, the store is back to carrying my favorite brand.

column13: Best world news and business coverage available anywhere
column14: By far the best magazine I have ever read, at least for my tastes. The mix of foreign policy and international relations, business, macroeconomics, and current events is ideal for me.  Sure, it might lean a bit to the right, but what periodical doesn't lean one way or another?  The lean is relatively slight compared to the leftward leaning of most other periodicals.

column6: Downey's 4 pack Sampler: Amaretto Italian Liqueur, Lemon Vodka Cake, Coffee Liqueur and Irish Whiskey Cakes
column14: Downey's cakes are the best ever!  They are super moist and extremely flavorful.  The Chambord French Raspberry is my favorite.  These cakes are perfect for company or as a sweet treat with coffee.  You won't be disappointed in these high quality cakes.

column6: Kasugai Roasted Hot Wasabi Flavor Green Peas
column14: These things are pretty good! If you're looking for something new and unique to snack on, I'd definitely try these. In terms of flavor, they're like big spicy wasabi flavored sunflower seeds, without the shell. I think I've found my new snack food of choice.

column6: Sampler Pack - Low Carb Chocolate from Ross Chocolates
column14: I just tried this company's chocolates, and handed out various flavors to co-workers for opinions.  This is incredible chocolate and I actually prefer it to any other chocolate I've had in quite a while!  Everything about it tastes, feels, and smells just like high-end chocolate, it's completely satisfying -- and each bar is about 1/2 the calories of a typical candybar!  It doesn't have junk in it (chemicals etc.-sweetener is maltitol, which is a safe sugar derivative)-seems surprisingly healthy for candy.  Also -- I placed an order and received in 3 days!  The flavors are awesome -- cherry tastes like chocolate-covered cherries only better (no chemical taste); orange equally incredible; mint strong but not overwhelming the chocolate flavors -- just try them!

column6: Butter Rum flavored whole bean coffee - 12 ounce package
column14: Arbuckle's is a local company, they make the best coffee ever!  I don't think I could even pick which flavor is my absolute favorite.  My local grocery store always carried Arbuckles coffee, and suddenly decided to switch to another brand, it was terrible!  I will go out of my way to always buy arbuckles coffee instead of another brand.  I even called my local store to complain and they had already gotten calls from other people too, needless to say, the store is back to carrying my favorite brand.
I like this flavor, but it kind of reminds me a Jello Pudding Bites and those things are just nasty. I mostly use this one for 'recipes' to create new flavors.
I do not like this one at all! I'm really glad I can order my favorite flavors without getting ones like licorice.

column13: You haven't truly lived until you've tried 'em
column14: The mastic flavor is popular in middle eastern cultures and, rest assured, it will blow you away! The aromatic resin of the mastic tree is used especially in varnishes, lacquers, adhesives, condiments and as an astringent.
This one is nice. I like using it in the 'recipes' for a root beer float. Too bad they can't put the fizz in a jelly bean.

column6: Sugar Free Sizzling Cinnamon Jelly Belly
column14: Cinnamon is my favorite Jelly Belly flavor. I like being able to get my favorite flavors without having to get all the really gross ones in a sample box.

I have one of these and wanted to get one for my mother-in-law who appreciates good coffee but who can't be bothered with having to brew a whole pot.  I've looked locally, but haven't been able to find it ... and voila, here it is!  Search no more!  This little jobby makes great tasting coffee ... just scoop in a few tablespoons and pour over hot water, and enjoy.  I can't stand the flavor of the inexpenive coffee we brew at work so I keep one of these in my drawer at the office.  Now I can make GOOD coffee at a fraction the cost of one of the coffee stores.  I also use it while camping or traveling.  Enjoy your coffee!

This is a flavored vinegar.  It is to be used to perk up lots of foods where vinegar is an appropriate seasoning.  In the South, it is most often used to season turnip, collard, or mustard greens but it can be added any greens including salads. It's quite tasty.  The peppers are very intense.

column6: Cabot Vermont Lite White Cheddar - 10 to 11 LB Loaf
column14: I've tried most if not all of the "lite" cheddars on the market and Cabot's beats them all.  Its texture is closer to that of full-fat cheddar by far; none of that rubbery feel here.  The flavor is distinctly cheddar, not as sharp as the best full-fat extra sharp cheddars, but it definitely has a presence and stands up to mustard (other lite cheddars tend to taste like American cheese).  We use this for nachos, cheese omelets, and grilled cheese sandwiches.  It melts with grace.  It is good to eat straight, as I've learned when I get it out to shred--people show up and carve off slices, never complaining that it is "lite."  I do recommend sharing the 10-pound loaf with friends if you have a small household--after a month or so, an opened package, even one that has been carefully wrapped, may suffer some mold.

I bought these preserves when i lived in Spain, and they are the best.  You absolutely must try them - they are real fruit, and simply wonderful.  I've tried Bon Maman, which I didn't really care for.  The peach is quite delictible, as well as the apricot and four berries if you can find them.

This is definitely a cute product to order.  You get a nice amount of candy for your money, the candy comes wrapped in a cute bag with a nice sticker on it and it is very fresh.  This makes a cute stocking stuffer for anyone!

I've drank Market Spice tea for years, and it is definitely my favorite tea.  I'm so glad I can order it on the internet now. Since I seldom go to Pike Place Market I was only able to get Market Spice Tea when I happen to run into it at a store.  I'm looking forward to trying other Market Spice items now that I have easy access to them.
By far you are getting the most pounds for your dollar, for nice packaging. Priced right and can be given as a gift.

This is definitely a cute product to order.  You get a nice amount of candy for your money, the candy comes wrapped in a cute bag with a nice sticker on it and it is very fresh.  This makes a cute stocking stuffer for anyone!

I have relied on these cake mixes for a few years and find them to be handy and to taste fine.  As with most sugar free products they taste great if you have not been eating sugar, but taste a little off if you switch straight from eating full sugar/fat desserts.  The cake mixes only require water to make.  The first lemon flavored Sweet `N Low cake I made was adequate but did not have any fresh tart lemon flavor.  The next time I tried using half lemon juice and half water and something very strange happened to the texture, it felt like a sponge.  Not a sponge cake but a dish sponge.  I keep trying to find the right amount of lemon juice to add and have not hit on it yet.  If you do not mind a mild and slightly artificial lemon flavor, than this is a great product.  For first time users I wish that the product description here specified that these mixes make a single thin eight-inch layer.  My local grocery store sells the mixes for $2.79 and rarely has flavors other than chocolate or yellow so the price and variety offered here is wonderful news.

While Pesto Genovese is my favorite pesto for capelli d'angeli, my family and I love this pesto on crostini. In fact, it's become a staple in our house and a regular at mealtimes.
Sun dried tomatoes tend to have more "tang" than other tomatoes and this pesto will certainly give your crostini added spiciness. Don't get me wrong, you don't have to use this pesto on crostini alone. That's just our favorite way of using it. It would be great on pasta, too.
If you love tomatoes, especially sun dried tomatoes, I don't think you can go wrong with this pesto. I recommend it highly.

column13: Tastes great for what it is
column14: I have relied on these cake mixes for a few years and find them to be handy and to taste fine.  As with most sugar free products they taste great if you have not been eating sugar, but taste a little off if you switch straight from eating full sugar/fat desserts.  The cake mixes only require water to make. A teaspoon of real vanilla or almond extract improves the flavor.  I like to make the chocolate cake with iced coffee.  Then rather than use sugar free frosting (ugggh!) I sprinkle the top with either unsweetened cocoa or with chopped coffee beans.  The bitterness of the cocoa and the coffee beans enhances the sweetness of the cake. These mixes make a very thin eight-inch layer.  My local grocery store sells the mixes for $2.79 and rarely has flavors other than chocolate or yellow so the price and variety offered here is wonderful news.

This company has perfected the art of roasting and combined that with state of the art packaging procedures.  These are the CRITICAL moments in any coffee bean's life and Fairwinds coffee carries this care in its flavor.  On top of that, they are socially responsible.  Highly recommended.
This cheese is soft, a bit runny just inside the rind, then rich and flaky in the center.  It is a mild goat cheese, but nonetheless flavorful.  Delicious!

This frosting is sweet, and it is low in calories.  Whenever I come across the term "cloying" I think of this frosting.  It is sweet and sticky and has an obvious chemical taste.  I also have had difficulty obtaining a frosting like consistency.  I enjoy using the Sweet 'N Low cake mixes so the first few times I used this product I assumed I had not followed the directions properly. (Okay, so the directions were basically to add water and beat.)  If you have to have sugar free frosting on your cake I suggest using the Sans Sucre brand dessert mousse mix and spreading it quickly on the cake as you would a whipped frosting.

column6: Kona Hawaiian Coffee Gifts, Coffee Samplers and K-cup Gift Samplers, from Aloha Island Coffee by Artisan Handcrafted, Inc.
column14:
Many coffee brands that advertise their beans as "Kona" are blends, containing only ten percent beans from the highly desirable region, but these Aloha Island Gold beans are pure Kona, all from plants grown on the Big Island in the designated microclimate that produces some of the smoothest coffee beans in the world. While the Aloha brand may not be Hawaii's best, it is certainly one of the more available brands on the mainland. Store in the freezer to maintain optimal freshness, and grind the beans immediately before brewing.
For coffee connoisseurs, two phrases light up their eyes, "Jamaican Blue Mountain" and "Kona." If you want to give a gift sure to impress a sophisticated coffee drinker, you've found your beans.

column6: Copper River Reserve Smoked Sockeye Salmon, 20 oz. Fillet
column13: BEST SMOKED SALMON I'VE EVER HAD!!!
column14: I discovered this amazing smoked salmon when I recently purchased the Copper River Reserve 7 oz. jars.  I gave it to my father for his birthday and ended up eating almost all of it myself!  So, I bought a few 20 oz. fillets for myself so I'd be prepared for the holiday season . . . but I've eatin them already!!!  I've had other brands of smoked salmon which claim to be from the Copper River, but this is by far the best I've ever had.  This Christmas, I plan on giving this salmon to everyone in my family!  Thanks Bear Creek.
I am a regular customer of the Hot Tequila Beans and Hot Tequila Tips.  If you haven't tryed them you should.  Your missing an experience.

Having tried many Jasmine blends, I found the Dragon Pearl blend basically the same as regular Jasmines but for the novelty of the leaves being rolled into tight little dried "pearls" which unfurl when infusing.  As far as I can tell, this does nothing to enchance the flavor of the brew.  It's a nice Jasmine blend, but nothing more.  I would recommend it for Jasmine lovers.

column6: Chocolate Assortment Gift Box, Assorted Chocolates and Chocolate Covered Nuts, Milk, Dark and White Chocolate Truffles, Milk Chocolate Roasted Pecans, Pecan Pralines, Best Assortment and Sampling of Chocolates and Chocolate Covered Nuts, Box of Chocolates, Truffles and Nuts.
column14:
This is truly "THE BEST COFFEE" and believe me I am a COFFEE LOVER! I've never ordered Aloha thru Amazon simply because my office is directly across from the store in Beverly Hills. I had no idea that they sold Aloha online so just imagine my excitement when I saw this. Oh well, I guess my secret is out.
Well, I'm definitely an advocate of this brand simply because I'm tired of the trendy "Starbucks" phenomenon. From talking with them at the store, this is positively 100% Kona coffee. So for all you out there who don't know your coffee, THIS IS THE REAL THING! It is absolutely a better bean. Good for you guys! Can't wait to tell you about this on Monday.

As much as my family and I love cheese from Italy and Spain, we love French cheese more. France is a country that produces more than 100 cheeses, so it must have been difficult to choose only four for this assortment, but in my opinion, four of the very best were chosen.
We are all watching our weight at my house, so we eat a lot of salads. While cheese is definitely not a "diet food," a little in a salad goes a long way, especially when you're using Buche Chevre. My children love it on crackers as well.
My wife and I reserved the chaource and the epoisses for a "wine and cheese" party, but believe me, they are so wonderful and so special, you'll be tempted to eat them anytime, party or not.
The Gruyère de Comté is just so special I can't really find words to describe it. It's rich. It's creamy. It's delectable. We often eat it as a dessert cheese. Yes, it's really that good!
If you're looking for a special gift, you can't go wrong with this French Cheese Assortment. These are four of the finest cheese France has ever produced.

column6: The Crab Place In Shell Chesapeake Bay Oysters, 1 Dozen
column14:
With the holidays coming up soon, my wife and I will be hosting quite a few dinner parties and there's nothing we like better as one of our appetizers than these oysters.
I've found these oysters to have a sweet and buttery taste, which I really love. We serve them raw or barely cooked and I really can't get enough of them. I could make a meal on them, but I try to behave and save some for my guests.
These oysters are an elegant food, not meant for everyday. Just knowing they're on the menu helps to put me in a festive, party mood. Many of our guests have told us that one of the things they love most about our dinner parties are the oyster appetizers.
If you've never served oysters as an appetizer to an elegant meal before, you can't go wrong with these. They will make your meal so much more delicious and so much more memorable. But one caveat: Be ready when guests ask you the next time...Are you having oysters?

column6: Spanish Cheese Assortment 2 Pound Hand Cut Imported from Spain
column14:
Everyone in my family loves cheese and we especially love French and Spanish cheeses. We recently received this cheese assortment as a gift and we really loved all of them.
Our favorite cheese in this group was definitely the Manchego. It was decadently rich and creamy and the flavor transported me back to the days when I was a student, hitchhiking my way across Europe.
Neither my wife nor I had ever had the Mahon Reserva, but we really liked it. It's sharp and tangy, so we ate it in much smaller portions than the Manchego. We had never had the Idiazabal, either, and I have to say this smoky cheese has become one of our family's favorite, rivaling even the Manchego. It's perfect for cooler weather or to nibble on with an apple, a loaf of crusty bread and a glass of full-bodied Rioja.
The Murcia al Vino was divine. This is a special cheese and one that we love sharing with friends. All of the cheeses in this Spanish Cheese Assortment make a wonderful gift for yourself or for the cheese lovers in your life.

column6: Natural Basil Pesto from Genova (Pesto Genovese)
column14:
Pesto Genovese is, without a doubt, my favorite pesto. My family and I eat it on capelli d'angeli at least once every week. We add a salad and a loaf of crusty Italian bread and the meal is simple but delicious beyond compare.
This brand of Pesto Genovese is one of my alltime favorites. So many times, Peste Genovese can be too oily, covering up the taste of the basil and the pine nuts. Not so with this pesto. Every ingredient seems to be perfectly balanced so you get the freshest, most flavorful Pesto Genovese available. The taste of the basil and the pine nuts is delicate, but so exquisite.
If you like Pesto Genovese or just want a change from more "traditional" tomato sauces, I urge you to give this pesto a try. I don't think you can go wrong.

If you've never had real Swiss fondue, you're really missing something special. My only regret is that I live in an area that usually doesn't get cold enough to really enjoy fondue to its fullest. To compensate (and because we love winter), my wife and I often go to the mountains where it does snow and when we do, one of the first things we enjoy is Swiss fondue.
I've found that the cheeses in this assortment make a wonderful and very authentic Swiss fondue. Just be sure to have a loaf of crusty French bread handy as well as white wine and kirsch. And don't skimp on the kirsch; it really makes the fondue special.
My family and I have found that fondue is best served the traditional Swiss way...as a main course. It's just too filling for an appetizer and just so good you want to eat your fill! There's nothing quite as relaxing as a good fondue on a cold winter's night. This cheese assortment is the first really authentic fondue assortment I've found since my days of backpacking and hitchhiking around Europe.
I really can't praise this cheese assortment highly enough. You really have to make a fondue yourself and taste how good it is to believe it. Try it! Please! Once you do, you'll become an addict!

This pie is delicious. Full of  crawfish and crab with wonderful seasoning in a flaky crust. I have lived in New Orleans and eaten all the fabulous food, so I know real Cajun cuisine. My son and I both thoroughly enjoy eating this for a treat. On the down side, it is not low in calories, which is probably why it tastes so good.

column6: Copper River Reserve Smoked Sockeye Salmon, Three 7 oz. Jars
column13: THE BEST SMOKED SALMON I'VE EVER HAD!!!
column14:
I have had smoked salmon from all over the world, even some other brands of salmon from the Copper River in Alaska. But I have to say, "Copper River Reserve" is by far the best I've ever had! I gave it to my father for his birthday because the packaging was just so beautiful, but when he shared it with me, I couldn't stop eating it!
I'm happy to say that this Christmas will be very easy to buy presents, because I'm going to buy this smoked salmon for everyone in my family. And I know they'll love it!

column6: Pacifica Culinaria's Blood Orange Avocado Oil
column14: This oil has so many uses. I use it with bbq salmon. It gives corn bread a delicious zest, and is great in salad dressings too! It gives everything a wonderful, subtle taste of orange. A must have item in my kitchen - I'm addicted!

column13: Something good and crunchy for snacking
column14:
I'm a big fan of rice crackers in general. I like the thin, crisp texture of them and the snappy crunch when you eat them. This flavor is very good with a great balance of saltiness to perk it up.
Alot of crackers are quite bland in flavor and while they may be flaky in the sense of baked products do not have the crispy mouth feel of these. I love these added to a cheese platter (with milder, less sharp cheeses). These also are good added to a home made party mix recipe(once you are done with the baking and seasoning of the party mix...these don't need the baking of flavoring).
These arent the kind of crackers I reach for when I want to add crackers to soup or just want to eat mindlessly in front of the TV (due to cost) but I love these as part of an hors d'ourve, light lunch or small snack. I love their punchy adult taste and crunchy texture.

This particular feta comes from northern Greece, specifically the Epirus region. It is not hard like the horrible american cow's milk type of feta, instead coming across as creamy and slightly soft. As a chef and a Greek, it's the only feta that I buy. Use it in salads, cheese pies or even by itself with a little bread and olive oil. Amazon needs to correct the name of it though. It's Dodoni, not Dodino.

I love hot food. I'm also a big beef jerky fan. I make my own and, when too lazy, I search out the net. With Zipsticks I think I've found a home. The Habanero heat not as hot as I've dealt with. It's a nice heat that won't cause the forhead to break-out in a sweat. Very flavourful and very well done in the drying process. These things are GREAT and so is the seller. Also, this is one of my first purchases in the new Gormet section. So far so good. Very good sellers in this new section.
Enjoy! I have been.

column6: TZO149899 - Tazo Tea Bags Earl Grey
column13: Tea is Great, Price is Bitter
column14: I love Earl Grey tea and have recently discovered the great TAZO blend. It's probably one of the best "brands" around. But you have to be kidding on the price!! I can take a 5 minute walk to my neighborhood Starbucks where one box (of 24 bags) costs around $4.50. Multiply that by this 6 box bundle and you get $27.00. So what am I paying the extra 2 bucks for, not the dispenser--which is just a cardboard-like box the tea comes! You've got to be kidding me. I thought things were supposed to be cheaper in bulk. C'mon Amazon! You can do better.

column6: Joseph's Lite Sugar Free Coconut Cookies 11 oz. bag
column14: A bit over a 16 months ago I had gastric bypass surgery.  As a result I cannot tolerate refined sugars.  Over the past six months I have been trying out different sugar free and no-sugar added cookies, candies etc.  A few months back, from a local discount store, I bought and tried Joseph's cookies (including these coconut ones) and they were wonderful!  Alas, when I went back to buy some more the store no longer had any.  I have searched my three more popular nearby grocery stores but none carry Joseph's (I shall be asking them to do so!)  So I am thrilled to discover these cookies available thru Amazon!  Thanks.

column6: China Mist Leaves Pure Teas Ginger Ginseng Herbal Tea Bag- 25 CT
column14: I first tried this tea after dinner at a restaurant in Napa and was instantly hooked.  It is wonderfully fragrant and delicious and I'm not typically a big tea drinker. The only place I've been able to find it was a Dean and Deluca in Napa - quite a drive from San Jose just for tea.  I'm thrilled to see it available on Amazon!!

Lots and lots of a great candy. This is the same as the the Ginger People's "ginger chews, original, 3oz" also offered by ShopNatural, but this is a 5kg box. Tasty and pretty addictive, which is why I bought it in this quantity. Check out the Ginger People web site for recipes and info about their products.
One thing to be careful of -- I'm told that these types of candies will go somewhat stale after about a month unless stored in an airtight container. When you buy the 5kg, it comes in one giant bag in a box, so after you get it you should divide it in individual baggies so that you can save the rest for later. Or share the candy with lots of friends (or just eat it all yourself within a month. ;-) Repackaged, it should stay fresh for up to a year.

column6: igourmet Sbrinz AOC by Rolf Beeler (7.5 ounce)
column14: My favorite of all swiss cheeses.  Age gives it tiny crunchie  crystals.  But the best part is the hint of sweetness.

column6: Espressione Classic Coffee Pods, Box of 150
column14:
We just received the 100% arabica coffee pods from ESPRESSIONE...they are fantastic. I prefer a good, hearty, european espresso and this coffee fit the bill perfectly.
We did some research on this coffee from Espressione and learned many things. It is made from 100% superior Arabica coffee beans, electronically sorted to insure that only the best are chosen. Roasted perfectly and air-cooled, ground and packed into precisely measured pods. Then sealed in a pressurized, modified atmosphere to enhance the aroma and insure freshness. The ESPRESSIONE single-serve espresso pods are designed to drop into your home espresso machine one at a time. There's no mess and no fuss. Just be sure to use an E.S.E compatible espresso machine.
It's like having the aroma and taste of Italy in the privacy of your own home. We recommend that you try these coffee pods (we have tried the espresso blend and decaf-both are also great) to enjoy not only the quality, but also the ease in making a quality espresso.

column6: China Mist Leaves Pure Teas Toasted Rice Green Hot Tea Bags
column13: Who Knew Green Tea Could Taste so DELICIOUS
column14: I recently tried this tea and was impressed from the first sip: it has a nutty complexity that does not get in the way of the satisfying, well-rounded green tea flavor.  Doesn't need sugar, honey -- anything!  What a find!

This will make you think you're in Southern Louisiana with out actually being there!!!!Moist and mouthwatering,!!!!Simply put !!!!"DELICIOUS"!!!! Great Holiday meal!!!! I Know because I ordered one along with a regular Turducken last year!!!!Hey [I] wouldn't lie to ya!!!!!!

column6: Earl Grey Supreme Tea, Loose Tea by the Pound
column14: If you like Earl Grey tea, you'll find no better than Harney & Son's blends. But once you've tried the Earl Grey Supreme you won't be able to live without it. All others will seem washed out by comparison.

column13: Pacific Rim - Thai Kitchen Fish Sauce
column14: Very tasty and the customer service I received from Pacific Rim Gourmet was excellent as well. No problems and shipping was very fast. I highly recommend Pacific Rim Gourmet for all of your gourmet food needs.

column6: Tazo Sweet Cinnamon Spice Herbal Tea Filterbags with Dispenser, Six (6) 24-Count Filterbags (144 Bags Total)
column13: The BEST tea I have ever had!
column14: This is hands down the best tea that I have ever had!  It was so sweet and cinnamony... it didn't need a drop of sugar!  Don't pass this one up... it is a must have!  Buy in bulk and give the extras as gifts!
I buy this at our neighborhood supermarket.  It really is the best soymilk - best flavor, best texture, everything.

I eagerly look forward to the Hollywood Show Biz Expo every year, because Mrs. Beasley muffin and cake samples are handed out by companies trying to interest moviemakers in hiring them to cater their next production. These are really good! I'm delighted to find a source for odering these cakes online.

This sauce will change the way you think about BBQ sauce. Once you try it, all the mass market sauces are a thing of the past. Kraft, smaft; Bullseye, smhullseye - these are you new best friend. The Rich & Mild is a fantastic sauce with a great blend of spices, dark molasses and honey. If you like a little heat (in the words of a famous TV chef \\"Kick it up a notch\\"), the Hot & Spicy is your sauce. The Chipotle peppers are roasted, so they are not too hot - juuuust enough to add a little heat to the mix. The Teriyaki is a great marinade for quick meals. Just marinade for a 1/2 hour to 1 hour and place on your local BBQ. I heat a few ounces and pour it over the meat just before I serve it. You wont be disappointed!
You also buy this cheese a whole foods markets.  I'm not a real cheese person, but this cheese is fantastic, very soft and very light.  It has a guota taste, so it is not overpowering, which I like.

column6: Big Acres Hot & Spicy Barbeque Sauce
column14:
Our entire family is crazy about this product. My children age
5 and 10 love the mild sauce. They put it on everything from hotdogs to vegetables. My husband and I use the hot and spicy sauce about 4 times a week. It is fantastic on all meat and poultry. We have stocked our shelves full of this wonderful barbeque sauce. We like it so much we even used it for my husband's 40th birthday party favors. Our theme was wild and crazy and we thought this hot barbeque sauce would be a hit with all of our friends.

column6: No Sugar Added Milk Chocolate with Cherry Bar - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates
column14: Ross chocolate bars are the best sugar-free chocolate bars I've tried.  I especially love the orange chocolate; they taste just like those round chocolate sugar-filled oranges (the kind you wack to break them apart.)

column6: No Sugar Added Milk Chocolate with Coconut Bar - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates
column14: Ross chocolate bars are the best sugar-free chocolate bars I've tried.  I especially love the orange chocolate; they taste just like those round chocolate sugar-filled oranges (the kind you wack to break them apart.)

column6: No Sugar Added Milk Chocolate with Orange Bar - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates
column14: Ross chocolate bars are the best sugar-free chocolate bars I've tried.  I especially love the orange chocolate; they taste just like those round chocolate sugar-filled oranges (the kind you wack to break them apart.)

Cranberry Fool did just that; fooled me! I was expecting the usual dull Thanksgiving side dish that never stands alone. This is much more. I have glazed it on ham, baked it on turkey, and best of all it is a wonderful appetizer with cheese. First,the usual way served on gourmet crackers. It is especially delightful toasted in the oven with a variety of cheeses on thin cut bread. The palate is sharpened, allowing a lighter but more satisfying meal for the calorie and carb conscious. It also serves wonderfully as a light but substantial snack with no sugar. Cranberry Fool is simply an all purpose delight!

column6: No Sugar Added Milk Chocolate with Raspberry Bar - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates
column14: Ross chocolate bars are the best sugar-free chocolate bars I've tried.  I especially love the orange chocolate; they taste just like those round chocolate sugar-filled oranges (the kind you wack to break them apart.)

column6: Switzerland Raw-Milk Raclette - Pound Cut (15.5 ounce)
column13: Hot Sizzling bubbly Raclette! !  Bubbly Bubbly..............
column14: Put in under a Reclette grill or just put it in your oven for 5-10 minutes.  Serve with boiled baby potaotes and cornichons.  You will be melted by the Raclette aroma and your melted velvelty bubbly Raclette.  Experience that you cannot forget!!!
I have baked with this organic vanilla in the past and realized that it is not a "pure" vanilla extract.  I found this product very misleading even though it's categorized has an organic product.

column6: Big Acres Sauces Ginger Teriyaki, Mild BBQ and Hot BBQ, Case Pack (6 bottles)
column14: This sauce will change the way you think about BBQ sauce! Once you try it, all the mass market sauces are a thing of the past. Kraft, smaft; Bullseye, smhullseye - these are you new best friends. The Rich & Mild is a fantastic sauce with a great blend of spices, dark molasses and honey. If you like a little heat (in the words of a famous TV chef "Kick it up a notch"), the Hot & Spicy is your sauce. The Chipotle peppers are roasted, so they are not too hot - juuuust enough to add a little heat to the mix. The Teriyaki is a great marinade for quick meals. Just marinade for a 1/2 hour to 1 hour and place on your local BBQ. I heat a few ounces and pour it over the meat when before I serve it. You won't be disappointed!

column6: No Sugar Added Milk Chocolate with Mint Bars - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates
column14: Ross chocolate bars are the best sugar-free chocolate bars I've tried.  I especially love the orange chocolate; they taste just like those round chocolate sugar-filled oranges (the kind you wack to break them apart.)

MY FRIEND got these for me for a belated birthday gift; I had never tried them before.
And I'm glad she bought them for me!
They're great.
A bit sweet at times, but very good, anyway.
Besides, don't you like a little something sweet once in a while?
I live in exile in Denver now - I couldn't survive without this bit of Miami !   This is the best.  I have a following at work - every Friday morning - cafe Cubano.

column6: Italian Parmigiano Reggiano Pre Cut (Approx 10 Ounces)
column14: This amazingly flavored cheese was at the top of my food triangle throughout childhood.  So bold, it speaks volumes of history and family life throughout the ages.  Virtually any dish can be sassed up with this wonder of creation.

column6: Big Acres Sauces Assorted Barbeque Gift Pack, Set of 3
column13: Hot and Spicy Sauce to die for
column14: I just love this sauce it has a really deep flavor without being too hot. The natural smoke of the Chipotle peppers is fantastic on grilled chicken. But my favorite is slow baked beef short ribs in this sauce - you will get raves from your family!

For those who don't know, BBQ truly means only one thing - pork, cooked real slow and flavored with a vinegar based sauce. Please, don't ever use the word barbeque for a gril or say you are having a barbeque when you are really just having a cookout. King's does a good job of representing Eastern North Carolina BBQ and they ship it fast. We live in Seattle now (2003) and have ordered from Kings our last two Fourth of July celebrations. The BBQ reheats well and impressed all the folks here in Seattle. Order several dozen hushpuppies and keep the toaster oven on to heat them up a few at a time. The only thing King's is really missing is the added flavor of real wood fire. Wilbur's in Goldsboro is still cooking their hogs out back in a pit with real wood. The pig tastes a bit better when it has been slow cooked in a smoky pit. Y'all be good now, ya hear!

column6: Bone Suckin' Hot Barbeque Sauce, 16 fl oz
column14: This sauce is excellent, and indeed spicy.  The brand also makes a mild version, in addition to other wonderful products like Rib Rub.  Made in North Carolina.  My husband doesn't like the sweeter type BBQ sauces - this brand he loves.

column13: On receiving a gift from My Brands, Inc.
column14: The recipiant of this gift will be very lucky with all it includes especially the Steap Sodas. This is a new beverage on the market and it is just delicious.

Very tasty! Big Acres Chipotle Peanut Sauce is not your average peanut sauce. It is thick (but still smooth) and flavorful, with small chunks of peanut and a nice chipotle-pepper kick! Great as a dipping sauce - think chicken tenders or grilled chicken on skewers, or even (don't tell anyone) chunks of bread. Buy the 6-pack because you'll want to use it on everything!
Added bonus: it's all natural, so you don't need a degree in chemistry to understand the ingredients list!

column6: Big Acres Rich & Mild BBQ Sauce
column13: Great right out of the bottle or as a base for your own idea
column14:
I like all the Big Acres sauces, but this one is special because it's great straight up, or spiced up as you prefer. Here in Texas we sometimes like fire coming out of our ears, but Big Acres is a lot more polite to their dinner guests. So if you are more rowdy than reserved, you might want to throw in some jalapeno on this one. Why not add some zip to their Hot @ Spicy sauce instead? Well, that'd be like gilding the lily, frankly. And I LOVE the maple syrup/dark molasses flavor of this one, with the zip of jalapeno added for "bite."
The best thing about using it straight is that it's not only a good marinade (three or four hours is great, overnight is Special), but you can also use it as a brush-on sauce during cooking. It doesn't overpower the flavor of your barbecue, whether fish, pork, chicken, or beef.
Big Acres' Web site has lots of recipes -- try those, too. You'll like 'em.

This is such a great hot sauce that we take a bottle with us when we travel. It comes in a compact, tough bottle that is just perfect.
So much better than Tabasco that it's hard to describe.

column13: A Must Have in your pantry!
column14:
This sauce is the quickest way to make a tasty dinner. Throw a couple of chicken breasts basted with the Teriyaki on the grill, cook up some rice and toss together a salad - easy breezy in under 30 minutes.
And the Teriyaki is just the tip of the iceburg when it comes to sauces. I highly recommend the Big Acres BBQ sauces as well as the Chipotle Peanut sauce.
I'm not sure I could pick a favorite among the 4 sauces, but I highly recommend them!

column13: Best BBQ sauce on the planet
column14:
Texans know their BBQ and who'd've thought it would take a California company to win my heart ... but, dang! this is great stuff. And now I don't have to fly out there to get it!
The teriyaki sauce is my favorite. I picked up a sample pack of all the Big Acres' flavors last year, and they're all good, but I am Stuck on the teriyaki. It is especially great with fish. I've never really liked any of my efforts at grilled fish before, but with Big Acres Teriyaki it's no problem at all to wow your dinner guests. It's also great just for dipping (warm it in the oven first). My favorite thing to do is jerked pork or beef, grilled in a cast-iron skillet, and served in a simmering quarter-cup of teriyaki. Stab 'em on toothpicks or party picks and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Yee-ha!
It's all natural, with zero preservatives -- but don't worry about how it "keeps" ... there won't be any left over!

column6: Zatarain's Black Eye Pea with Rice Mix
column14: This is an easy, and very versatile, sidedish that goes great with beef & chicken, and pork. I discovered this product when I lived in Georgia, and introduced it to my hubby. We loved it so much that we probably ate it at least once a week because it's easy to prep, inexpensive, and tasty. My favorite (and most simple recipe) for it is to brown some ground beef, cook the Hoppin' John as directed, and then fold in the beef. Instant main dish. In the winter we would take that simple dish, add two cups of Knorr beef boullion broth, and we had a hearty soup. Of course, the product is great simply as a side dish for pork chops, pork roast, baked or fried chicken... whatever! Since we moved to Nevada, we have not been able to locate this particular item among the Zatarain's offerings on the grocer's shelves. I am thrilled to know that it is now only a few clicks away from being in my pantry on a regular basis once again.

I bought this tea on a whim, WOW was I ever in for a treat.
I add fat-free half/half and my favorite sweetner then sit down and savor every last drop. I recently ran out and went all over town trying to replace it but no luck. Who would have thought that I could find it on Amazon.com, I guess it is my lucky night.

See's Candies is a well-known California chocolate company, now with stores and distribution throughout the United States. In California, the lines to buy chocolate can snake out the door. I've had See's Candies many times, most recently this assortment, and while See's makes an excellent product, the chocolate coating could be richer in flavor. Still, these confections are above average; they easily outclass ordinary brands such as Russell Stover and Whitman's with fresher and more flavorful fillings.
Anyone receiving a box of See's Candies for a gift knows that an extra effort has been made. Although they aren't the best I've had, they certainly rank up there with the finest chocolate assortments available in a box.

column6: Pop Rocks Strawberry Watermelon Combo [36CT Box]
column14: I haven't seen these as much lately as I did when I was younger, but they are still out there. I happened across them when I went to the video store to rent Van Wilder. Anywhoo...Pop Rocks are just a fun candy. As soon as you put them in your mouth, they start popping and tickling.

These caramels are simply splendid.  The touch of salt adds a nice richness and the texture is simply divine.  They're firm enough to be worth chewing, but not so dense that you need to worry about your fillings.

column13: A high quality chocolate for baking
column14:
When I worked in a French restaurant, Callebaut was the only chocolate allowed to be used in the kitchen. This Belgian chocolate adds much better flavor to baked goods and specialty desserts than does the average chocolate found in the grocery store. I highly recommend it for serious bakers and those who want their desserts to stand out.
Bittersweet chocolate is not to be confused with unsweetened; it is a dark chocolate without an overly sweet taste. Special occasion cakes and pastries often use bittersweet to give an intense chocolate flavor without overwhelming the palate.
A piquant, sweet, colorful treat.  Don't be put off by the Hot designation - no hotter than a pepperoncini.  Really great for adding a little color and sweetness to lots of dishes

Tea bricks make beautiful decorations with a link to the centuries old far east spice trade.  Still used as currency in some parts of the world, these bricks would last travelers for months as they shaved off a bit of tea into water over the campfire each day.  Extremely dense, they can actually be used to make tea, but most people keep them whole and enjoy the designs pressed into the tea.

A Japanese-American friend of mine introduced me to Pocky a couple of years ago, and I ate two full boxes at that first sitting. These Almond Crush Pocky are even better than the original chocolate, in my opinion.
For anyone unfamiliar with Pocky, they're basically sweet "bread" sticks dipped in chocolate or other flavor icings. It doesn't sound nearly as good as it tastes, though. They aren't overly sweet, but they give you a wonderful feeling of decadence. The Almond Crush Pocky has a light coffee flavor to the icing, and it has -- you guessed it -- crunchy bits of almond mixed into the icing. The combination of textures is very satisfying. Try these with tea in the afternoon, alone as a light dessert, with ice cream, or just as a not-so-very-bad-for-you snack. Enjoy!

From the first tiime I tasted them while visiting my daughter who was then living in San Francisco, I have absolutely insisted on having See's Candies--they are the best of the best!  See's became an instant holiday tradition...for gifts for family, friends, co-workers.  And especially, See's Candies for having to indulge in at home.  This is one of my favorite items.

..In my dreams!
I've used it in Vietnam and it's great! But be sure to get some *vietnamese coffee* and *condensed milk* to get the real flavour :)
If I could just find a shop that would be able to send it all the way to Finland, I'd be very happy :)

column6: Aunt Lizzie's Zero Carb Cheese Straw Bites - 20 oz Tin
column14: As an avid follower of the Atkins low-carb lifestyle, I am continuously searching for the perfect snack that I can enjoy as much as I want without straying from the diet guidelines.  Thank you Aunt Lizzie's for producing such a delicious high quality zero-carb snack.  I can't get enough of these!

Forget that store bought jerky.  Make your own premium jerky with American Spice's Hot Beef Jerky Blend.  Regular so called "hot" mixes just don't stand up this product...If I could give it six stars, I would.

column6: Sambal Oelek - Ground Fresh Chili Paste
column14: I was introduced to Chili Paste a little over 10 years ago.  This stuff is great to add to any dish you want to spice up quickly.  It takes just a little bit to get things heated up.

To really enjoy this cheese you should have a Girolle. This is a board with a rotating slicer blade that you turn. This results in beautiful flower petal shaped slices that are ideal for getting the most from the cheese. Search for "Girolle" as they are not in stock at the moment I can't offer a number. There is a combination available from another vendor "B0000DK4XT"
As to the cheese it is really special. At first scent it is a bit intimidating but let it come up to temperature and you will have something wonderful. Most likely you will only use half of this in one setting unless you have a lot of company. Terrific setup for parties.

column6: Dentyne Ice Sugarless Gum, Peppermint - 12x4 = 48 Packs
column14: A tennis player hubby of mine got this pack on the rack of his opel corsa and casually,I started cherishing the peppermint flavour. It's gotta lasting refreshing flavour but the best part is, its real mouth freshner and above all, keeps my teeth so whiter and feels good chewing for a long time. Normally, Indians prefer 'mukhwas-masalas' after lunch or dinner but I prefer the chewing gum as it refreshes the taste buds. Good pick.

column6: Caroliva "Premium" 100% Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 750 ml bottle
column14: Of all of the olive oils I tasted in gourmet retailers and travelling around Spain, Italy, and France, this is my favorite.  They use a blend of 3 olives and it is so fruity and fresh tasting without the throat burn of Italian oils. I saw that their gift box won an award at Fancy Food Show which has their sherry and balsamic vinegars.  The Caroliva balsamic is amazing too, 18 years aged and from Spain!?

Leyden cheese is one of Holland's main cheeses. It has a delicious characteristic flavor which comes from Cumin seeds. This cheese is spiced with Caraway seeds, a completely different flavor. This is not genuine Leyden cheese.   If you really want genuine Leyden,purchase the Farmhouse Leyden or regular Leyden through Igourmet.

column6: No Sugar Added Dark Chocolate Bars - Low Carb Chocolate From Ross Chocolates
column13: I've tried them all - But WOW!
column14: I was looking for some chocolate that I could enjoy on the Atkins diet since I'm a chocoholic. My one weakness on the diet, "the weakness" that time and time again almost made me blow the diet was my intense desire for chocloate. So I began my quest. I had tried so many brands that I was about to give up. All of them either tasted waxy, or just plain weird and chemically. Then I bought a sampler pack of these baby's. When it arrived the first one I tried was the "Almond" bar, and with my first bite my mouth exploded in pure delight, and my eyes opened as wide as saucers! I was so excited that I ran to my buddy who was also on the diet and gave him one of the bars too -- now he's totally hooked as well. They are worth EVERY single penny - I promise!

column6: O & H Danish Kringles, Set of Two, Pecan and Raspberry flavors
column14: Our family has been giving and recieving Kringle for many years. It is one of our Danish tradtions. Having had family living in Racine, Wisconsin we know first hand that O&H is the best.

Thai tea is a wonderful exotic drink with deep flavors and vibrant overtones. Almost a dessert, but can quickly cool your month down after fiery Thai entrees. Pacificrim-gourmet also offers another brand of thai tea which is less expensive and yields more tea per package and some argue is more authentic.  Both are very good.  Ordering the products are easy and delivery was quick, and not as expensive as some other on-line vendors.

column6: Sweet Mele's Hawaiian Waterfall Caffe Water (Caffeinated), Case Of 12
column14: This water is really fantastic.  Hawaii, supposedly, has the best water in the USA, and the water is really great tasting. You don't really taste the caffeine at all, but watch out, if you drink it too close to bedtime you'll be up for awhile. It similar to a cup of coffee in caffeine content.
Richer taste but not overpowering. Great with crackers.
The flavor is outstanding for that great hot sauce taste on any tacos, beef, eggs at breakfast, you name it. Enjoy!
These lollipops are amazing. If you love watermelon, you will have one after another. Enjoy!

When chatchi's favorite afternoon treat became mysteriously unavailable in the vending machine at work, chatchi panicked. How would chatchi get through the work day without his Chuckles -- the delicious, fat-free candy that provides you with the sweet-filled enjoyment you earn every day.

Fortunately, Amazon carries this delicious, chewy, fruity candy, and chatchi can get back to doing his job.

chatchi's only complaint about Chuckles is the black licorice flavor. chatchi normally likes black licorice, but this flavor is so overpowering, chatchi needs to eat it last, so as not to ruin the remaining cherry, orange, lemon and lime flavors.

chatchi loves Chuckles.

Pierre Robert is similar to Brie but with a smoother, creamier taste. The best way to enjoy it is on toast points with slices of strawberry, the tang and sweetness of the berries accenting and enhancing the cheese's saltiness. You may think that the price is a little high, but I can assure you that you'll be more than satisfied with a wheel of Pierre Robert on your party table -- or just enjoy it yourself and drown in decadence.

column13: Truly the best cheese I have ever had
column14: My husband and I attended a wine tasting at a local restaurant.  This cheese was paired with a 2002 Maculan Pino & Toi.  The combination was heaven, but the cheese could have very well stood on its own.  I recommend it highly.  You will not be disappointed.

column13: Forget the coffee, give me Tea! (red that is)
column14:
Well I won't completely give up my morning coffee for tea, but I am now officially hooked on this red tea. I have tried six of the flavors and cannot decide which I like best!
It is by far the best tea I have ever had and is making a tea drinker out of me.

column6: igourmet Maytag Blue - Pound Cut (15.5 ounce)
column14: This is awesome cheese. And for me and a few of my friends who suffer migraines and have trouble with blue cheese, are able to eat this. I first heard on Emeril Live that this cheese is different than other blue cheeses. And he is right, whenever I can find and afford it, I have been able to enjoy it without pain. I hope you enjoy it as well.

column6: Arriba Salsa & Cheese Dip Set: Two Salsas and One Cheese Dip
column14: I have bee an affectionado of salsas for a number of years.  This includes a lot of experimentation in making my own and attending salsa festivals here in Texas.  There is something special about the Ariba salsa that is special.  I don't know what these guys to beyond fire roasting many of their ingredients, but the taste is fabulous and different. I recently served the fire roasted garlic and black bean dips to some salsa-jade guests, and they all wanted to know what it was and wear I got it. I am not a big fan of cheese dips, but adding chipotle to it makes it very interesting.  If you like salsa, Arriba is at the top of the top tier.

I like Tillamook cheese quite a bit, but this photo scares me. Did they just pick it off the grocery shelf, take it home for a photo shoot, and then put it in their fridge until someone orders it online?

column6: Molcajete Mortar and Pestle Lava Rock From Mexico
column14: This lava molecajete is very authentic and is not only a fine kitchen tool but a piece of handcrafted art from Mexico.  Ordering was very easy and delivery was exactly as described with my product being shipped the same day I ordered it

Thank god I found a coffee company that roasts great coffee and is socially responsible.  So many of the gourmet coffee roasters over roast and even burn their beans.  Fairwinds has hit the jackpot.  I am no longer brain washed to drink poor, overpriced coffee that many of the nation's larger coffee makers supply.

Excellent wafer cookie with vibrant fruit flavor.  Open them and pass them around to friends at work or serve them after a Japanes dinner for that extra special touch. They are great placed in sorbet or fresh fruit

Thank god I found a coffee company that roasts great coffee and is socially responsible.  So many of the gourmet coffee roasters over roast and even burn their beans.  Fairwinds has hit the jackpot.  I am no longer brain washed to drink poor, overpriced coffee that many of the nation's larger coffee makers supply.

column6: Tortuga Chocolate Rum Cake, 16 Ounce Cake
column14:
I was pleased to see the acceptable price of the rum cake. I was disappointed by the fact that the Tortuga Cake does not have the expected rich flavor. It seems that the manufacturer saved some money by using less rum as an ingredient.
The other issue arises with the dryness of the cake. My recommendation would be to have a full glass of water for every bite you take. I have had a better rum cakes before.

I ordered this product on Tuesday afternoon, and it arrived on Friday afternoon, the perfect temperature for eating right then and there! Inside the box were 12 mini cheesecakes--2 each of: Classic New York Cheesecake, Chocolate Swirl, Classic Ney York with Chocolate Topping, Cranberry-Orange, Mango Chai, and Pumpkin-Fudge Swirl. Each one was delicious! The texture was thick and creamy, and each flavor was unique and wonderful. I would definitely order them again. They're perfect for a party. A whole mini cheesecake per person might be a bit much--they are very rich. They are great to share. At the office, I cut each into quarters and everyone took one or two of their favorite flavors. It was a hit!

column6: igourmet Kerrygold Dubliner - Pound Cut (15.5 ounce)
column13: A Cheese the Whole Family Likes...
column14: The description of a cross between cheddar and parmesan is completely accurate.  It's good grated on top of hot foods, in sandwiches, or just sliced for snacking.  YUM!

column13: Just the right amount of outside crunch and inside chewy!
column14:
These combine the best of all jelly bean worlds. The outside has a nice initial crunch and the inside has a clear, chewy taste of whatever is the flavor. I like some quite a bit... the watermelon, pink lemonade, cherry, lime, bubble gum and root beer are favorites for me. Some miss a bit for me...the buttered popcorn comes to mind, for example. I'm not all that fond of the chocolate either but...
With so many flavors to choose from...49 I understand (only jalapano was left out which i actually like quite a bit)there is really something for everyone with this assortment.
These beans are really quite small compared to the drug store variety. And light years better. With these you can eat one and taste what it really is supposed to be... if its green, is it lime? or watermelon? or something else entirely...you WILL be able to tell when you taste it! I think that is the fun of these... You arent going to want to throw in a handful of these like you might be tempted to with the cheaper beans...with those you throw a handful in your mouth and just taste...well...*sweet*. with these if you throw in a handful you will get a riot of different flavors!
Savor these...enjoy these...eat them one at a time. And they are fat free!

column13: A lot like a juice spritzer...
column14:
I have been drinking this brand for many years, as this isn't a new product. It is much loved among many and I can buy it in my area grocery store.
It's different from mass produced soda in that it isn't all that sweet as much as it is quite refreshing. It is excellent iced cold and I prefer it without ice as it has a light flavor. The texture is more like that of a juice and sparkling water than that of a commerically produced soda. There are no artificial tastes with this product.
The flavor is more on the tart side of the orange spectrum with the hint of tangerine for pizazz... It really is a very good alternative to wine spritzers on hot summer days.

Fresh limes are underappreciated, but a joy to have in the kitchen. A few squirts of lime juice into water makes a wonderful and healthy alternative to carbonated beverages (and without sugar!).
Additionally, they're essential for doing salsa right.
1/4 C Lime juice (from 4 limes)
10 small tomatillos, husks removed and washed (ASIN B0000TL6DG)
2-3 Chipotles, seeds removed (ASIN B0000EIDSR)
1 C cilantro, roughly chopped
8 small Tomatoes
1 small onion (optional)
Salt to taste
Cook tomatillos, tomatoes and onion: place on cookie sheet and broil at 500 degrees. The tomatoes will come out in about 10 minutes, the tomatillos and onion 15-20 minutes. Let cool, then puree the tomatillos in a blender with the lime juice, boullion garlic and the chipotles. Add half the cilantro, and whirl just a little bit. Add remaining ingredients. Let stand for about 30 minutes then serve at room temperature.

column6: See's Candies 1 lb. Almond Royal(r) by See's Candies
column14:
See's Almond Royals are amazing. I would highly recommend them, especially if you like turtles -> the Royals are sort of like a nice twist to them, caramel chocolate and dutch cocoa covering crunchy almonds. Yum!...
The Almond Royals come individually wrapped (very nice touch) in a tin that you can store in a cool place. They keep for a really long time and are the perfect treat after a meal or when you have a candy bar craving.

Shin Ramyun ("ramen" or "instant noodles") is the most popular brand of ramen in Korea - they sell them everywhere, including 7-Elevens and little hole-in-the-wall restaurants where a nice little old lady will boil it for you with an egg and sliced vegetables and serve it with kimchi and pickled radish.
Like all instant noodles, it is very easy to prepare - all you have to do is boil some water and then add the noodles and soup base (all included in the packet) and boil it for appx. three minutes. The noodles are thicker than most ramen noodles (somewhere in between traditional ramen and udon noodles) and have more substance. The soup base is salty and very spicy - keep in mind that the less water you add, the spicier it gets.
It is very delicious alone or with some added goodies like an egg (crack it in with the soup base when the water is boiling), sliced ham and veggies.
Just make sure you have a large cup of cold water nearby, since the noodles will be both spicy and hot.

column6: Bowl Noodle Soup - Hot and Spicy
column14:
"Bowl noodle soup" is instant noodles (ramen) that come in a styrofoam bowl (kind of like the cup-o-noodles that are sold in grocery stores). It stores easily and super-convenient to prepare. All you have to do is add a cup of hot water (or put it all in the microwave for a minute with some cold water) and wait a few minutes for the noodles and reconstituted vegetables to cook up.
This particular brand is supposed to be spicy, especially since it is kimchi-flavored. For those not familiar with Korean food, kimchi is the spicy pickled cabbage that is an absolute staple on the Korean peninsula.
I'm not sure how this particular item made it onto the gourmet list (perhaps simply because it's foreign?). Nevertheless, it's a decent meal when you have nothing else in the house and don't feel like cooking. The spicy soup also feels really great when you have a hangover. For these two reasons, they are especially popular with college guys - I remember that back in college, some of my male friends would have a whole box of it stored under their beds...
Anyway, if you like noodles and also like spicy-hot dishes, I think it's definitely worth trying.

column6: TZO149899 - Tazo Tea Bags Earl Grey
column14:
I really like Tazo's Earl Grey tea because it is highly fragrant without being overly bitter - an experience I have had with too many Early Greys.
Plus, the tea bags come in a nice box so it is easy to take one bag out at a time and enjoy (without making a mess!). I'd also like to note that the boxes are stackable, if you have more than one type of Tazo tea.
So grab a tea bag and let it steep in your favorite mug for three or four minutes. Take a deep breath and enjoy the earthy fragrant goodness of the Earl Grey. Take a sip, close your eyes, and savor this little scrap of peace before facing the rest of your day...

column6: Big Acres Sauces Ginger Teriyaki, Mild BBQ and Hot BBQ Gift Pack, Set of 3
column13: Big Acres Transforms Healthy into Delicious!
column14: Big Acres barbeque sauce is my family's favorite.  I love Rich & Mild; my husband craves Hot & Spicy; our son devours Teriyaki. Friday night is barbeque night, usually chicken or fish, but always BIG ACRES. Try Big Acres fish tacos; they're are mouth-watering! Big Acres sauces make a healthy meal into a delicious meal! YUM!

column13: Sort of like instant Korean spaghetti...
column14:
This is quite different from most instant noodles out there - you get noodles with a nice sauce instead of a soup. And it's not spicy.
Chapaghetti is the instant version of "chajangmyun," which is noodles in a brown sauce made of soybeans (like the brown sauce you get at some Chinese restaurants).
Inside the packet, you get the noodles, instant vegetables (freeze-dried carrots and peas), powdered sauce, and some olive oil. You have to first boil the noodles, and then drain some of the water before you add the packets of veggies, sauce, and oil and boil the water down into the Chapaghetti sauce
It's a great instant meal but I've found that you have to try it a few times before you get the sauce thickness to your liking (not enough water and it's too dry; too much and it's too watery).

column6: The Extraordinary Artisan Handcrafted Organic Coffees of Aloha Island
column14:
If you've never tried Kona coffee, Aloha Island is definitely the one to start with.
Kona coffee is grown in the Kona district of the Big Island and regarded by some to be the best coffee in the world. I'm not a coffee aficionado by any means, but you can taste the difference with Kona coffee - it's full and rich and almost mocha-ish. I always reserve Kona for lazy weekend brunches or to serve with dessert after a lovely dinner.
Aloha Island operates the only quality management program in Kona, so their coffees are certified as 100% Kona. Which just means that you're guaranteed to get quality Kona coffee if you order from them.
Keep in mind that Aloha Island has three grades of Kona coffee that they sell - gold, platinum, and diamond (which is supposed to be their private reserve). Obviously, it gets more expensive as you go up the ladder. The gold is very good and a great place to start sampling their fare.

column6: igourmet Kerrygold Dubliner - Pound Cut (15.5 ounce)
column14: This is a wonderful tasting cheese and at a great price (...)

column6: Aunt Lizzie's Zero Carb Cheese Straw Bites - 20 oz Tin
column13: My mouth is watering as I write this
column14: If you're doing a low-carb diet or looking for snack foods that won't trigger a glycemic reaction, try these amazing cheese snacks.  They are very delicate and pastry-like, crumbling in your mouth. Very savory -- no sweetness. Aunt Lizzie is on to something, and these are a no-compromise low-carb snack.

column6: Melissa's Fresh Young Coconuts, Set of 3
column14: Melissa's sweet young coconuts are juicy and delicious. I would not go anywhere else for coconuts. Melissa's got the best!!!
This sausage is delicious - a little sweet, from the apples, but very low carb.

Prepare to Enjoy!  See's Victorian Toffee is an excellent buttery candy with a great chocolate and nut coating.  It comes in large chunks - so you can break off a piece just the right size for you.  After you have enjoyed the main pieces, the small bits left over make a great ice cream topping!

Chipotle makes everything taste better.  I first encountered this sauce at a small restaurant in New Mexico and it instantly made everything spicy and smoky. Each bar is 240 Calories and is delicious for breakfast with a cup of tea. I eat a Clif Bar almost every morning and never really feel overly hungry during the day. I eat because I'm supposed to be fuelling my metabolism, but otherwise, rarely get hungry in the middle of a workout.

Gary (The Owner of Cliff Bar Inc.) seems to have also found out that \\"other\\" energy bars were not really that tasty. After his \\"epiphany,\\" he spent lots of time in his Mom's kitchen working on making cliff bars. What a guy! I was at the point where I was trying to make my own granola bars, but after discovering these bars, I'm hooked. They are portable, delicious and basically, I love all the flavors. You can take them biking, hiking, walking, anywhere.

This bar is especially delicious and I seem to fall in love with it again each October. Must be the spices and the creamy white chocolate chips. There are just enough chocolate chips to remind you of cream cheese icing. If I had to choose between a piece of carrot cake and one of these bars, the bar would win.

Also look for the Cranberry Apple Cherry Bars, which are another favorite!

I read a lot of news magazines and financial publications but the Economist is my favorite by far. This magazine, which originated in England, mixes together eye- catching economic statistics, important world news, and volatile political situations into one complete magazine.
Unlike other news magazines, The Economist is very thorough and very analytical. Instead of just rambling on about an issue and talking in superficial ways, the Economist presents the hard facts. And to help readers get a better understanding, many of these facts are backed up with graphs, tables, and charts throughout the magazine. Since I am interested in the subject of economics and I have studied it extensively in school, I particularly like these graphics and tables. They really help to drive the point home.
There's only one bad aspect I can think of with this magazine: the high price. The cover price is $4.95 and a subscription for a year costs more than $100. This is more than double the price of other news magazines, and the cost alone will likely deter many potential readers from giving this magazine a look. I think is's worth the extra cost to get something that's higher in quality, but others will disagree.
The Economist, in a nutshell, is a very serious, very intelligent magazine intended for those who want a little more substance and who prefer reading the facts. It's an informative read; educating and fascinating in its coverage of world leaders, world events, and economic changes on a global scale.

column6: Starbucks Espresso Roast Dark Roast Ground Coffee, 12-Ounce Bag
column13: Not actually for use in espresso machines
column14:
Few things I'd like to point out:
1. "Espresso" is not a roast. It's a drink. In northern Italy they make espresso from Vienna roast, in southern Italy they use French. Starbucks appears to be using French roast, so they should just label it French roast like any normal person would.
2. The product description says "Taste Espresso Roast as both a shot of espresso and brewed in a coffee press. This is one versatile coffee!" This is patently absurd. It's pre-ground coffee, and it's either for use in espresso machines or presses, but not both. Here's why:
Making a shot of espresso requires a very fine grind. Making coffee press coffee requires a very course grind. If you have ground coffee that is appropriate for espresso machines, it will pass through the filter in a coffee press and you will have a cup of sludge. If you use ground coffee that does not pass through a press's filter in an espresso machine, you do not get espresso. You get cafe crema, which is a good, but entirely different, beverage.
Therefore, a "Universal Grind" is an impossibility. They should tell you on the label what kind of coffee maker it's ground for, like normal people.
3. It's over-roasted. Starbucks has an excellent bean-sourcing operation that buys better coffee than any other company of its size. Then they roast all their beans Vienna or French. Most beans taste best at a particular level of roasting that varies with the bean, and for most beans that level is not Vienna or French. So why roast all your beans too dark? I guess it's just easier that way. Also, it lets them rename Vienna Roast as "Starbucks Roast" because the Austrians don't seem to care.
That said, this is still better than what you get in the supermarket - Starbucks specializes in coffee and sources much better beans than any of the companies that also make cheese, hot dogs, shampoo or cigarettes.
Anyway, if you really want somegood coffee, do this:
Buy a grinder. Nothing makes coffee lose flavor like keeping it around after grinding. If you have a drip coffee machine, get a grinder with spinning blades; if you have something else like a press or vacuum pot, get a grinder with burrs. If you have an espresso machine, get a very nice grinder with burrs. Amazon has good deals on all three kinds, just do a search for 'coffee grinder'. It's not that much money, and if you're somebody who's willing to pay for Starbucks you should invest in one.
Find a local coffee shop that roasts their own coffee and gives you the date it's roasted on. Freshness matters! Good beans don't taste nearly as good after they've been sitting around.
Ask the people at your local shop to tell you about the correct amount of beans to use. Most people don't use the right amount. If you don't use enough, your coffee comes out bitter, especially if you have a drip machine. Not enough coffee means the beans you do have get too much exposure to hot water, which makes bitter coffee.

column13: The Most Comprehensive and Well-Informing Magazine on Earth
column14:
The Economist magazine is the authoritarive source of news and information from all over the world, from politics to business. In a single magazine, some 35 or 40 countries may be reviewed, with intriguing insights, commentary, and analysis that provokes, insights, and sometimes creates heated debate.
I'll admit that sometimes I am surprised by the opinion pieces that The Economist magazine publishes. For instance, The Economist magazine takes the editorial position that makes it one of the most popular libertarian journals around -- they support free-markets, but yet they appear skeptical of President Bush's tax cuts that make our economy even more free.
All the articles are unsigned. I once asked my professor why this is. Amazingly, she had no answer. So I did research on this topic and I learned that the main reason is that The Economist thinks of itself as an organization, where each member sees to it that the organization succeeds. Thus, some articles have multiple people assisting in the writing and editing. And that solves the big secret -- how are the articles constructed by this special force known as "anonymous."
My favorite section is Lexington, which The Economist magazine uses to highlight the person of the week they wish to focus on. Now, if you read Time or Newsweek to learn about a specific person, you often will learn very superficial information about them. But with The Economist, the information provides scintillating facts and analysis. Often the article will present both sides to information relating to the person with equal vigor, but at the end will issue The Economist's true position. A remarkable magazine and well worth the money.

The Economist describes itself as \\"a Friday viewspaper, where the readers, with higher than average incomes, better than average minds but with less than average time, can test their opinions against ours. We try to tell the world about the world, to persuade the expert and reach the amateur, with an injection of opinion and argument.\\"
The Economist is written in lively, concise, and often humorous language; it discusses international politics, business, finance, science and technology, and has book reviews and an obituary. Alone, the breadth of topics it covers (and the brevity in which it does so) is enough to set it apart from other newspapers.
But The Economist stands out because it refuses to conform to the standards of the industry: it is anonymous (\\"The main reason for anonymity ... is a belief that what is written is more important than who writes it.\\"); it manages to surprise even its dedicated readers; and, it is factual, opinionated and appeals to the highest common denominator, tackling complex and controversial topics.
In the end, though, The Economist has a different selling point: newspapers live by the \\"if it bleeds, it leads\\" rule; The Economist, however, emphasizes the ways in which our lives are becoming better and suggests ways to improve them further. It is this injection of well grounded idealism, rather than an exposure to tragedy, that makes The Economist unique and a pleasure to read.

column13: The best journalism in the English language
column14: I've read \\"The Economist\\" on & off for at least 25 years, since my early teens, when I used to snag my father's copies. At my British high school, it was offered at a discounted rate, presumably because it was (rightly) considered such a valuable educational tool. My understanding of current events has been shaped more by \\"The Economist\\" than any other media source -- the newspaper (as it calls itself) is an education. It does what the best journalism should: educates, informs, entertains, provokes. ... The newspaper has a point of view when discussing ideas. Americans (often told that journalists are unbiased) may find this unfamiliar. In my opinion, the British media (\\"The Economist\\" is British) is more honest than the media in the U.S. in that there is no pretense that journalists lack all personal biases. Readers understand that reporters have clear biases reflected in their stories, & they are able to make up their own minds. This seems fundamentally more honest, easier all round & simpler than the fiction of pure objectivity, which the older I get increasingly seems to me humanly impossible. ... \\"The Economist,\\" however, isn't wedded to political parties. It's quite capable of soundly trashing Republicans & praising Democrats & vice versa, issue to issue. ... That most of the copy is written anonymously has always seemed to me a huge advantage, if hard on reporters' egos. The result is the feeling of reading a newspaper with its own point of view, something so tightly edited it feels like it might all have been written by one person, if one person could cover so much. This is a strength, because it gives the newspaper a distinctive style. ... The writing is outstanding. The reporting is outstanding. The breadth is outstanding. ... Among all the noise out there, I really only need one news source to be well-informed on the most important news, and that's \\"The Economist.\\" Great value for money. You cannot go wrong subscribing and, more importantly, reading. ... And, to the newspaper's credit, its quality & consistency has remained unchanged for the 25 years I've been reading it.And, to the newspaper's credit, its quality & consistency has remained unchanged for the 25 years I've been reading it.

column13: A must-read for anyone who wants to be in the know
column14:
The Economist is an absolutely unique newssource. They have reporters based in countries around the world who report on economics, politics, culture, society, and everything else. They offer a perspective on international news not easily available in the American press. This is the only readily available source where you can read about usually-ignored countries, from Uganda to Tahiti. It provides opinion pieces too (i.e. Lexington), which are wonderfully written and erudite. All articles are written anonymously by field reporters, putting the focus on the reporting and not the personality.
The Economist does assume you know something about the issues, as most of the articles are short and don't provide much background. But as you continue to read issue after issue, it becomes easier to keep up. It is a dense magazine, and not one to be flipped through, like Time or Newsweek; it instead requires time and effort, but rewards with depth and breadth of knowledge.
The Economist does have an agenda: it promotes free-trade and democracy (the libertarian form). It supported George W. Bush in 2000. However, as a voting Democrat, I can still attest that is refreshing to read a magazine that is not afraid to have an opinion, whether you agree with it or not.
Summary: Bar-none, the best and smartest newsmagazine available.
